name: Kimberly Graham
text: If you buy a vehicle from one of Jack Ingram’s many dealerships, do not set your hopes up to have it repaired at Jack Ingram’s body shop. You would think a body shop would have a sufficient flash light to assess and take pictures of scratches and other damage. Not the case here. Bring your own flash light. And it seems as if Casey doesn’t want to be bothered by what he considers to be “minor” jobs that have to be filed through insurance. Maybe you will get a better experience if you pay out of pocket.

text: It took 3 months to repair the part mainly delayed in part preparation and i did contact to check in the status most of times. It was good to communicate in person with staff and it was quick to replace when part was ready.

text: This is second vehicle repaired by Jack Ingram and both times it was excellently done.

name: CryptoOver9k
text:
Hello, It is with great pleasure for me to sit down and write a review of the repair work Jack ingram Body Shop performed.

Their process is laser focused and the quality of the body work was pristine. I’d like to thank Mr. Casey and his Body Work team for ordering all the OEM Parts. To also include the great attitude and energy he demonstrated.

Mr. Casey is Punctual, he got my parts ordered, painted and installed in 2 days. That too me is professionalism at its finest.

Overall Assessment: Highly Recommend this Group of professionals!

name: Vicki Hines
text: I dropped my car off around April 3rd for repairs and it has been nearly 30 full days and my vehicle has not been fixed. The guy I'm dealing with is hardly in and when I drop in, he's blaming the delay on the insurance company/appraiser. The insurance company says that the dealership can determine if damage has been done and paint the hood of my suv which is clearly evident. This is all unacceptable, unprofessional and simple laziness. I only came to Jack Ingram because in the past, the reputation was one of quality and treating customers fair but when you hire and have people who don't care about the business or the customer, that's what you get. Once I get my vehicle back, I will NEVER visit Jack  Ingram business again. I'd rather travel to Atlanta where I know the customer services and employees care about the customer and work they do and work is done with quality and in a timely manner.

name: Simply Alluring
text: DO NOT TAKE YOUR CAR HERE!!! My mother took her car in to change a tire. They couldn’t get the tire sensor light to go off and asked her to leave it overnight. When she went to pick her car up she was told they couldn’t show her that the sensor issue had been fixed because “it took (the guy) a long time to read how to get the light off and (he) didn’t feel like doing all of that again.” She went up the street to shop and when she opened her trunk 4 cases of sodas and 2 cooler bags were missing. She called several times and was told they’d review the cameras and call her back...that was 3 days ago. Shop with them at your own risk!

name: Rich C
text: I was met by Regina, a sweet young lady behind the counter, and i told her what i needed. She and i walked to my truck to see what the exact size tire i needed. I told her to set me up with her recommendations and i handed her the keys and they immediately started the process of mounting my tires. Everyone was awesome,  very polite and made me feel right at home. Thanks to the whole crew there for the prompt attention and new shoes for my truck! I definitely recommend these guys!

name: Donald Fields
text: Listen.......don’t take your car to any of T Walker Enterprise places. It’s sad how that man handles people. His reputation is not the best and it’s sad when you explain a problem you’ve had and everyone that hasn’t dealt with the owner has a NASTY taste about him. Take your car elsewhere. Many of the places will lie, but to the extreme HE WONT HELP FIX THEIR MESS UP. Don’t settle. Keep all your receipts and make sure that you document EVERY MOVE! Ive had THE WORST EXPERIENCE. Goodyear should be ASHAMED to have him under their franchise. My girlfriend and I are just so frustrated.

Gluing a water pump, cutting wires and giving my car back without telling me and having professionals to find the damage was one thing, but the way Thomas Walker has handle me after going for years lets me know that the value of a loyal customer is nothing.  Be careful please. Im willing to expound to anyone who would like more on my situation in hopes that you all avoid this. Please be careful!!!

text: I have been in the body shop repair business for over 30 years so I consider myself to have a better eye for quality than most people.The reason I picked this shop to do my repairs was because of Joel Allen he and did some PDR repair for me and the quality of the repair was second to none!! My review starts off with my estimate with my estimate. Gary Wrote an outstanding estimate! With Gary you not only get someone that is very knowledgeable on cars but you get someone that can actually do the repairs that he writes that is very rare! Now the Repair.They actually finish the repair sooner then they had previously estimated I was amazed most shops are always behind on their estimated time of completion. The quality of the repair was better than I expected!! they did stuff beyond what was written on the estimate and the quality was even better than I expected from Joel. Me being a painter myself I can recognize a quality paint job and I will have to say Jason put one of the best paint jobs that I have seen in the state of Alabama he is truly One of the best painters in the state!!

name: linda wolfe
text: High price. Wouldn't give written estimate

name: Ashley Granger
text: Nice paint jobs

name: Elizabeth Bass
text: Good Honest People

name: Clifton Forrest
text: Just okay.

name: Stephen
text: They took over a month to damage things that were not damaged when I took it in and never contacted about any progress.  If you like good service go someplace else.  This was by far the worse experience I have ever had for any kind of repair.

name: Chloe Bryant
text: Only use this place if you don’t need your car back anytime soon. When I scheduled my repair I was told it could take a while for parts to be received. Since my car was driveable, I asked them not to begin work until the parts needed were in hand. At drop off, the front desk staff told me there had been “no problem” getting the needed parts. The repair estimate was 5-7 days. They have had my car for a month and repeatedly tell me they are waiting for a part to be delivered. Worse, they tell me they did not know the part in question was needed initially- they missed that a strut needed replacing and this was only identified when they had “completed” their repair and sent my car to a separate tire shop for alignment. The tire shop pointed out the need to replace the strut. And since others have been accused of leaving “false” reviews, yes my insurance is under another name: Carlton.

resp.text: Preordering parts for drivable repairs is a standard operating procedure for Joe Hudson’s Collision Center. However, we only order parts that we can physically see are damaged. This is a requirement by all insurance carriers and is the right thing to do. Sometimes it is impossible to see if there are additional damaged parts, such as a strut, until an alignment is performed. Backordered parts are something that has impacted the collision industry as a whole over the past year or so; ultimately causing delays that have negative impacts on both the customer, the insurance carrier, and the repair facility.

name: Jennifer Washington
text: They do excellent work! My car was damaged at the front end and now it looks like a brand new 🚗 car. So, 😊 happy with the repairs! I just hate they don't have a payment plan cause my deductible is $1,000. Which I don't have that all at once.

name: Justin Rivers
text: If it were possible to leave these guys zero stars that’s what I would do. The worst customer service on the planet and the manager is spineless. Work wasn’t done completely and didn’t offer a solution to resolve the issue. I will never use this company again and can’t recommend enough for anyone reading this post to NOT use this company. If you want quality service and customer service go somewhere else.

resp.text: It has always been our standard operating procedure to adhere to the insurance regulations and guidelines. Sometimes following the rules does not produce the desired outcome for all parties involved.

name: Johanna Wells
text: Sadly, my experience getting my car repaired at this Joe Hudson after hitting a deer was one of the worst not just automotive repair experiences I've ever had, but one of the worst customer service experiences ever. They had my brand new car for over 3 months and returned it with fenders and hood totally misaligned and the check engine light still on. Promising to right the wrongs, they cashed the insurance check and 4 months later, I still have received zero follow through or even a phone call and they still have a set of my keys. If I could give them zero stars I would. Highly do not recommend.

resp.text: We have searched our system and cannot find any information on a customer by the name of Johanna Wells. Did you use a different name when you did business with us. We would like to resolve an issues you may have had. Please feel free to contact me at joehudsoncollision@gmail.com.

name: Kyle Manning
text:
Keep your autos away from these amateurs. Below average auto knowledge; poor customer service.

They made mistakes (ordered the wrong parts, installed parts in the incorrect order then had to re-install parts) that professionals do not make. On top of this, they did not communicate that they had made mistakes which extended the amount of time required to repair my car.

name: Ken Westbrook
text: My car went in to for repair to rear bumper on 3/5/21. Initial repair was complete on 3/19. Was very satisfied with work done at pickup, so I recieved car. I noticed rear camera was not working upon arrival at work and immediately called to inform them. I returned to facility 3/22 for assessment. Told car would have to go to dealer as issue was with camera itself and not due to repairs. I then had to obtain another rental, paid for by insurance, and returned car on 3/26. The Chevrolet dealer across the street from facility in Opelika, would not be able to get car in for 2wks. So, car was taken to Auburn dealer. It is now 4/7 and I still have not heard anything on when repairs will be completed.

name: Austin Chandler
text: Overall had a very poor experience with Joe Hudson Opelika getting my vehicle repaired. I chose Joe Hudson because they are a Progressive Preferred Body Shop after my recent auto incident. From the original estimate to communicating the status of my vehicle, everything was backwards. I had planned trips and rides without my car based on the estimated completion date. 3 separate times they told me that my car would be finished the next day, and it wasn't. The only reason they get 2 stars is the quality of work was decent, but the communication and customer service provided was not acceptable. Would not recommend.

name: Rick Hairston
text: I first want to thank all the folks at Joe Hudson's Collision Center. I have never seen such professionalism like I experience there at any other collision center. From the first time I took my son's car in for repairs to the completion of the work done on his car was nothing less than a 5-star experience. They keep you abreast in all aspects of what they are doing with your car. Even with the 6-ft separation of the virus they have preventative measures that are set in place and enforced. My son's car was better than it was before the accident. I couldn't have asked for a better place to take a car in need of body repairs. I would HIGHLY recommend Joe Hudson Collision Center to anyone that wants quality, value, professionalism and punctuality. If I have anymore work that needs to be done and hopefully keeping my fingers crossed that we stay accident free but in the event it does happen I will definitely be going back to this place. Thank you again for a first class experience with a top notch personnel and collision center.

name: Larry Marshall
text: It was my first time there and it was very pleasant and friendly staff that I met and I hope to be able to say job well done and let everyone I know how good and professional they are.

name: Jason Akers
text: Overall great experience, a little mix up with insurance and the body shop about payment, but good looks great. Was given update through out the repair.  If I happen to need them again, they will be the first place I visit. Thanks to your team. 5 stars 🌟

name: Nathan Fredrick
text: Awesome people!!! You are awesome

name: dwayne majewski
text: Great service good looking professional employees.  Shop looks clean and organized.

name: Kevin Willis
text: Very professional, done a excellent job. Very nice and helpful. I recommend their work.

name: Arnold Lindsay
text:
I went to the Collision Center on 9/12/2019 at about 4:10 pm.  I followed a lady in from the parking lot that appeared to work there.  She went to a desk in the middle of the reception area and started working with a PC.  I walked up to the desk and stood within 5’ of this lady.  She never acknowledged that I existed.  She did not ask me if she could help me, did not ask what I needed.  There was one other person in a chair in the reception area that was busily working on a lap top.  I assumed he was a customer or insurance adjuster.  Another lady walked through the reception area from the shop area while I was there.  She looked at me and I looked at her.  She entered an office and never said anything either.  I was there as an invisible person for 5 minutes before I left.  I will take my business elsewhere.  This was a big disappointment since Opelika Ford had just adamantly recommended the Collision Center as the “go to” shop for collision repair.

Update:  I returned to the shop for an estimate and was treated professionally and received an estimate quickly.  I was satisfied with my second visit.  I will go back if I need their services again.

resp.text: We have discussed this incident and do extend a sincere apology to Mr. Lindsey. The employee in which this incident involved was in the middle of an important email when Mr. Lindsey approached her station. She took a minute to finish her sentence in the email before looking up. By that time Mr. Lindsey was leaving. We have made things clear with each employee that all customers are to be acknowledged as soon as they enter the building, no matter what else may be going on.  We would appreciate the opportunity to be of service to Mr. Lindsey if he would like to return.

name: David Hill
text: Forget the rest of these reviews.  My friend had his speakers stolen out of his car in their lot.  They claim to not have cameras on the lot.  That is grossly incompetent if true, or a blatant lie.  Other cars in the lot were checked and every one of them were unlocked.  I absolutely do not recommend any one risk their business here.

name: Rebekah Brazelton
text: My roommate has had the worst experience with this collision center. She has had to take her car in on three separate occasions for the same collision because they have not been able to fix her car in one. They have been unprepared, untimely, and unorganized. The desk service was very unprofessional. They have not worked with her at all to fulfill the service they guaranteed and have sent her car back home unfinished. We will not be using this collision center again. I wish I could leave zero stars!

resp.text: We have no way to possibly address any issues that the possible customer may have as this review was left by someone that we have no contact information on. In these circumstances it has proven, more times than not, to be a false review. What is being described by Ms. Brazelton is absolutely not how we treat our customers or take care of repairs.

name: Linda Culbertson
text: I would highly recommend this place to anyone. Service was great!! Kept me informed on the progress of my vehicle. The repair they did was excellent couldn’t even tell I had an accident. Great job Joe Hudson Collision!!!

name: David Holmes
text: They did a great job on my car.

name: john johnson
text: Joe Hudson's did a fantastic job on repairing our car.  The whole crew was very professional and courteous.   Couldn't be happier.  Thank you.  Great job you guys are terrific.

name: Erin Wilson
text: The service was above and beyond.  We got our vehicle back sooner than anticipated and in perfect condition.  But the kicker.... 24 hrs after body work and new paint. our son dinged the freshly repaired door just ever so slightly with his car door!  Too bad so sad??  Not even!  These amazing people said bring it up and let us take a look, and touched up the spot then and there simply and easily and at no charge since they still had some of our paint still on hand.  They even saw another tiny spot on another door and gave it a quick touch up too!  Incredibly helpful and friendly the entire time!

name: Kate Manning
text: Joe Hudson's was great. I worked mostly with Robin, who was great, but everyone I talked to was very nice and knowledgeable about my repairs. It took about a week for my car to be fixed and when I picked it up it had also been clean inside and out which was a wonderful surprise.

name: ZEK
text: Quality work was done in a very timely manner.  They are very communicative throughout the entire process, giving updates on the progress being made. Everything was handled with professionalism. I highly recommend doing business with them.

name: Jessica Kramer
text: Everyone was so nice and looks like we will be using them again! Very friendly service!

name: Dina Watson
text: This place is very untrustworthy. I had the same experience another reviewer had. My son and I took his Chevy Cruze here to have the front bumper repaired. He removed a few items from inside the car but left some change, an antique pocketknife, phone charger, and few more items. When we went to pick his car up, all of these items were missing, and 3 pair of shoes, a jacket and a gym bag was missing from his trunk. Why did they feel the need to go in his trunk, when all he needed to be repaired was the front bumper?? He spoke with the manager and she advised that no one stole these items and that they do not have cameras in place at this business. She said she would investigate it. We never heard from her- my son called her and she couldnt find any "evidence" that these items were taken from his car. Joe Hudson's in Auburn is nothing like this one- my daughter went to the one in Auburn and her car was returned with "everything" she left in it, and she left money, speakers, clothes, etc. I WILL NEVER GO BACK TO JOE HUDSONS IN OPELIKA. They are not professional nor are they trustworthy.

resp.text: Unfortunately, we have no way to prove if these items were actually left behind in this customers vehicle, upon drop-off. This is why each customer is required to sign an agreement stating that they have removed all personal items from their vehicle before we will accept it into our shop. We do not inspect each vehicle for left behind items upon drop-off nor do we inspect to make sure said items are still in the vehicle when the repair is done. We do make it a priority to hire honest hard-working individuals to serve our customers and represent our company and take the accusation of theft seriously. However, it is simply near impossible to prove that anything was left behind in a vehicle and then was stolen when we have several vehicles being taken apart and worked on, by many different employees, each and every day. We do sincerely hope that this accusation is not true and that no one had any item, no matter how small, stolen while in our shop.

name: David Wright
text: They were really nice and informative, that helped bug the insurance company to get things rolling faster.

name: Debra Moore
text: Great customer service and they do a great job. They also give updates on your vehicle. I would recommend them. Thanks Joe Hudson Collision Center👍👍

name: Mark Gillen
text: The staff at Joe Hudsons were courteous and professional. They communicated well and kept me informed through the entire process. The overall experience was excellent.

name: Lisa Day
text: Loved the great service and professional treatment from Joe Hudson's Collision. I especially appreciated Casey taking the time to accommodate our particular scheduling needs. Thank you!

name: Kim Deal
text: It's a busy season, so I've been driving a slightly, damaged car. The staff are super friendly!

name: Dr. Keonn Nettles
text: There is a lot I could say but long story short without much detail, communication is horrible. They did a good job fixing my car but what happened afterwards was not acceptable. I returned the car twice for an issue and both times they kept the car longer than stated and did not bother to tell me such. I had to rent a car (which area manager reimbursed but not without more bad communication that delayed the process). I spent over over $150 for them to send the car for a diagnostic and was not told up front that would be the case and the issue still was not fixed. In conclusion, take your vehicle elsewhere!

resp.text: We have honestly done everything within our power to please Mr. Nettles. He returned his car to us twice. We took care of every detail that he wanted looked at and he was happy with the repairs. He asked to get out of paying his deductible but we couldn’t allow that which upset him. The $150 that he mentions was for a diagnostic test. We explained to him that the vehicle needed to be taken to the dealer for the test. It was concerning the automatic door locks and we needed to know where the problem stemmed from. We explained to him that if it was determined the problem was related to the accident the cost of the test and repair would be covered by his insurance. However, if the issue was not caused by the accident, he would be responsible for any diagnostic fees that were charged as well as the cost of fixing the issue. The dealer determined the issue was due to corrosion in the wiring and not related to the accident, therefore State Farm would not pay. We even have clear photos of the corrosion. We paid for Mr. Nettles rental car as well as went over and beyond to try and make him happy. Unfortunately, we can’t do things for free which was his primary frustration.

name: Jonathan Rivera
text: Customer service was excellent! Very worth the drive from Panama city,  Florida to have them work on the vehicle.  I highly recommend JHCC in Opelika, Alabama.

name: Bruce Bailey
text: Very impressed with the thorough services, friendliness ,and overall look of repairs. Looks better than new.🙂

Very professional and personal service!

rf

name: Trillium HOA
text: Missed resetting blown seatbelt on a front end collision so car had to stay an extra 10 days. They did not clean up well or re-detail after the problems with belt issue (which turned into other issues). Manager Robin didn't "own" the problem. Made excuses and blew off major inconveniences her shop caused.   Car smells like smoke and oil inside. They still didn't reset a tire indicator after keeping car over a week extra. We are very dissapointed our insurance recommended this shop. Will NEVER use them again.

resp.text: This vehicle was towed in to us and not delivered by the customer. We did not realize that the seat belt was locked up until after delivery of the repaired vehicle. When the customer called to inform us of this issue we took responsibility for the over site and apologized. We ordered the needed parts and corrected the issue. When the customer’s father, who is also the one who left the review instead of the actual customer, came in to pick up the vehicle once the seat belt issue was corrected, he was immediately upset that the tire pressure light was on. All tires were at the correct pressure and the sensor was bad. This was a problem unrelated to the accident therefore insurance did not allow us to fix it. Due to this the father demanded their deductible be refunded and promised to leave us a poor review. We did everything to correct all issues the vehicle had due to the accident. I can assure you that no one smoked in the customer’s car and it was indeed cleaned after the seat belt issue was corrected. We have placed a call to Mr. Dicke and hope to speak with him but he has yet to return our call.

name: Tristin Terry
text:
No cameras pointed at your unlocked cars in their back lot (or lying).

A friend of mine had their speakers stolen out of their car that was on their lot. Other cars were checked and they were left unlocked as well. Do not do business with them.

text: Both of our cars were damaged during Hurricane Sally. Auto Craft Collision worked well with our insurance company and made the entire process very easy for us. We were very happy with the quality of their service, their attention to detail, and their professionalism. They were quick to respond to our questions and they continued to keep us updated on our progress. I would definitely recommend them.

text:
My 2009 F-150 had some severe paint damage on the front grill. I had about decided that I wouldn't repair it but my wife convinced me I should.
I went to Auto Craft Collision for an estimate not really expecting to do the work.
The estimate was quick , accurate and very professional. The work went exactly as estimated anf the cost was much less than I had expected.
Picked up the truck today amd I couldn"t be happpier!!
Thank you!

text: So happy with the folks at Auto Craft. Great work, delivered ahead of time and for less money than the original estimate. Will was the best to work with!  Thank you.

text: Wonderful customer service, always helpful and pleasant.  Rocky Lundy was professional and made you feel like he cared.  Would recommend this business to friends and family.

name: Erick Wiggins
text: Called rocky lundy never received a call back

resp.text: We apologize that you are upset for never receiving a call back from Mr. Lundy, however, the reason you did not get a call back is due to the fact that Rocky is retired and no longer with the company.  Perhaps you can call back to speak with someone else?  We are unaware of your call attempt.  Again, we apologize for the confusion.

name: Robert Rainey
text:
Took my truck in for repairs, a date was set.  They call 2 weeks later (time I could have gotten into another shop) to tell me they couldn't honor the appointment they set.  Called me today and said they could not take my truck in on the date they set.  Period.  My mother had problems with these people and I should have known better than waste my time with them.

You must have me mixed up with somebody else.  Will called me this morning and all he said was he couldn’t take my truck in on 10/19 (the date that was set).  I told him I’d call him back.  I made a call to another shop (down the road).  Called back and told Candy I’ll be taking somewhere else.

I’m giving you an honest review.   You are unable to accept the truth.

resp.text: Mr Rainey, as the owner of the company, I feel that we should reply to your complaint via Google since you chose to insinuate we couldn’t honor your appointment via our Google review page.  We actually called this morning to confirm your appointment for next week and you told the customer service representative that we would have to complete your repair within 1 week or you would go somewhere else.  We explained that we cannot commit to that due to the size and complexity of the repair and the fact that dealing with your insurer (name withheld) results in a 100% guarantee that additional damage would be found as they write their estimates without a disassembly to identify all hidden damage.  They typically take 3-4 days to complete a supplement.  I truly apologize that we were unable to meet your expectations, however, we would rather you and all customers know up front that a repair cannot be performed within those expectations when we know that it cannot be done that rapidly.  To tell you otherwise would simply be telling a lie to get you in the door and then you would be more upset after finding out that’s what we did to get your sale.  We don’t want our customers to endure that.  Best of luck in getting your repairs completed.

name: Randall Cherry
text: The amazing crew at Auto Craft Collision did a fabulous job on my vehicle. 10/10 service.  Thank you so much!

text: Rocky and the entire staff at Auto Craft Collision Center in Fairhope have once again gone above and beyond. Their repair work is beautiful and so is the warranty work. And they always return my car to me cleaned and vacuumed. I've been a customer for over 6 years, and I wouldn't go anyplace else. Highly recommend!

name: Jennifer Siefert
text: The whole entire staff is amazing.  They took care of everything.  My car was returned better than I could have hoped for. I have used them many time and each time is better than the last.

name: Patricia Guthrie
text:
We needed the front bumper on our Nissan replaced and had a short timeline.  The folks at Auto Craft made sure the part was in before calling us to drop off the car.  As promised all was done in just a couple of days PLUS we asked them to detail "Nina".  She had some scratches on her hood and in a few other places and really needed some TLC.
I can't tell you how proud we are of her now.  She looks like new inside and out!
2 years ago I had Auto Craft refurbish the headlights on the Nisan as they were looking rather scuffed up and dull.  Today they STILL look excellent.

They really care about their customers at Auto Craft and it is obvious.  I was even contacted over the weekend to make sure that we were happy with their work.

Hopefully nothing happens any time soon to bring us back, but if it does, there is no where else we would go.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words Ms Guthrie!  We appreciate the opportunity you gave us to make Nina look new again!!

text: My car drives better than when I first bought it

text: The best body shop in town hands down. They have fixed a few different cars of mine and have always had the best quality. I loved the high end experience as a customer even though I didn't own one of their brand of cars. Would highly recommend.

text: Shout out to Century Collision Center and manager Drew Peck.  Had a few minor issues appear from a repair that had been done several years ago, and Drew took care of everything without hesitation. Outstanding Customer Service!

name: Brad Jaxon
text: Century has fixed several of mine and my families cars. Their quality is top notch along with the high end experience they give you regardless of what type of car you own. They have fixed my Honda along with my spouses GMC. They always kept me updated on what was going on with my claim and made me feel safe knowing our cars were in their care.

name: Andrew Behel
text: century has a great group of employees in the collision center. Everyone was very nice and courteous to me and my family. we will definitely recommend to family and friends.

name: AmbiQueen96
text: Nice people. Good customer service but when we picked up the car on Monday July 21st we noticed there was an ant infestation in pur vehicle. It wasn't like that when we dropped it off. The car was clean and free of bugs. Now it is Thursday July 25th and we are still dealing with the ants in our car. Be more mindful of where you park peoples vehicles please!

name: PJ Gray
text: After having my BMW there 3 weeks for repairs from a limb falling across the top & hood, I got it back and was very dissapointed. The inside had nasty fingerprints all over,  there was overspray on the sunroof, white buff marks on the paint, and several scratches from the limb were not addressed at all. After taking it back for these problems, we got it back with the fingerprints still there, overspray still there, and of course they said the scratches were not caused by the tree limb. Basically they ran it through the car wash then hit it with a buffer real quick and called it done. Im taking it somewhere else to finish the job that should have been done right the first time for almost $2400.00. Never taking another car here.

name: Mike L
text: Someone backed into my almost brand new car. I needed to make sure that it looked like factory when it was done. Dave Graf and his crew at Century Collision Center made it perfect. They even drove it to my work to inspect it and make sure I liked the way the color matched before they finished up. Talk about service!!! I can't not say enough about the quality of their work and the royal treatment they give their customers!!!

name: Lance Proctor
text:
Certified BMW had a few minor dings and a wheel that was curbed by the previous owner. Took the vehicle for a detailed analysis/estimate and felt good about the cost. The estimate included the replacement of the wheel as opposed to a repair. Upon picking up the vehicle (5 day repair), we noticed that one of the "dings" did not get repaired only painted over, and the wheel was not addressed; neither of the delinquencies  were scratched from the invoice. Asking about the wheel, the manager and director claim that the estimate for the wheel was in error due to a "software glitch", then they said the cost for the replacement was about $300 more than estimated. I was very confused and asked them to please explain because I must have missed something. They then said that the wheel part number on the estimate was for the "wrong" wheel. They reprinted the estimate for the updated wheel cost, and this time there was no part number, only the increased cost. I asked them to meet me half way on the wheel but they would discount by only $100; Im used to companies honoring their commitment. Needless to say i requested my money back (for the wheel); havent received it yet.
These guys lack morals and are willing to sacrafice referrals for the sake of a buck. I cannot recommend this shop to anyone. BTW, the repairs totaled $3.1K (not including the wheel).

name: Rachael Mann
text: The guys at Century Collision Center saved the day when my daughter locked my keys in my car. They came out to my work very quickly and carefully unlocked my door without causing any damage to my vehicle. They were my heroes that day!! I definitely recommend them and will use their services again when needed.

name: Robert Forman
text: I took my car to Century Collision. Worked with Tim, was very professional and my car looks great! Would recommend to friends and family.

He smacks right into the front of our car. My poor pitiful fiance was pretty much in tears because he loved that car so much! I've never seen him so upset; we thought it was totaled, but the guys at Century Collision Center had it back up and running with no problems in no time at all. Great job guys. :) Definitely recommend.

text: I have a 2019 Honda Accord Sport that was hit and was very upset about having to get it repaired. The guys at Preformance Auto Body & Frame did an EXCELLENT job. I was extremely pleased with the work that was done on my car. Also, I have to say that I was so impressed with Tony Shankle. He had no idea that I am a single mother on disability, and he went above and beyond by educating me and helping me to get other issues taken care of that pertained to the accident. He didn’t have to do that, but he did, and it showed me that he truly cares about his customers. I highly recommend taking your vehicle here and I will be sending everyone I know to this place for repairs.

text: Danny helped me from start to finish and got my kia k5 back looking brand new again in 2 days. Thanks to the guys at pop's. Great job

name: Lisa Blanton
text: Pop’s Shop is my new favorite place! I know they fix and paint cars but over Christmas someone took the passenger blinker cover from my truck (? because they didn’t want to buy the whole housing I guess)?  No one was open to help me either due to COVID or Holidays. Joe kindly stopped his working and came out and fixed it for me in a minute! No charge! My mom had her car painted earlier this year there with great service and results. My father used to take his vintage cars there for painting and help. I’m all in for Pop’s Shop! Very kind people like them are a rarity nowadays.... especially to old disabled hippie ladies on oxygen!  A+ people!

name: Amber Thomas
text: NEVER GO HERE ! I let them work on my 2018 camaro and I have to take it to another shop to get it fixed right . The paint is messed up I have a dent in my fender. They scratched my tint on my back window . My car smelled of cigarettes and I don't smoke. The car looked trashed when I got it back . I will never recommend this place to anyone.

text: When I needed a tow they were right there and the man that towed my car was very nice

text: They made my experience easy and simple Mr Tim explained everything were I could understand it I would recommend anybody to Pops Shop

name: Hannah Perkins
text: Stay away. I had a horrible experience. It took 2 full weeks to replace a rear bumper with only cosmetic damage. They also let me drive off with missing bolts to hold the tire guard to the bumper. They will lie to you over the phone about when they have started work and are very dodgy with questions. They just want your money and don’t care how long it takes to fix a car. They also will never call you to update you on things such as late parts or even when you can expect to pick up your car. You will have to initiate all the phone calls.

name: Nothin Fancy Home Cookin
text: Customer Service is everything when going to a new place people recommend.  And that with four visits, is something they lack in every single time.  And I will leave the rudeness at just that.

name: Betty Harris
text: They is the greatest place to take your car to get it fixted good work

name: Shonnie Shelton
text: Called AAA for towing service. On time, nice and no charge for 2 extra miles. Thanks pop's shop.

name: Patrick Hildreth
text: Took my f250 here to have it repainted due to scratches. When I got it back I couldn't have been happier at what I saw. Turned around and brought my Tahoe to them to have a lock fixed after it got broken into. When I got it back I noticed they even took the liberty to wash the dirty thing. Very professional people with great quality of work.  Recommend them to anyone.

name: Heather Hastings
text: I had a very bad experience using this shop.  My car was kept for days longer than I expected and I was told the reason was b/c they were "waiting on the part from Honda".  After picking up my car, I realized the part did not look the same as before.  I called and was told it was an after market fabric that they went to Hancocks and purchased.  1) Then why was I waiting days longer?  2) Why didn't they ask?  When I asked these questions, I was told by one of the owners that they didn't know "why I cared b/c no one else ever did".  That is not a professional response, nor was the attitude I was given.  I was waiting on Honda fabric, was told it was ordered, and something else subbed without being notified.  And obviously, it was different or how would I have noticed?  Then when I asked about all of this, I was treated rudely.  Go somewhere else - you can get better work and much more professional dealings.

name: Bishop Gambit
text: Needed my headlight repaired. And still need my headlight repaired.  Gave me a honest estimate and a free bulb.  Good enough for me.

name: Bob Morrow
text: Brian to the rescue.  Blew tire on band new Toyota Tundra at U of A.  Called AAA. They sent Pop and  Sons.  Came when they said they would, courteous,  effecient and helpful. Could not have ask for better service.

name: Therese Gavin
text: My review is based on customer service as the male server on Friday 3/15 seemed bothered by each question asked and not helpful at all. Nothing like the positive 1st experience when I visited Tuscsloosa.

name: Amy Golden
text: Pops Shop did an excellent job on my vehicle.  The paint matched exactly. We would highly recommend Pops Shop.

name: King Craig
text: Danny hunt is courtesy and will listen to your problem and try to fix it

name: Bin Miggy
text: Apparently the people at Pops think it's okay to exhort every last dime out of folks. We're from Birmingham and our car was in a wreck near Tuscaloosa and not drivable so it got towed to Pop's. It's old and we feared it was totaled but Pops said they'd look it over and give us an estimate- in the meantime they charge $20 a day to store it. Then they told us they can't look at it and give us an estimate for three weeks! That's right: a full 21 days in storage before they even LOOK at it and give us an idea of the cost, and $420 in storage fees! Since when does it take 21 days to decide if repairs will be more than the worth of a 11 year old car? My guess is they knew very well it was not worth fixing and wanted to make some money before we figured it out. We got it taken by a friend who does salvage ASAP and his guy confirmed it was not worth repairing... in less than 24 hours! I guess I should be glad Pop's DIDN'T do repairs- what kind of nightmare would that have been?

name: Janie Vandiver
text:
PLEAES READ BEFORE CHOOSING THIS SHOP
First of all, I dropped my car off with a FULL TANK and picked it up (12miles on the ODO) and THE GAS LIGHT WAS ON. I told the manager about this and he told me I must have filled up another vehicle.......I only have one vehicle.
SECOND- They put me off for 5 WEEKS. and when I got it back, the HOOD WAS CROOKED, PAINT WAS CHIPPED, AC WAS NOT WORKING, and it was MISSING PARTS.
THIRD-- it took me sending it back to them 3 times for them to fix it correctly.
I finally was able to pick my car up yesterday (by them leaving the key on the tire because they didn't give me enough time to find a ride and they closed)

this place is a JOKE. they rush it and tried to get me to sign all the paperwork and handed me the keys before even letting me look at the finished work.

name: John Samuel Gurtler
text: Professional work and quick turnaround. I got a free estimate.

name: Michael J. Butler
text: Terrible worthless shop. Ran over some rebar out on highway 11 near Mercedes. Had car towed to Pop's after a friend from church recommended it. Had rental coverage for 30 days. My rental is up and two days ago they called to tell me they couldn't work on it. I'm furious with them and Geico at this point because I don't get paid to manage repairs, they do. DO NOT USE THIS SHOP!

name: Shelby Schmidt
text:
Just got my car back today
When I got in a wreck I didn't have the chance to empty my car trash can, but when I got it back the trash can was empty
The repair was seamless and matched my paint perfectly, but I kind of expect that from any shop when it's just a bumper replacement
I'm just really impressed that they took out the trash for me though
It was a nice touch

name: Chelsea Gilliland
text: pops shop are great people very quick with repairs very friendly and reasonable. wouldn't take my car anywhere else.

name: Aunt Persnickity
text: Stranded in Northport and called AAA. They sent Pops who came, diagnosed and got us rolling within the hour. These guys could have charged us for a tow to the dealership but placed integrity above profit!!

name: Carla Simpson
text: I had a horrible experience dealing with Tim Minor at Pop's Shop. He wanted to charge me over $600.00 to repair my car. When my exhusband called to get a price for the same work on the same car he quoted him $300.00. So I feel Mr. Minor discriminates toward women. I called Mr Minor to try and settle this matter, all he did was yell at me over the phone and threaten me. I did advise Mr Minor that I would not reccommend his shop to any of my friends based on the way he treated me. What he did was wrong.Shame on you Mr Minor!!!!! You should treat everyone the same. It is not ethical to discriminate based on gender and you should not yell at a lady!!!!!!

name: Chereigna Hughes
text: Worst experience ever they tell you one price to get you in there. Once this company finds out it is an insurance claim they hike the Price up to get all the money. Scandalous and rudest body shop ever take your business to honest people. Then they wait until they take your car apart to call you and tell you it will be 2,000 more. If you tell them you don’t want them to work on it they tell you they can’t put it back together!!! They also kept my my car way longer than they told me originally. Worst experience! I should Have paid attention to the reviews.

text: What a rip off they did not do the work I paid for and they are very rude with horrible customer service

text: Great expertise, service.

resp.text: Crystal, thank you for the kind words. We love hearing that our customers are happy with their experience at Bentley Cadillac! We appreciate your business and value you as a customer.

Update: Talked to Alex over the phone and his apology seemed genuine and sincere. He went above and beyond to make it right.

resp.text: Very sorry for your experience. Your wait time was much longer than anticipated, so we are refunding you the alignment charges. We appreciate your business very much!

text: I'm a transplant from Florida, so finding a Cadillac dealership in The Shoals area, with excellent service, is very important to me. Well I found that in Bentley Cadillac! Judith Rickard

text: Vic’s was recommended by a close friend that said he did quality work.  Unfortunately, the repairs required over 6 weeks to complete and we were stuck with an extra $450 in rental car charges.  This wasn’t a difficult repair ($3000 damages).  As the rental car insurance coverage was expiring we were told over the phone by Vic’s that they would cover the difference for the extra rental costs out of the deductible.  When we picked up the car today the owner then stated he would only pay 2 days ($60 total) of the $443 total extra rental car bill.  I can’t recommend using this business based on the extended time required for the work and the misrepresenting of how the rental car overage would be handled.

text: Meticulous and gifted in his craft. He even towed my car from a different location and didn't charge me since he did my body work. This man whom I have just met is now a friend for life. text: My car was damaged by hurricane Zeta.  I chose Vic’s because they are a locally owned business. The paint job is perfect.  Staff always kept me informed of when to expect my vehicle would be finished.  COVID slowed progress due to illness within staff.  I am more than pleased with their work. I highly recommend this company.

name: Amy Bush
text: I dropped my car off there to get an estimate done and was supposed to pick the car up the next day.when I went to pick up the car and the estimate the next day ,and this guy already had my car in pieces without my consent 🤦🏽‍♂️. When I asked what’s going on he said he already contacted the insurance company and they are going to pay for it and the money was on the way to his account. After reviewing the estimate it was things that I didn’t want done by him and things that wasn’t don’t in the wreck he got furious when I contacted my insurance company and stopped the check .That’s not the only thing I heard about him and sketchy things beaware when dealing with this guy.

text: Very professional! I didn’t have to call to extend my rental, ONE TIME! My truck looked better, coming out, than it did before I wrecked it. Paid great attention to detail. Beautiful work.

name: Zack ThaKidd Pettway
text: I need more Stars to rate this shop and that's in all honesty. Vic's Paint & Body is a great shop to go to if you want great work done by awesome people. I turned my car into Vic right before the Christmas & New Year holidays and even through those days he came in day & night to make sure my car was priority. The attitude and drive he has is amazing, the guy is a workaholic and will do anything to satisfy his customers. He doesn't hesitate to call and give updates. He answers EVERY Call. The shop is just awesome! My car was an inch away from insurance totaling it out, but Vic did his thing and brought my car all the way back to life. The finish product had me shocked beyond words! So 10 Stars rating for me... Take ya wrecked vehicles to VIC'S CUSTOM PAINT & BODY LLC. IT'LL BE WORTH IT

name: Demaya Hall
text: Vic got my car looking like new again after it was hit. He worked with me and was very helpful and understanding. He updated me on this that were going on with my car considering I was scared and do not trust many with my car. He understood that got my car done in a timely fashion overall great service.

text: The day after my daughter car was wrecked I took it to Vic that Monday for an estimate. He was so helpful and professional he put me in a rental that day. I gave him the claim number and he took care of the rest. At one point the insurance adjuster told me my daughters car was deemed totaled because it cost too much to fix it. My daughters damage was only to the front passenger side of her car. I called Vic and he got with the adjuster who then called me and said that they were paying for the damage. I recommend any and everyone to do business with Vics ❤️❤️❤️

However, after multiple calls and visits to the store, they did nothing. I have not received one call back from them. I have given up on them. DO NOT leave your car with these people. They are not professionals, they are amateurs and you would be better off never coming to this body shop.

Thank God for you guys. Joe Hudson royally sucks. Their repair job was just crappy. Lynch, however, has NEVER failed me. They made everything easy, quick, and perfect.
Customer Service= Perfect

name: jon sims
text: A level of professionalism that is hard to find in today's world.

resp.text: Jon, thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review.!

name: Grant Brewer
text:
DO NOT TAKE YOUR CAR HERE!!!!!
We came to Lynch collision center after a minor fender bender. Our experience quickly went downhill as it took 2 months for them to replace the front bumper and radiator. When I got my car back the front right headlight didn't work. We later figured out the headlight unit was cracked and they didn't find that worth telling us. We fixed the headlight on our own. A couple days later there was a leak under the car. We figured out it was the antifreeze reservoir. So we took it back to Lynch and they filled up and said it would be good. After bringing it home it leaked again so we took it back only for them to do THE SAME THING. Filling it up and claiming it was fixed. We ended up having to make two more trips leaving the car there for multiple days each time. After the fourth time of taking the car and Lynch being completely bewildered by the leaking of antifreeze we decided we are not wasting any more of our time with them. As if the incompetence of the workmanship wasn't enough, we had the misfortune of working with Dennis. Dennis was extremely rude and unhelpful. On one occasion while I was asking Dennis about a charge on the invoice he handed it to me and started walking away.  I can't not recommend this place enough.
STAY AWAY FROM LYNCH COLLISION!!!

resp.text: Mr. Brewer, we sincerely apologize about your experience at Lynch Collision Center. Thank you for making us aware of your concerns. We will address this issue with our management team. We look at reviews like this as an opportunity to better serve our customers. Someone from our management team will be in contact with you once we address the situation internally. Thank you and hopefully we can change your opinion of our body shop. :)

name: JR Jung
text: Repairs were done on time and for the price originally quoted.  You can't ask for much more than quality repair at a fair price, as far as I am concerned.

resp.text: Jr, Thanks for the positive feedback!

name: Wesley C
text: The Lynch Collision Center team was extremely professional and did an outstanding job; you can't tell there was ever any damage to the car. Friendly and efficient service.

resp.text: Wesley, thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review.!

name: US! times 3
text: I was very disappointed with Lynch Collision. I was a previous customer and had a great experience, so when my vehicle suffered damage from a piece of plywood flying out of  a pickup truck I naturally wanted to go back. I expected the front skirt to be repaired as easily and as great as before. While the skirt was repaired, my vehicle suddenly had other things not working that was working prior to my body repair. Bottom line is I feel like I was given some song and dance about the situation. Dennis, who was apparently the manager of the operation, has absolutely no customer service skills. He argued with me and made sure I knew how wrong he thought that I was. There's really no sense in airing the argument here because all that will happen is a rebuttal post stating I was wrong again. Dennis heard Christian music playing on my radio in my van and while not directly saying it, he insinuated that I was not acting as a Christian. No where in the Bible does it state that Christians are to be doormats and be trampled on or even taken advantage of. I feel me calling him on a situation is completely appropriate and not ungodly. I also feel like him using the "I'm a Christian too" card to try to make his point was highly inappropriate. The problem at hand was not about being a Christian or not, it was about why something else going wrong with my vehicle under his care. I never felt like I got a satisfactory answer. He set up for us to have it looked at next door, but it seemed way too coincidental that the exact thing Dennis suggested was wrong be wrong and it would be about $1200 out of my pocket. Upon further investigation on my own, what was suggested isn't accurate. That would have been a lot of money to spend for something that wasn't truly broken. I also found it super odd that the following day, a Saturday (when the center is closed) another employee called me on my cell from his cell to discuss what was wrong so he could make it right. Red flag! I never returned this Individual's call. Business should be done during business hours and also not on someone's day off on their private phone, especially if you've never talked with this person. I couldn't help but wonder why this happened. Was this guy covering for himself, did he know why a part mysteriously and suddenly went bad in my vehicle? Had Dennis been this was with other customers and he was building a case against him? Either way it was wrong and no way to do business. The only redeeming individual there was the lady at the desk. She ran that place great! She made her customers feel welcomed and most important. She helped to the extent that she could. It's ashame she couldn't have been in charge of fixing my vehicle. One final thing that comes to mind has to do with the insurance. It was a road hazard claim. My agent asked that contact be made directly with his office and not the main 800 number. It took so much for me to convince Dennis to speak with my agent directly. Eventually, He was able to speak with the office and get the ball rolling. He was not thrilled with this. I just kept being told that they were an authorized agent for said insurance. I really felt like if I had gone in as a private pay that my quote would have been different. I was told several times that because of some of the damage to the vehicle that the quote may not be accurate. Amazing. When we had to pay the bill, it was down to the penny quoted. The quote included new fog light bulbs. if I'm not mistaken, and all that supposedly happened was they needed to be plugged back in. Where did that portion of the quote get dropped? I just don't know. It is possible that I did not understand the quote because it's not broken down for easy understanding. I am certain of this, my vehicle left Lynch Collision with a function not working that had been working. I am also sure of this: I will not be back to Lynch Collision as long as Dennis is there. I may reconsider should there be management changes. I do not know. It was a very disappointing experience. Customer service was severely lacking.

resp.text: We are very sorry to hear that you had such a poor experience with our collision center. It is never our intention to disrespect any of our customers or give them false information. Our mission statement is "to create an atmosphere of Trust, Integrity, Respect and Teamwork". It is our goal to exceed our customer's expectations in sales and service. We apologize if the ball was dropped in any of those areas. We hope you understand that any disrespect you felt from management is completely unintentional and most likely a result of miscommunication. We hope to resolve this issue as soon as possible and turn you back into a happy Lynch customer. Thank you for your time and we hope you have a great day! :)

I was told that my tire couldn't be repaired due to threads being worn too thin, tires needed to be replaced for $900 I was told.. It looked to me like the tires still had some threads left. So I took it to Greg at Good Year who repaired the tire for $14 and confirmed that the tires had plenty left on the threads. Good to see that there are still good people around with integrity. Thanks for the great service!

They will always take time to explain things to you but the main thing I love going here is because they are honest people. They will not sell you a service you don't need.

name: Lynn R. Perry
text:
While traveling across country my truck suddenly needed repair.  I asked the tow truck driver  to haul me to Alabama Auto; the driver said this station was an excellent choice.  My truck was towed in the back parking lot at 11:30 PM on a Monday night.  At 7: 00 AM the station open and I was out by 10:00 AM with new front hub bearing assembly.
The people were considerate, and competent throughout the process.  I have basic auto repair knowledge and they added to that by patiently demonstrating and showing me specifically what was wrong and how it would be repaired.
When your traveling having your vehicle repaired is a roll of the dice and I won big here.  I have no qualms about taking my vehicle to this station and neither should you.

name: Bo Foster
text: I've been using Alabama Auto Services for a decade to service my vehicles. This business is run by very trustworthy and extremely accommodating people to say the least.  They're very reasonable in terms of maintenance and repair costs and always call to consult with you prior to doing anything to your vehicle.   I highly recommend this local business for automotive service and repair.

text: These folks are friendly, very fair and never do anything without making sure I agree to the work.  I feel so comfortable dealing with them! i never feel like I have been taken advantage of.....not so with all shops.  ESP for women!

name: Kelly Howard
text: Got my car radiator fixed and they did a great job!  I highly recommend them.

name: Jenny Seale
text: This business went above and beyond to give us a safe place to land in our time of need. We were pulling our camper from Texas to Florida when our truck broke down on a Friday evening in heavy rain. We were stranded on the eastbound side of the I 10 bridge, just past the U.S.S. Alabama. When my husband called Alabama Auto Service Center, the owner stayed an hour after closing to wait for a tow truck to get us there.  He allowed us to park our camper at his shop overnight and gave us access to his water and electricity so we could use our shower and run fans overnight. Saturday morning our truck was quickly serviced and we were back on the road by 10:30. Thank you Alabama Auto Service Center!

text: I ordered new tires from an online store and had this service center install them. Very good prices and service. Was in and out in less than an hour. Will do business with again.

text:
Got my truck June 30 and had 5 days to repair per insurance company and it’s be well over 40 days and my vehicle is still not ready. The owner has a nasty attitude whenever I called about my vehicle. The secretary tell you she will call every Tuesday and Thursday with updates and she doesn’t. She never knows what’s going on when u call and ask for a update. Told me my car would be ready Friday august 6, 2021 and it wasn’t and they also keep calling
Asking for money to fix stuff unrelated to the accident. I would t recommend these people to a dog. BE CAREFUL OF THESE MONEY HUNGRY UNPROFESSIONAL PEOPLE.

name: T Walker
text: Their service was the best. I was run off the road a few hours earlier in the day by a wreckless driver and damaged my tire. I was looking to get it fixed and was pressed against closing time. I arrived and the manager and workers assisted me by repairing my tire. It brought tears to my eyes upon leaving because you rarely find nice people anymore. I greatly appreciated their generous service.

resp.text:
T Walker,

Thank you very much for your generous review and for sharing this experience! It is moments like these that remind us why we are in the auto repair business! We greatly appreciate you for stopping in and look forward to giving you another five-star experience on your next visit! Thanks! - TW

name: Lan Lupe Lòpez
text: Idler arm destroyed because they did not take time to make sure vehicle is safe it is a 4x4 that has a tow package and carries a family very unprofessional.Lugs not tightened correctly cost me a ton of cash just now. They also take down reviews can’t find my other one.

resp.text:
Lan Lupe Lopez,

I am sorry that you had an unsatisfactory visit. We strive to make sure that we do everything with excellence. We have a nation-wide warranty through Goodyear's Tire & Service Network that takes care of all mechanical service that we perform. Could you please call us at 205.664.0810 to help get your problem resolved? Also, I'm sorry you don't see your review. We do not have the ability to remove public reviews. Only Google has that authority. Again, please call us so that we can take care of your matter. Thanks - TW

name: James Davis
text: Was passing through Birmingham when the truck developed a vibration. The staff was wonderful. Told me the problems and the time it would take to fix it. resp.text:
James Davis,

Thank you very much for the kind and positive review! We love to see that we can make an impact in our customer's lives. Thank you for trusting us. We look forward to taking care of your vehicle again soon if you are ever in the area! Thanks so much! - TW

text: Excellent service as always! We've been taking all our cars here for years. Paula, Jim, Rick the entire staff are a wonderful.

resp.text:
Michele Hayes,

It has been a pleasure serving you and your family for all of these years! Thank you for sharing such a positive and heart felt review. We strive to make the visit of each of our guests as welcoming as yours! Thank you again and we look forward to taking care of you soon! - TW

name: Quentin Evans
text:
Very nice and helpful staff. My son had a blowout on the highway, and we needed a quick, inexpensive option. Not only did they meet the price mark, but after hearing our situation, they had us out of there in 10 min.

They are now on my short list of tire shops. Excellent job!

resp.text: Quentin Evans, we are greatly appreciative of your five-star review! We are happy that we met your expectations for taking care of your son. name: Emily Clark
text: This location went out of their way to help me when no one else would. Provided quick, friendly service and are true tire professionals! Other tire shops told me it would be 3 days until they could get me a tire, this shop made it happen that day! Highly recommend!

resp.text: Emily Clark, thanks so much for your kind and gracious review of our business! We strive to provide exceptional service for each customer that is in need of assistance. Thanks so much! - TW

name: Nick Casiday
text: The service was high quality, but very slow. I was a walk in with a flat tire, so I expect it to take some time. There were only a couple of people ahead of me and I added an oil change to the patched tire order. It took about 3 hours total. I would suggest using Speedy Tire as an appointment, but not as a walk in.

resp.text: Nick, thank you for the honest review! We will take these measures to the service manager to evaluate. Although, some things may happen out of our control, no matter the case, we strive to make each visit for our customers a pleasant one. Please allow us to take care of you again and to shoot for a five-star experience! Thank you again! - TW

resp.text: Amber Butler, we deeply apologize that you had a poor experience at our location. name: Shawn Price
text: Simply Awsome!  I shopped 4 other pelham area tire shops before I picked Speedy-goodyear.  I know it sounds silly, but they delivered 100% on everything they said they would do.  The tires came in when they said, The work was completed when they said, the spare was rotated out like they said.  The best surprise was the price.  The quote was EXACTLY what I was charged...  no hidden fees, no forgotten taxes, just 100%  accurate... and did NOT include the rebate.  All other stores included the rebates as their "best price"... not speedy, the got all the paperwork together for me and said mail it in you would like some money back from Goodyear.  Just awsome people, I would send my mother to this store.

resp.text:
Shawn Price,

We are greatly appreciative of your five-star review! We are more than appreciate of the story that you shared with us. For that, we are grateful! We look forward to continuing to serve you! And yes! We will take care of your mother's vehicle as well! send her our way! Thanks! - TW

name: Rakin Abdullah
text: This place is terrible and I witnessed why before I left my car so it's my fault for dealing with them.I witnessed the front desk argue back and forward with a customer about poor improper work performed on his vehicle this past Saturday but I figured I was only getting an alignment and oil change so what the heck.I left my car key and rim key with the front desk and was told I'd hear from them soon but I never received a call so my wife went down right before closing and they were done.The only key that was returned was my car key and magicallyl the rim key is missing .I call them but they were already closed so I called Monday ,went by Monday and called back Monday after getting the run around from the rude ,unprofessional staff who placed the blame on me and my wife about the key.Did you check your car,her car ,and went on to say they didn't have it or ever received it .The problem wasn't the key it was how we were treated but it was the same treatment I saw them give another customer.PLEASE DONT DO BUSINESS HERE !!!! YOU'VE BEEN WARNED !!! now I'm changing my work schedule etc to take care of the key problem that they caused and the work that I got on the car is still doing the same thing!

resp.text: Rakin Abdullah, we are very sorry that you encountered this poor experience at our location. Although, we may make mistakes, but we ask that our customers give us the opportunity to make it right to our upmost ability. In the case of the missing wheel lock key, in no way did we attempt to be condescending when asking questions about it's whereabouts. We are only concerned for your belongings. We made every effort to correct the misplacement by checking in the vehicle to purchasing and replacing the wheel lock keys with no hesitation. Your convenience is important to us, so we offered to pick-up and purchase the wheel lock keys for you. Again, we apologize for this inconvenience. Our team has discussed this situation to prevent any encounters such as these again. We strive to provide exceptional customer service for each customer that walks through our doors. We hope that we can be offered another chance to earn your business and trust. Thank you! - TW

name: Kym Klein
text:
Front desk manager, Paula, is one of the rudest and disrespectful customer service managers I've ever encountered!

My windshield wipers had quit working so I pulled in thinking someone could take a quick look at them and let me know what was wrong. When they asked me to come inside and proceeded to try and open a ticket - I said I'm sorry I thought this was something you could help me with so  I turned to walk out.  As I was leaving, Paula rudely snipped, "Do you work for free?"  Her disrespectful comments were totally inappropriate and uncalled for!

I took the vehicle down the street to O'Reilly's and they came out, in the rain,  to check my fuses - FOR FREE!!!

My experience was appalling! No wonder her bays were empty!!!!

resp.text: Kym Klein, we deeply apologize that you had a poor experience at our facility. Although, we must create an invoice for liability purposes for each vehicle that enters our facility, we strive to be fair and transparent with all recommendations for vehicle issues. Please accept my apology for the comments made. Our team has discussed this immediately. Our team is known for exceptional customer service and we strive to display this with each and every customer - no matter the circumstance. We hope that we can be granted another chance to earn your business and trust! Thank you! - TW

name: Steven Schrimsher
text: Mr. Rice took very good care of my car and had it looking like it just left the factory. Ok, while that might be a little bit if an overstatement, the quality of repairs he did on my car were much better than what I had anticipated. Mr. Rice was also very friendly and responsive to my phone calls and questions, and clearly explained what the work he was going to do was. Walking through the shop after dropping off my car I saw several classics in for work, which led me to believe that if these enthusiasts trust him with their dream cars, he's going to treat my daily driver just fine. All in all, as close to a dealership-quality repair as you can get without actually visiting the dealership or paying a dealership price. Would definitely recommend.

text: It's a great shop. Mr. Rice is a great man and will take care of you.

text: Very professional... great timing.... they keep their word... fast and friendly... they was very understanding about my situation when I was involved in my wreck... and I couldn’t get a rental they fixed my car within a day and had my car looking good as new... keep up the good work you guys... y’all are awesome

text: Work was accomplished quickly within the time frame we were told and the car looks great. Paint matched and pin stripe.

name: misthe king
text: Eagle collision seems like a honest business because a representative from there called me and let me know that my vehicle was a total loss and that my insurance company would not repair the vehicle due to the extensive damage. I was kindly informed that I can come by and pick up my license plates. They also informed me that soon they will be selling used cars

name: L. Frederick
text: My husband used Eagle Collision to do some challenging paint work on his classic BMW motorcycle. We were very pleased with the end result! Justin was great, and the price was lower than quoted. We will use them again for sure. Picture is Before/After

name: Bill Stratman
text: Nice people. I needed an estimate on some damage. The estimator was available in less than 10 minutes. He looked things over and I got the estimate by email in less than an hour.

name: Debi Swaney
text: The guys at Eagle Collision are the best! The attention to every detail is amazing. My car looks new! They took care of it in a timely manner. The great atmosphere and professionalism of the shop is an important part to a consumer. Thank you all!!!

name: Jasmine Montgomery
text: Awesome people and very friendly! They did an amazing job on my car repair and they also cleaned it to a point where it looks brand new again. I highly recommend!

name: Katrina Robison
text: Work so far is holding up. But their up-to-date service not so much. I would get a text saying my car would be ready by expected date, well a week later it was ready with an hour and a gift before they closed. Like really. Had I not picked up my car that day I would have had to wait until after the long holiday. Picking up a car in the dark one could not expect the repair properly there at the center. Also made me rush returning my rental to which something was left in the car, to which I feel the rushing of the whole situation contributes to the item being left behind.

name: Bryan Cook
text: I have used Eagle Collision more than once, and each time they were professional and provide quality work.

name: Shane Chenault
text: Best service I’ve ever had. Finished way faster than I expected and every employee was super professional! Highly recommend

name: Reginald Owens
text: Great work. Great customer service.

name: Matthew Rust
text: Easy to find and great customer service and will get the job done as quick as they can and truck looks great

name: Toby Holloway
text: My experience with Eagle Collision was the best ever. Very professional and the service was speedy. They will always come highly recommended in my book

name: larry jones
text: Poor quality repairs and poor house keeping in shop. Paint started peeling within two weeks and there was runs in paint. Ended up with two before I got home. Which after investigation, the two tires had body panel screws stuck in them.would not recommend or be returning.

name: Elaine Schutte
text: Went to get an estimate and specifically asked for only what would make the car safe to drive as we were paying out of pocket. They then added about $1k of repairs they wanted to do and when I pointed them out and asked if they were specifically necessary to make the car drivable they said no. Went to a different company and got a significantly better estimate

name: Vickie Phillips
text: They did a great job on my moms car!! Thank you to Justin and his team!! Would recommend this place to fix your car.

name: Steven Sheldon
text: Wow.  I came here for just an estimate, but the appraiser looked at my car and said, "Go sit in the waiting room for a minute, I think this will come right off."  I waited a few minutes until he came and got me.  Holy cow!  With a little paint thinner he was able to rub off 99% of the markings left from the bump with the other car!  All that was left was a little dent - nothing worth fixing and especially not on a 9-year-old car.  So they saved me $900 in repairs.  I'll definitely go to Eagle Collision Center if I ever really do need body work!  You just don't find this kind of service these days very much!

name: pamela sanders
text: Good body work

name: jim sanders
text: So service has been spot on, took my car right in, arranged my rental in minutes and if all goes as planned will be back on my vehicle in 10 days.

name: Steven Fanning
text: Took our 2016 pathfinder in for repair and was given an estimate which I was very pleased with to begin with. The car was repaired by the next day and Troy called me and advised it was ready and that one part that was quoted did not need to be replaced. Most shops would have charged for it anyway and not put it on .. It was behind the bumper so I would have never known .Instead they sent the part back and the repair was significantly less .Not only was the repair awesome but they are super honest people . That's hard to find these days .I would highly recommend this shop to anyone needing repair. Thank you for your honesty and awesome work .   Steven F

name: Savannah Brooks
text: Everyone was very nice here and they repaired my car quickly. I needed my car back by a specific time because I had to go to work and their technician stayed late to put my car together once the paint had dried. I thought they had great service and they even cleaned my car up on the outside for me! I would definitely recommend working with them. It was an easy and all around great experience.

name: Lloyd Andrew
text:
I'm from Chicago, IL area and I brought my car down to northern Alabama to get some chassis work done to my street/race car as well as get painted.  Justin and the guys at Eagle Collision Center are the guys who painted my car and I couldn't be happier with how it came out.  There are some fiberglass parts on this car and on the first pass, I felt it could have came out better.  Justin, no questions asked understood where I was coming from and re-did the components and they came out incredible.  Exactly like I was looking for.  And overall, a very reasonable price too.

I would have zero problems bringing my car or another car down for work and/or a paint job and happily endorse Justin and his team's work.

name: Mike Seba
text: Eagle Collision is the best.  I recently took my vintage 1966 Chevelle to them for an all over paint job and the results were spectacular.  The Eagle folks worked with me every step of the way and their attention to detail is amazing.  I highly recommend Eagle Collision and I will certainly go back to them for any project large or small.

text: Do not and I mean do not have Eagle Collision repair your vehicle! I had my bumper repaired there and two weeks after the repair the bumper started detaching from my car. I went up there to get the issue resolved only to be told by the very rude technician that a rock must've cause the bumper to detach. I told the technician if a rock can make the bumper detach then it was not put on correctly. The very rude technician continued to explain to me that it was something I did. I am very dissatisfied with the work and the people who work there. I will never allow Eagle Collision or any one they are affiliated with to work on any of my vehicles again.

Also want to recognize Enterprise Rental Car representative Chelsea Stocks for making this process as painless as possible.  As a result of their efforts, repairs were completed in less than 48 hours just in time for Christmas and my wife's birthday. For top quality work and customer service, I recommend Eagle Collision Center for all your your auto body repairs.
