name: Alison Gentry
text: Wish I could give no stars for the rude sales manager and all five stars to Jonathan the salesman. He should be a manager! Very friendly, understanding, and respectful. We made an offer on a truck that was only $900 less than asking price. We also wanted to know trade in value for current car. Jonathan came back and the manager said he wanted full price of sticker and lowballed $2000 less than what the trade in was worth! Did not even give a counteroffer. We thanked Jonathan and said we would keep an eye out for anything else that came up we might like. Super nice guy. As we were about to get up to leave the manager came over and started yelling at us and bashing us for the offer we made! I was shocked! He kept telling us we had no idea how much the truck was worth. The offer we made was reasonable for the truck. We told him he could not give us the numbers we wanted so we were leaving. Yet he kept yelling at us and trying to tell us we were wrong! Terrible customer service. A manager should not yell at two customers telling us we are wrong because of an offer.

resp.text: Mrs Gentry, We apologize your experience was not to your satisfaction.  We strive to provide excellent customer service to anyone that we have the opportunity to serve.  We always like to learn from our mistakes and improve our service in the future.  Please contact me so we can discuss your visit and we can correct the issue.  skcomatt@gmail.com or 251-343-4488

name: Melanie Shelly
text:
I found the car I love 2018 Nissan Maxima. I live about an hour and a half away so I really love it!  I did all my negotiating via email and set up a test drive appointment. Very, very, easy sale for the company. My biggest disappointment is the fact that the car was filthy when I arrived and the battery terminals were severely corroded. I am convinced nobody from the service department even looked under the hood until I made them.  I wanted the terminals cleaned,  I wanted an oil change,  all fluids topped off and a cabin air filter change (Very minimal requests for a car dealership) I stated it would have to be detailed inside. The detail department worked on it but they would only be there until 12 or 12:30. So we concluded our business (paid cash) and I went to lunch without the car.  Well by the time I got back the headliner was much cleaner but it smelled terribly in the car (like stagnant mop water). Nothing else was even wiped down and unfortunately the detail department was gone. There was sticky crusted disgusting something in all the buttons so some would stick in certain positions. Literally the battery terminal was only brushed with a wire brush to knock off the corrosion. I don't think the oil was changed. When I got home the oil did not appear new. I think they put new on top of the old then they mixed together. The cabin air filter was not changed. I removed it to check because everytime I used recirculated air instead of fresh it smelled bad. It has a new one now and it no longer has an odor.

My salesman was okay, but seriously the easiest commission ever. Wish I would have at least gotten an after the sale phone call. Just to check in. Would have made me feel better about the other issues.

My complaints are only directed to the service and detail departments.

I am now looking for a truck in the $20,000 range (same as my Maxima) and I am not even looking at this company now.

name: Cameron Martin
text:
I was at SKCO Automotive today. I had been there for almost 5 hours. My salesman was actually a nice  man, so i have absolutely nothing bad to say about him.  After going through this ridiculous process of trying to prove my income for 2-3 hours and trying to be put in a car  the finance company wanted me to have. I was exhausted, over it and ready to leave. As if that wasn’t enough, someone decided to make a big deal out of nothing. My children went ahead of me and went to the door. They were holding the door for each other and then was holding it for me, waiting for me to catch up and come out. Before I got to the door they were approached by a lady. She told my children to either go out the door or go find their moma or daddy and they they were letting the air out. I was appalled!! I asked her what was the problem. I asked her name and she mumbled something and I asked her again and she told me she didn’t owe me an explanation!!  Come to find out she was the owner. The salesman walked up to me try to find out what was going on. She began to butt in, so then the gentleman walked me out the door to discuss it. it started to rain, he offered to grab an umbrella for me. We make our way into the building and the owner runs up to the salesman and tells him he is her employee and He better not walk me out the door. How pathetic and nasty can a human be over nothing!!
I’m sick of people  acting ignorant for no reason towards me. So needless to say I left all deals on the table and vowed to make it known that I would never spend a dime with a company that doesn’t value my business or dollar. So it’s above me now!!

And so far from what I hear the cars are junk! A friend of mine bought a van and the alternator went out 2 days after she purchased it.

Oh and if you plan on buying a car using your business name don’t waste your time. Apparently they don’t know how to process those sales!

name: Amanda Unrue
text:
Buying a car wasn't bad.  But they have this policy of holding the spare keys until you pick up your paperwork.  I informed them that I was going to be moving and might not be in town to pick up the spare key.  The guy who was doing my paperwork said that he would mail it to my new address(even though that is apparently against policy).  The paperwork arrived in the mail, but the spare key never did.  I called them back to check the status of that and they are now saying that they have no record of a spare key but that I can bring the car into the dealership, pay them about $400, and they'll make a new key.  So now some random person has the spare key to my car, which I find a little sketch.
**As a side note, it is my opinion that the office manager is incredibly incompetent and rude.

name: James Wilson
text: I came into SKCO Automotive to buy a Nissan Sentra that I seen online. the salesperson, a Mr. Billy Keene, informed me of an issue with this particular car. He showed me evidence that it was in need of service, however minor, before it could be sold. He actually took the car to the service department and fussed at the service manager telling him that, "I have a man here to buy this car and you all could have had this ready a week ago." Billy persisted until the service department took care of the issue. He and I sat while they took care of the issue and I found him to be very astute about all sorts of subjects regarding cars and how financing works. He took time with me he did not have to take. He also made it possible that the car that i wanted was serviced before I left in it a few hours later. I cant say enough about this salesman, and also about the sales manager, a Mr. Joe. The Dealership as a whole was easy to deal with and Billy and Joe were actually able to get me out the door $500 less than the advertised price. If you need a good quality vehicle, i highly recomend SKCO, and really recomend dealing with Billy.

I had scratched up and messed up my bumper (without going into details how), but Bryan from BCR Collision Center fixed it, and it looked like it was brand new! When I went to pick up my car, I almost did not recognized it as he also had it washed. This guy is the best BARNONE! He answers the phone 99.9% of the time! He is honest and very trustworthy. He will tell you what he can and cannot do upfront, he will tell you when he will get it done. Locals know him and will not go to anyone else!
Not sure how one other auto repair shop keeps getting their 5-star reviews, but I, personally has had experiences with that same auto-repair shop (before I found BCR), and I say that the reviews are OPPOSITE of what my experiences were.
BCR Collision's reviews are TRUE. I almost not left a review as I want to keep him for myself LOL, but I believe in giving credit where credit is due.
Thank you Bryan for everything!

text: Brian and his  team did an excellent job repairing the damage to our truck.  They were extremely professional, did excellent work, and worked well with our insurance company.   We will definitely use BCR again if the need arises.

Roger & Gloria

Sad thing is the Geico Supervisor signed off on the repairs with BUBBLES  in the paint job and Ruff texture body work.
Geico Pay Attention!!!
You have the Wrong Company representing you and your Supervisor needs to be Fired!!!
The BEST thing that came out of this deal was finding BCR Collision!!  I didn’t know what to expect when I picked up my Truck after what had happened at Professional Collision.  OMG  I was AESTHETIC when is saw my truck. It looked Brand New! I was So Happy:)These people are the Professionals.
Bryan Thank You So Much for turning something bad into something Amazing.  I Love Your OCD. Lol
The finish on my truck was Immaculate. I love it!
I highly recommend this place and would definitely use them if I ever need another Repair in the future.

name: John Lohin
text: Sharon called me and told me she has a 2020 dry van trailer available. I specifically wanted a 2020 year. She told me she needed a deposit to keep the trailer for me. I sent it to her. She sent me papers to sign for a 2019 trailer, I asked her about it and she kept saying it’s the accounting mistake. They changed the papers to show the year 2020. Before my loan closing, I called her and asked her what’s the company’s name exactly so my bank could make the cashiers check. After I finalized my loan she sent me a bill of sale for a 2019 trailer. I called her and she says it is definitely a 2019. The accounting keeps making a mistake. How did they change my papers to show 2020 from the first place? She told me she could give me $400 off. I said no thanks. I’m not going to pay the same money for a 2019, when a 2019 is a few thousand cheaper than a 2020. Sharon wasn’t honest from the beginning.

text: We haven't been in three years.  It use to be a favorite, but the last time we went was a nightmare.  We arrived for a early meal before the dinner/supper time and we were served food that had been reheated.  When we brought this to the attention of the manager he said it had not been.  I showed him what I meant the coutry-fried steak had a second coating of batter and reheated.  He said no it hasn't.  Both my husband and I showed him our food.  He then says would we like him to get carry-out containers so we could eat at home.  I said no, if we can't eat it here because it inedible what makes you think we'd want to take it home.  He never once apologized or offered to make it right.  We left and decided it would be our last time there.  I emailed corporate, but never heard a word from them.  Truly disappointed.  You don't have a negative star so the one star was all I could leave other than this post.

text: If I could give zero stars I would Tom told me that they were going to pay for my car being towed to their shop from the impound lot. Once I got there and he saw I was black I guessing that’s what he meant by things have changed and now not only do I have to pay lot fees of 30 dollars I also have to pay a 75 dollar towing fee when I could have gotten my car towed there for free using my roadside service. And not only did they tell me it cost to write an estimate but didn’t write one and said that my car was totaled which is untrue because only the left tire was damaged and that was the only sensor showing at the time after the accident. I can’t wait til I get paid to be able to take my car to a real mechanic because I do know a little bit about cars myself and if my car had all the structural damage they claimed it wouldn’t been still in a straight position the tires would have been pushed one way and and the body of my car would have been sitting a whole different way! I don’t understand why he lied but God doesn’t like ugly and I am going to still pray that he be blessed! But be very careful what you do to a child of God’s is all I am going to say because my father in heaven can do much more then I can to this cheat and a liar!

name: Donald Barger
text:
This was a very professional experience! I am amazed at how well Joe Hudson's Collision Center did with my vehicle repair. The car was dropped off on a Monday morning and it was ready on Tuesday afternoon. From the very first interaction until the end, this was an excellent experience. I have had accident repairs done at dealerships and it took nearly a week for a very similar repair.

I was impressed with the communication throughout the process. I received text messages and phone calls several times a day updating me as they went through the different stages of repair. I was given estimates for when the repair would be ready and they were early.

The rental car was provided for me at the location and my drop off was also at the location.

This accident repair occurred during the covid pandemic. Upon entering the office, masks and a sanitation station were provided for customers. The door clearly identified the mask requirement for entering the building. All employees wore masks.

The work provided comes with a lifetime warranty. I was provided with over 20 detailed photos of the teardown of the work performed.

This will be wear I take all of my body work and accident repairs.

name: Shaun Matthews
text: I would highly recommend JHCC. They were very professional and updated me every step of the way and when we went to inspect the vehicle they made sure everything was exactly as we wanted it. They even went above and beyond to fix some damage that was not what we initially came in for. Great quality shop, you won’t be disappointed. Thank you Joe Hudson team, we will be back!

name: Ashley Hendricks
text: My husband and I had to use Joe Hudson’s Collision on two separate occasions following car accidents and we could not be more pleased with the service they provided! They do excellent work and you can tell it’s their passion. From the moment we walked into the door we were always greeted with a smile ( they wore masks but I could tell they were smiling underneath the mask ) from the receptionist to the repair team and they immediately went to work on inspecting our vehicles and starting the repair process. I also like how they keep you abreast by sending email updates as the car progresses through repairs and they use factory parts! They also thoroughly clean and detail your car so that it’s almost like brand new when you pick it up which is so refreshing. I pray that we never get into another automobile wreck but if we do we know exactly where we will take our car for repairs...Joe Hudson’s Collision Center!!

text: Family owned business that was recommended to me by my daughter's boyfriend's father after she wrecked her car one night in the rain. And when we picked it up, just before the holidays, it was spotless, in and out. If the "little things" matter to you, bring your car here.

name: OH KYOMIN
text:
(Translated by Google) * This review is written after tire replacements.

Do NOT replace this in the "Body" shop. Balancing equipment is too old. They do not have Alignment equipment. You have to visit Atlanta to get the alignment service. Owner mechanic has experience but technic.
He can do tire replacement. but does not know how to handle OBD tool.
This body shop does not have paint booth. Do not waste your time, money and gas.
by the way, I am going to visit this store again. Cuz one of 4 new tires has vibration. XD

For Korean customer,
April 19, 4 pairs of tires and four pairs of TPMS (air pressure sensor). Total $ 830.
I had a good tire replacement. Air leak Check well and balance well, old machine, accuracy is lower than latest equipment. Go to a place you can trust in luxury cars with run-flat tires.

Except for spare parts! TMPS is installed and the coding cost is only $ 160. The TPMS tool you own is TS501 ($ 200)
Failing to code a new sensor in the car.
The OEM sensor is a problem. If it is a car problem, refuse the refund,
Forcibly reset the alarm with OBD tool and exit.
The next day, of course, the warning light comes on again.

I visited again and invited you to do it myself, and I was impressed by the video below. "Come on, now, if you wake up again, study again."

I am doing manual BRZ self-maintenance.
We are working on engine oil, mission oil, intake filter, kevin filter, brake pad, liner, brake fluid, coolant flush, spark plug, manual clutch pad, various lights, rear camera,
The tire was not able to be removed without equipment, so I visited the shop.

The most inexpensive but safe way of replacing tires through advanced experience,
1. Purchase tires directly online or through warehouse marts
2. Equipped with tires in place operated by Mexican people ($ 10 each)
3. Balance and alignment in the latest equipment shop.

Pros: The impression of the boss. Hours of leisure available.
Disadvantages: old and poor equipment, technological power behind the speed of automobile development, and the ridiculously expensive price.

(Original)
*This review is written after tire replacements.

Do NOT replace tire in this "Body" shop. Balancing equipment is too old. they doesn't have Alignment equipment. You have to visit Atlanta store to get alignment service. Owner mechanic has experience but technic.
He can do tire replacement. but doesn't know how to handle OBD tool.
this body shop doesn't have paint booth. Do not wast your time, money and gas.
by the way, I am going to visit this store again. Cuz one of 4 new tire has vibration. XD

For Korean customer,
19년 4월 타이어 4짝과 TPMS(공기압센서) 4짝 교체. 총 $830.
타이어교체는 잘해주셨습니다. Air leak 확인 잘해주시고, 밸런스도 잘 해주셨는데 구형 기계라 정확도는 최신장비보다 떨어집니다. 런플렛 타이어를 끼고있는 고급차는 꼭 믿을만한 곳으로 가세요.

부품비 빼고! TMPS 장착, 코딩 비용으로만 $160 드림.보유중인 TPMS툴은 TS501($200)
새로운 센서를 자동차에 코딩을 해야하는데 실패하심.
OEM센서가 문제다. 자동차 문제다라며, 환불을 거부하시고,
OBD tool로 경고등 강제 리셋하고 출차 시키심.
다음날 당연히 다시 경고등 들어옴.

다시 방문하여 제가 직접 방법을 권유하였고, 아래 동영상과 같이 인상깊은 말씀을 하셨습니다. "이제함 타봐. 또 뜨면 또와, 연구해"

저는 수동BRZ를 자가 정비를 하고있습니다.
엔진오일, 미션오일, 인테이크 필터, 케빈필터, 브레이크 패드, 라이너, 브레이크액, 냉각수 플러시, 스파크 플러그, 수동클러치  패드, 각종 라이트, 후방카메라, 블박매립 등의 작업을 하고있습니다만,
타이어는 장비없이 탈착이 불가능해 샵을 방문 하였습니다.

앞선 경험을 통한 타이어 교체의 가장 저렴하지만 안전한 방법은,
1. 직접 온라인이나, 창고형마트를 통해 타이어구매
2. 멕시칸분이 운영하는곳에서 타이어 장착(개당 $10)
3. 최신 설비를 가진 샵에서 발란스 및 얼라이먼트.

장점: 사장님의 인자한 인상. 여유있는 영업시간.
단점: 노후되고 부실한 장비, 자동차 발전하는 속도에 뒤쳐지는 기술력, 그에 비해 터무니없이 비싼 가격.

resp.text: Hello Taylor, my name is Linda I am one of the owners at Mr T's. I would like to speak to you concerning your experience but I can't find any information in your name. May I ask if your vehicle is your name or some one else's ? What make and model is it and what repair did we do? Without any information I can't address your issue. Can I ask that you please call me personally at 205-786-8279? I want you to know I am very sorry about this and  interested in listening to what happened directly from you. Please call me.

text: I usually don't write reviews but Mr T got me out of a bind when my boat trailer came loose off 59. The axle was bent and I slowly crawled off the exit to his shop. Thank you, Mr T!

resp.text: Thank you, Jonathan for taking the time to leave us a review! We're always happy to help a lending hand to customers in need, as we know how scary and frustrating a situation like that can be. Thank you again for your kind words, and for visiting Mr. T's Automotive!

name: Sharlene Brown
text: Received car back with missing parts, drove car home and parked it.  Two days later drove it and it broke down while driving it after I paid $1700.00 for it to be repaired. Was told it was the engine why wasn't that found when the $1700.00 work was done?????

resp.text: Thank you Sharlene for taking the time to leave us your feedback! On April 4th we put a rack and pinion steering sector and a power steering pump on your car. Your timing chain broke, there is no way to predict that the timing chain is going to break. It is always a good idea to replace it when recommended by the manufacturer so that it doesn't break and destroy the motor.

name: Pam Steele
text: I am at Mr T’s shop with my daughter and the manner of communication given to my daughter by an employee was unprofessional i.e. talking about her hair and children; stating that he understands why her hair is “glued on” since she has so many children. when we returned immediately after picking up her car because of engine light being on he stated well you might as well get it fixed too since you have your income tax money......very rude and appears to have an set opinion of certain people. Know this; all people of color are not ignorant to employee’s or employers who  apparently  do not have their facts or business etiquette in order. We are waiting outside over an hour for wiring to sensor to correct check engine light. I have had to cancel my business appointments today by the way is how we paid for this fiasco. Such a bad way to earn business from customers however they choose to pay

resp.text: Ms Grant, I am very sorry that you were offended that certainly was not my intention. Let me first say that I am not a racist person, my business would not have survived 30 plus years in a predominately black community if I was. I try to treat my customers like family or at  least like a close friend without the thought that some people may take offense to it. I often come into the lobby and interact with my customers, mostly to let them know they are more to me than just a dollar. I believe that most appreciate that or I wouldn't have been here as long as I have. My business is built on word of mouth from family member to family member, friends to friends then coworkers and others. I know the majority of my customers by name, I know their spouses, mothers and fathers, sisters and brothers and their children. Again, I apologize for offending you and I truly hope that I have not lost your daughters business through this misunderstanding.

name: Doyle Bright
text:
Mr T's automotive strives to satisfy the customer Matt Tortorici is very knowledgeable he has been working with cars and building engines from back in the mid 70's .  I had a coolant leakage problem with my GMC 1500 Sierria 5.3 liter Truck.  GM used defective castech heads casting#706 from 2002 thru 2007 they were made in China. The heads will crack at the head bolts causing coolant to leak into engine. GM would not fix the Issue and had multiple other shops in the Birmingham area try and repair the same old casting 706 and it would last for around 60k miles and crack again.  We put casting 243 heads on my 2002 5.3 liter
and so far so good it seems to have lost little low end but picked up some upper end power. Matt went over everything with me and even steamed cleaned my engine also repaired my AC.  I highly recommend Mr T's / Matt Tortorici he didi exceleent job on my Truck.. MShelto

My Mechanic is on vacation, waiting for parts to arrive, dealing with a warranty issue etc. However none of this explains why it took 3 months to render repairs, why were there services on my invoice that had not been performed on my vehicle and why my vehicle is not in drivable condition today. When this issue was presented to the business owner instead of him treating a paying consumer with respect, I was met with, anger, frustration, he himself had a lack of understanding, unwillingness to explain, lack of empathy. Robbers.  I am going to report this place to the Better Business Bureau..  cause they need to be  shut down now he want me to spend $400  on a computer. Why  all of a sudden my computer is bad.. it was nothing wrong with my computer before I took it up there to you guys..they will call you with bad news after news.what they will give you. resp.text:
Do you know the legal liability you have imposed on yourself by posting a malicious business review with a fake Google account? You should look it up. With that said here is our reply to your review.
I am sorry you are having an issue after the repair but an engine replacement is just that, the engine along with any extra parts that we felt were questionable and they are listed on your invoice. There is not an ECM on your invoice. Please keep in mind that there are several other things under the hood of your car that can also cause future problems. Unfortunately we are not able to detect a component such as an ECM, starter, alternator, Oxygen Sensor, Injector and so on that is about to go bad, it is just impossible. Your vehicle is 11 years old and does have 175,000 miles on and usually parts and components will begin to fail and need replacing after 10 years. This ECM is not covered under warranty because we did not replace this part and it does not come with an engine. I have copied and pasted some information for you that came from a site called my mechanic explaining the ECM’s function to your car. We have ordered the ECM, as you know, and as soon as it is installed and the car is test drove we will call you.
Here is some information that I pulled from the site "My Mechanic" that may help you better understand an ECM's function.
The engine control module (ECM), also commonly referred to as the engine control unit (ECU) or powertrain control module (PCM), is one of the most important components found on virtually all  vehicles. It essentially functions as the main computer for many of the vehicle’s engine performance and drivability functions. The ECM takes the information from the engine's various sensors and uses that information to calculate and tune engine spark and fuel for maximum power and efficiency. Erratic engine behavior also indicates a bad or failing ECM. A faulty computer may cause the vehicle to intermittently stall or misfire. The symptoms might come and go and not appear to have any sort of pattern to their frequency or severity. The ECM plays a vital role in engine performance. Any issues with it can cause major problems with the overall functionality of the car.

name: Soul Jah
text:
WARNING! WARNING! ...Avoid at all cost!! This business is not what they claim they are. My P30 Step Van was towed in to get a refreshing and almost had to be towed away. I heard their ad on the radio, gave them a call and found out they service Cintas vans. I spoke to the owner Matt on the phone and he assured me that he was the place to come to and he would take care of me. I told him what I wanted done, I also left a list with the most important to be taken care of first (fuel tank leak and master cylinder replacement) with the receptionist. I mentioned new tires but didn’t decide what to install, but he did, and installed them without my consent. Later he said he thought that’s what I wanted “the cheap ones.” He decided to do what he wanted and void my concerns (that I spoke of on every visit). I was charged over $400.00 in parts (radiator, v belt and lug nuts) plus labor @ $74/hour added without my consent nor were they spoken of when I made payments in person. I was charged ($35.00) for an air cleaner that he had left from a previous vehicle and promised that he wouldn’t charge me for since I was getting so much work done. That Monday of week three, I stopped by to realize no work had been done over the past 5 days and I immediately stopped the work and told them I would be back in the morning to pick up and pay off balance. Next morning I waited over and hour for the motor to be pressure washed like he promised it would be done yesterday by lunch. While waiting he then decided that he would for free replace the master cylinder and patch the fuel tank leak with a $6.00 putty instead of replacing the tank like I asked on day one. All while repairs being done there were no actual receipt/list of parts and labor but guesstimations made until I made final payment. After I reviewed the receipt just before I paid the remaining $1,400+ balance I had to request that Matt break down and fix the double charges on receipt (I was so angry that I missed a few issues on the receipt). A week turned into a month and if I had not stopped the work there’s no telling how long it would have taken to get the van back. Now I’m weeks behind schedule on preparing for the van for body work and getting it wrapped.   The total cost was $3,863.68 and $1,417.25 of it was labor. I felt robbed and played. This place is not worthy of your money and will waste your time…. so please be advised! You are WARNED!!
CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS

H Russell Adair II
White 1984 Chevrolet P30 Step Van

P.S.
I was charged $30.00 for brake fluid even though he knew the master cylinder was bad. I realized this after I paid. Also, the paper work was drawn up and balance paid before he decided to replace master cylinder.
Matt told me the only man allowed to work on my vehicle had taken off several days due to court date and illness hence why the time frame was pushed back.
He spoke negatively about customers in front of me while they were on hold with the receptionist who also was not professional.

Considering you had just purchased it, and it was a 1984, you didn’t know how well it was maintained hence lots of wear and tear does equal extensive repairs. Again we are very sorry and would like the opportunity to speak with you. Please call us at 205-786-8279. Thanks.

name: Carrie Williams
text: Trussville Collision went above and beyond fixing my husband’s car! They did more than asked and the car looks brand new. Kim was great and stayed in contact with me during the whole process. Definitely recommend them!!

name: Trey
text: Fair prices, very professional and car looks great!

name: Micah Malkove
text:
Find another body shop! They drilled holes into my brand new $3200 front end because "There were holes in the old bumper, so we made holes in the new one". Wow, how awful. I have a 2013 Lexus GS F-Sport. It originally came from Tx where they require ugly front tags, fortunately in Alabama we do not, but to cover up the old holes the guy before me added a little Lexus vanity plate. So after the accident instead of asking me or just leaving the bent up old plate. They drilled holes into my brand new painted bumper to add a very dented up, paint now peeling off, vanity plate that I never wanted. You can always add it, you can't un-drill the holes, why would they do that? My guess is that they charged my insurance company for a new OEM part at top dollar (verified) and instead put a used part that already had the holes, and so to cover it up they put the previous owner's old dented up vanity tag back on...Thanks for the $3200 of body work.
On top of that,  To start with Jim gave me an estimate for the front end damage for my car that was $1300 (ended up $3200, no big deal), and told me that if I got it done there he could fix the little golf ball sized dent in the back for me as part of it since it was small. But after they ended up finding $3200 they later told me that they could not add that dent in because they were already to tight on the project. I could get it out for $300, I just got a quote down the road and they said they will remove it for $100 and that would be pretty standard anywhere.
So to recap, they drilled holes into the brand new bumper that I did not want there and didn't remove the dent in the back that the estimator said he would have included. Then asked for more than going rate to have a third party dent puller fix it with them marking it up at least 1/3.
They get 2 stars because the work that is done looks pretty clean. But I chose this place over a State Farm approved body shop because I believed Jim would take care of me and the extra dent, well I don't feel taken care of at all.

name: Dalyn Deliz
text: Did an amazing job on my 97 gmc. My truck does have a few dents and pain chips all around the truck from other things, but where they were fixing it it looks brand new! The paint match is incredible. Would highly recommend going here

name: Deboraa Baud
text: I recently had the rear bumper and lift gate replaced due to a minor accident.  The replaced parts are excellent.  Great quality work.  And not only did the staff detail the complete interior and exterior, they even salvaged my Texas Longhorn decal from the damaged lift gate and placed in on the new lift gate!  THAT is excellent, beyond level of satisfaction in my book!  I was prepared to have to replace that decal myself.  I am a very happy camper.

name: Q B
text: Overall, Very Great Experience from the time I dropped my vehicle off for collision repairs til finish , the service was rapid and my car looked amazing.. Thanks Jim and your staff!!!!

text: Amazing work and wonderful customer service! The staff regularly called me with updates about my vehicle, dealt with insurance as quickly as possible, and completed the work on my car within 5 days of me dropping it off! Also, I picked up my vehicle and it had been cleaned inside and out! If we have any trouble with other vehicles in the future we will definitely be using Trussville Collision.

text: Trussville collision is amazing! I had a car problem that needed to be fixed by days end due to family reasons and they helped me so I could get home to be with my family. I called many places and no one was as nice or eager to help as they were. I cannot thank them enough. And the work done was great. I have no complains!

I've had 2 vehicles that had to be worked on and both look like they had never been in an accident.  If you need any body work use these guys!

Byron - Chad - Michelle & all the auto body technicians went above & beyond my expectations in repairing  extensive body damage to my 2005 GMC Sierra pick-up.
I had hit a deer & my pick-up was within an inch of being totaled . Byron put me in a
great car to drive while they put my truck back into "like brand New " condition.
I will be recommending Trussville Collision to all my Family & Friends .

text: The Owner was up front with me, even though the time to get the car fix was past the deadline, I still knew they were concerned.  The fact they called me back to let me know the problems they encountered, helped me to understand where the issues were.  80 percent of my problems was the insurance claims department, they were not very reliable and efficient. Have used CCM for several years.  Often initial estimate is just that!  Once they dig into the full extend of damage it takes longer to receive replacement parts, complete repairs, and deal with insurance companies.

If you want something quick and less than accurate, go somewhere else, this place focuses on repairing your vehicle to showroom quality.

Best shop around hands down!

name: Scott Halpern
text: Recently purchased my wife a 2015 Mercedes-Benz SL550 Diamond White Metallic with Bengal Red leather and only 7200 miles on it out of Miami.  When it arrived to Nashville there were a few issues I needed but knew that there were maybe 3 places in the country that could match the 3 stage Diamond White metallic paint. I went on the Mercedes-Benz forums and 11 different Mercedes owners replied to my forum post and told me to send the car only to Classic Car Motoring down in Birmingham AL.  Just got it back and I am stunned I have never seen better paint work on an automobile in my life!  They answer their phone immediately, return calls when there are questions and the level of service is beyond compare. Polite, courteous and responsive. I was amazed start to finish!

name: Drew Chambers
text: The most professional shop the place looks like a showroom all employees are very professional al work is perfect will use again

resp.text: Thank you for your review!

name: Samantha Hays
text: I had damage to my car and claimed insurance. When I was given an option as to which body shop to get the body work completed by, Crown Automotive referred me to Classic Car Motoring. When I found out their credentials, I knew this was the place to go! From the moment I first contacted the office, everyone I spoke to was very professional and warm, listening to my requests and making sure that they understood what needed to be done and what my expectations were. When I came to pick up my car, it was good as new! The process was as painless as possible, and everyone was quick to answer my questions and offer advice on care. I will be happy to come back for any future work on my car (which I hope won't be necessary!) as well as getting it detailed. I couldn't be happier with the results!

name: Jc Chandler
text: Perfect place for the car to look better than factory. Love the people.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear about your positive experience.

name: Vince Webb
text: Easily the best experience I've ever had with any body shop.  The people were super nice and helped me fix a minor problem, whereas every other shop wanted to replace my entire bumper and charge me $2000.  These guys found a scrap part my bumper was missing, screwed it on and told me don't worry about it--"happy to help, and just keep us in mind if you ever need anything else."  I cannot recommend this place highly enough.

name: Olivia Donaldson
text:
I recently purchased a used Mercedes which needed repair, after discovering that there was a gap around the back tailgate.  There was a car fax on the car at time of purchase and my guess is it was never repaired properly by the previous body shop.  It was hard to see, so I did not notice at the time of purchase beause the car was otherwise in great condition, inside and out.  We were told about Classic Car after taking our car to the Irondale Mercedes dealership, who informed us that was the only certified Mercedes body shop in Birmingham.  Our tailgate was repaired perfectly and at a very good cost by Classic Car Motoring!  I could not be more pleased.

Fast forward, a couple of months later, and someone tried to "pry" the back door open while I was shopping in the Hoover area.  I did not notice this until one day it rained and I saw a leak.  I took the car the next day to Chris Baggett at Classic Car, fully expecting to leave it and get a repair bill.  But Chris said, "oh I think I can do this myself right now."  He applied just the right amount of pressure several times to the door using his body weight and strength until the door eventually molded back to the door frame.  He said the doors were made to be somewhat flexible.  My husband and I were shocked and he would NOT LET US PAY HIM ANYTHING.  Now, folks, you know it is rare to find service like that in the world we all live in today, and I was not only shocked but extremely grateful!  Thank you Classic Car not only for the outstanding body work you perform, but for your honestly and integrity!

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We are happy for the positive outcome in this situation. Please let us know if we can be of further assistance.

name: Kermit Earl Pleasant
text:
I took my Mercedes Benz there for an estimate...I found the atmosphere to be
other that warm. The reception was quite frigid. I am a black male, 63years old. I will not return. I hear that they do great work, but I didn't feel welcome there.

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out to us to let us know you were less then satisfied with your visit. We would like to know what happened and how we failed to meet your expectations. Please call me directly, Chris Baggett, at 205-841-2153.

text: The staff was awesome. There were so many beautiful cars there.

Hands down the best work, quality, customer service and class of any company experience I have ever had! I have been dealing with Chris and his outstanding team for years with outstanding results.

Jack Barefield
Extremely Satisfied Long Term Customer

text: Truly exceptional quality. Working with Chris and Josh is more like working with a museum than working with a repair or body shop, and they treat vehicles more like pieces of art than cars. In the last year Classic Car Motoring has worked on both my AMG Mercedes as well as my classic truck and I couldn't be more pleased. Whether modern or classic, exotic or daily driver, if you want as-new perfection, their work is the best. I send family and friends to them as well with complete confidence, the highest compliment I can give. Just a walk around their shop demonstrates the the precision you should expect.

name: Tim Perley
text: Absolute attention to detail. Fit and finish excellent. The place if you want the best.  I just picked up my MB and it is flawless. Thanks

text: Everyone was professional, helpful and friendly. Work on my car was phenomenal. I was beyond impressed with their service. This is absolutely the place to bring your vehicle.

text: I wouldn't even consider taking my Mercedes anywhere else in Bham but Classic Car Motoring.  If you own a Mercedes, or any luxury car for that matter, and you take it somewhere else that pretends to know how to work on, paint, repair, upgrade...a high end vehicle in a manner that is deserving of the Brand that you have then you are making a mistake.  You didn't go cheap when you bought the car so don't go cheap when you keep your car going.  I've had Chris and his guys work on 3 Mercedes's that I've owned including my current S550 that has a Matte paint job and have been thrilled with the results.

They set an appointment for me to bring it back then had the work done in 2 1/2 days.  Not only was the exterior perfect but they detailed the interior as well.  I have offered to PAY my children to do it and Joe Hudson’s did is without me asking multiple times

text: These guys are the best. Not only did our car look amazing but the service was outstanding. In a world where it is hard to find people that care it was so refreshing to deal with Mark, Rebecca and Dave. They take great care of you on every step. You will be glad you picked this shop.

First and foremost the repair made to my Silverado is impeccable and the paint perfectly matches my 4 yr old 1500.

The staff kept me up to date on every aspect of the repair and completed the project on time.

Could not be happier with JHCC !!

name: Courtney Bryars
text: The staff at Joe Hudson’s couldn’t be more helpful, understanding, or professional. After my car was hit, they were the only pleasant people to work with in the whole ordeal. On top of doing an excellent job on my repairs, they went above and beyond by fixing other small things that I was concerned about, when they had no obligation to do so. I hope to not have to deal with something like this again, but I can without a doubt say if I do, this is absolutely where I will be taking my car!

resp.text: Thank you very much. We appreciate the positive feedback. If you ever need us again, we are here to help.

name: Wanda Jost
text: They have awesome customer service, very friendly, professional, and the work they do is great!!! I have had to use them 2 times  in 2 years and been more than satisfied. I recommend them to every one o know they stand behind their work. Great people also they do keep you updated.

name: Marc Livingston
text:
We were hit from behind with damage to only the rear bumper and tow package. I didn't have to have the repair work done immediately but I got Joe Hudson's to do the estimate within a few days and then waited on the insurance company. I received a couple of calls from Joe Hudson's to check on my status. They were understanding and patient.

I turned my truck in to Joe Hudson's early one morning. I received regular updates on the status of the repair. Mid-afternoon, the called to say my truck was ready. When I picked up the truck, it looked amazing as if nothing bad had ever happened to it. They also gave her a good washing!

Everyone I dealt with was incredibly helpful, polite and friendly. The repair work was top-notch. I couldn't ask for a better repair experience.

name: Michelle Langley
text: I was totally impressed with Joe Hudson Collision Center. They sent me multiple emails updating me on what stage of the repair my car was in daily, had it done quicker than I expected,  and to top it off, detailed the INSIDE and OUTSIDE of my vehicle before returning it to me. Should the need arise in the future, I will take my car nowhere else but Joe Hudson's! Very professional and courteous, too!

name: Dreama Schofield
text: I took my 2018 car with 12,000 miles in for minor repairs caused by backing into a pole going less than 5 mph. Mark, the manager, told me that my axle was bent and needed to be replaced. When I said that didn't make sense he said he was going to "educate" me and my husband about axles. I demanded that my car be looked at by the dealership  before proceeding. The dealership determined that the axle was fine. I'm not sure if the manager is incompetent or if he was trying to get extra money out of the insurance. Either way, I won't be back!

name: Tessi Center
text: We are completely satisfied with the collision work we had at Joe Hudson Collision Center in Daphne, AL. JHCC exceeded our expectations in every area of customer service.  They kept us informed about the progress of the work, our vehicle was ready before the promised day/time. We would highly recommend JHCC!

name: Nate Holland
text:
Very poor customer service, definitely won't be back ever.

Dropped by here on a lunch break to get an estimate on some repairs. Was informed by a somewhat rude receptionist that couldn't understand why I would think they offered walk-in estimates like every other body shop, that this wasn't an option. Despite their next "appointment" being a mere 20 minutes away, there was no attempt made to accommodate in any way.

I left immediately and had an estimate in hand in less than 15 minutes from another very friendly local shop down the road.

name: Jack McInnis
text:
This was my second visit to Joe Hudson repair and I experienced the same excellent service.
The repairs made on my vehicle are perfect. If you didn’t know that I had work done on my car you would swear that everything was original equipment.

I’ll always use Joe Hudson collision repair shop for any repair required on my vehicles.

resp.text: Thank you for the positive review. We appreciate your business.

name: Janice Hillman
text: From the day I contacted Joe Hudson Collision Center, l felt as though I was dealing with a family owned business.  Their estimate and repair processes were very clearly explained and completed as stated. I have an older vehicle, but when the work was completed, it looked like new. Thank you to the entire team at Joe Hudson in Daphne, Alabama!

name: Bobby Johnson
text: They did a great job and kept me informed on everything they doing

name: mary miljak
text: Joe Hudson is a first rate business. Everyone is intrested in the costume and providing good work

name: Nickie Olson
text: They were excellent in keeping me informed of the repairs every step of the way.  The finish was beautiful! I only wish they would have asked me about the other little dings and touching up them for an additional charge since the car was already out of service.

name: Lisa House
text: The customer service was great! Both ladies who worked in the office were helpful and friendly. My car looked great and I loved the text status on the step by step process of  when my car repairs would be complete. Thank you

name: Stacy Maddox
text: The whole process was handled very professionally.  Appointments were scheduled on time and I was notified at each step on the progress of my repair. I could even look online to see the status of my repair whenever I wanted. They cleaned my car before returning it to me and the repairs were done properly. I will use them again if I ever need another repair.

name: Aliyah Collins
text: Joe Hudson's staff was professional, efficient and very courteous. I am very pleased with the quick and detailed work done to my car. They went above and beyond to make sure my car looked like it had never been involved in an accident. Awesome job!!!!!

name: James Bolden
text: Great customer service and vehicle looked and drove as good as new.

name: Paige Whatley
text: Derek, the manager, is very difficult to contact. He told us he would have my car door part painted within a week. When it wasn’t done, Derek claimed a car dealership brought in cars for repair and he was behind. Obviously, regular customers aren’t as important. The dealerships get priority there. Derek took my car part to someone else for repair ( guess they weren’t talented enough to paint a door)and my car part was picked up to be recycled without any contact with us or our permission. We had to make several trips to Joe Hudson and many calls to Derek before the truth finally came out. We had to be paid for the car part they scrapped. I would not recommend this company to anyone. We have certainly gotten the run around.

name: Norman Roman
text:
Great service at Joe Hudson in Daphne, AL. My vehicle was delivered when promised and they kept me informed throughout the process.

If I had to get body work done, I would always choose Joe Hudson in Daphne. Thanks to everyone there.

text: Amazing, first class, customer service!!!  I was extremely impressed!

name: Angel Overton
text: Everyone was very friendly and my repairs were completed quickly!

text: I had a really good experience. The customer update page kept me abreast of every step of the process and explained what each process consisted of. In the end my car looked really good!!

text: They do a great job.

name: Hayley Maulsby
text: They were the nicest people I’ve ever had the pleasure of meeting at a car repair place!  So professional and efficient, my car looks brand new!

name: Jim Beck
text: I had the best experience ever in getting my car repaired in a timely fashion.  Customer service and quality of work were exceptional.   We need more businesses in America like this one!

name: Jim Craig
text: Repairs on my vehicle were so well done, I cannot see any evidence of the accident damage remaining.  Dave's estimate was accurate, except for the replacement of the rear door latch.  Kudos to Rebecca for staying a while longer on Friday so I could pick up my van without having to wait until the following Monday.

name: Meredith G
text: The customer service and quality of work are both incredible. They went above and beyond for me. I highly recommend!

name: Melissa Engelke
text: Service was excellent. Repairs look perfect. People were helpful and just lovely (thanks, Dave!). I particularly appreciated the automated updating system. Thank you.

name: dfordt
text:
Not good at all!! They did cheating. They charged extra money $$$ without doing anything.
We recommend not to go there!!!!
Not good service

resp.text: We literally did everything we could to make this customer happy. There is a language and cultural barrier that is preventing him from understanding what we replaced as well as why we replaced it. We have all of our paperwork to prove what had to be replaced as well as the cost of that piece. In trying to help him understand we spoke with him numerous times as well as put the vehicle on the lift so we could physically point out to him what had to be done. The repairs were done with great care and precision and our customer care with him went beyond what was expected in trying to help him understand.

name: Rob Lewis
text: My fiancé had work done on her car and the work was done awesome, but there was a small issue with the manager... When picking the car up,  he seemed to be slurring a bit and told us to hold on... He went and got someone else to bring her the car... It seemed as if the manager was on something or not all there.. When we asked questions prior to receiving the car, he had no answers for us... It  was a really weird situation for the both of us. This company came highly recommended to us, but it seemed as if the front office/manager  didn’t know anything!!

name: Wanda Chastang
text: Awesome. Everyone was so helpful and they kept me informed every step of the way. I will not hesitate to recommend them to anyone I know who needs them.

name: Greg Dunn
text:
The front desk clerk was friendly and efficient. The  cost estimator was courteous and detailed.  The update emails were helpful. It seems that once the vehicle is transferred to the service staff, the estimator looses contact and or control. To me the estimator is the representative to the customer and should be involved in the entire process and have the final call on the quality of the service.  I assume this is not the case.  Upon arrival to pick up my vehicle I paid the balance due on the invoice and listened to the rehearsed verbiage on pleasing the customer, before my vehicle was brought up to view.  Immediately I noticed a severe flaw in the paint job (peeling) and a flaw in the chrome grill....obviously there was no quality control involved in my situation.  When I pointed out the issues, they were quickly noted and apologies were made. The vehicle was taken back to service.  After a week plus of no updates....I guess the email/text updates are not for correcting mistakes made....I contacted the office and I felt like the forgotten customer.  An update could not be shared and It seemed I had to remind them who I was.  They did kindly offer to get back with me.  I appreciated that and maybe my feelings, of not being on the TOP of the list of importance, are not warranted. I do feel I pre paid for a service not completed properly. Please understand I am not in a hurry, I just want the car returned in perfect order, with all the issues that were verbally discussed, completely resolved (to include an irritating noise caused by the accident).  I am patiently waiting.  I do not feel that what happened to me is the standard of service, but it did happen this one time. I would recommend and would use again.
Thank you.

name: Chris Wiber
text: One star because you have to leave one to leave a review. I took my truck to Joe Hudson 4 times for the same repair and the issue was still unresolved. When I returned for the fifth time they said I would need to take it somewhere else. This is after they received nearly  $3000 dollars for a job they failed to complete. I have since spoken with other people in our community who had similar horror stories with this company. DO NOT take your vehicle to Joe Hudson for repairs.

name: Steve Brooks
text: Great place. kept me informed throughout the process. I will recommend them to others

text: I am very pleased with the outcome and repairs of my vehicle.The entire staff welcomed me with great smiles and concerns.They kept me posted by calls,texts,&emails daily about my repairs.They had my car ready today as scheduled.I recommend this Team to everyone.

name: B J
text: They fixed the damage on my car 4 days earlier than my expected pick up date. Only reason why I chose to write a review. They are fast.

name: Larry Lewis
text: Excellent customer service. Very satisfied with the repair, it looks like new.

name: Jim Unger
text:
I just had my pride and joy, Cadillac SRX, repaired here from a front end collision. Nobody was hurt but my poor cadi. I can tell you I am the most picky person there is when it comes to my cars. I have 5. You could say it's my hobby and passion.
The staff here was the most professional and nice people I have had dealing with in a very long time. I can't say enough about the front desk staff(I think it was Ronda) and the estimator. I don't remember her name. Sorry. I went in to pick up my car totally in a bad mood expecting to find at least 1 blemish to raise $&@@ about but I'll tell you there work was nest to perfect. I know what to look for. I have been restoring cars and done plenty of body work in my day and still do. There work is a 10 out of 10. If not , they will do whatever it takes to make you happy. I left there feeling very good about the experience.
Now, like everything, you get what you pay for. Everyone knows that. Everyone has had a time when you wish you had just paid a professional and not a back yard weekend warier. They are not the cheapest but I will promise you it will be worth the extra few bucks.. I will definitely use them again but hopefully I won't have too. Lol

name: Erica Thomas
text:
The absolutely worst atmosphere I have ever experienced in retail.  The service person who didn't even bother to introduce himself looked at me as if I was speaking a different language and didn't seem to understand the internet claims procedure.  These other comments here that compliment this place on it's courteousness have got to be a joke.  I left immediately and went down the street to Jubilee and was told that I was like the 10th person this week that said the same thing about Hudson! This is a small community Hudson, but you are not the only service center here, and I can not imagine anyone bringing their business to your facility!

Horrible!!!

resp.text: Not only did we not repair Ms Thomas’s vehicle, we did not even do an estimate on her vehicle. Ms Thomas did come by for an estimate but we choose not to do one because of how she acted and some things that she said. We supported her idea of going to another shop to handle her repairs.

name: Liquid Shine Pressure Washing
text: Lucassens Body shop is the best body shop in Baldwin Co.  Walter, I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart for the hard work, diligent effort, and, knowledge to find the problem with my car that 15 mechanics before you could not.  The hours that have been put into this car is embarrassing to be completely honest, and you Walter found a 7mm difference in 7 hours that they all missed. That may not seem like much toany of you... But after the 10 pain staking months of driving an unsafe vehicle I literally owe my peice of mind to this man. I wish there was a way to repay what he did for me. I wish he could really understand the gravity of what he did for my family and I .Doug, I want to thank you for being so informative and kind. All in all, if you need a body shop make sure you choose wisley. Your insurance is not on your side until you make a point, and let me tell you have many hours I have spent trying to make it to the top of that. The amount of energy and stress that you all took from me is unexplainable. You will be seeing me regular with cakes and pies and my forever refferals  Thanks to you all for being people I will always trust .

text: I took my Escalade to the service dept to get work done on it. They miss diagnosed it and I paid over $500.00 for repair. I had my truck 2 days before it started doing the same thing again. I called to let them know and got the vehicle back over to them. They had my truck a little over a week and claim it was not doing anything for them and that it was old codes showing up. Well since I have had my vehicle back it once again started doing the same thing showing up the same codes. I decided to take it to another dealership and to my surprise the codes that they told me was old was not old they just cleared them instead of fixing my truck. I'm very upset because they repeatedly lied to me over and over. I will not recommend the service dept at all. They just played around with my truck and I called to let Myla know that it was doing the same thing again and that I took it to another dealership and they showed me how codes had been cleared and showed me the history codes. She stated Christian the service manager would call me but he never did.

Before leaving me with my new car, he explained again how to use the features in the car.  In closing, it is obvious that Rodney enjoys selling cars and making his customers happy.

name: Nicholas Williams
text: I purchased a vehicle from this dealership in Jan 2021. I came from out of state to pick up the vehicle and when I arrived found out there was an issue with the vehicle. After waiting for a while we worked out  a fixed for the issues and the dealer said they would send a check to me for the repairs. It took almost two weeks for them to finally send the check to me.  Now over a month after I purchased the vehicle I get a message from my county tag office saying that the dealership didn't pay the Tag fe and I will have to come in and pay it.  If a dealer is not going to pay these fees, they need to let people know so your not waiting until the temporary tags run out.

Nicholas, I am very sorry to hear that we weren’t able to provide you with the best experience possible. I have passed this information on to the General Manager and he will be reaching out to you. We appreciate your feedback and can only improve because of it!

Haley H.
Marketing/PR Manager

name: Katy McGehee
text:
The service department is the best I've ever encountered. They have gone above and beyond every single time. I'm not a crying person but they've made me cry twice. The good cry. The first time: I assume they saw the toy factory and smashed snacks in the carpet or maybe it was my food covered shirt and crazy hair. Either way, they gave me a note of encouragement that every mom needs sometimes with a gift card for coffee. The second time: I requested a larger loaner vehicle which is apparently hard to come by. Along with my 3 kids, my dad is in a wheelchair and I transport him to/from dialysis and we just all wouldn't fit in the smaller one. They greeted me with a "one tough cookie" box with treats and snacks galore.

They are the nicest people and so accommodating. Add uplifting to that mix. That was this exhausted Mama's gift from heaven.

I can't say enough good things about them. I would buy every vehicle from them a thousand times over just to show my appreciation to their service department. Thanks guys!

name: Veronica Eaton
text: I was due for an oil change for my 2012 Cadillac SRX and received a call from the dealership asking me to schedule an appt. I looked online 1st to schedule, there was an appt. available for the next day. I didn't book it, thinking that maybe the person that called would get credit for service. I called her back, and was informed that it would be a week out for the oil change, fine. I also had a secondary issue of getting an estimate for the liftgate actuator replacement. A week later, I take the car in and wait on it. When it was done, I specifically asked about the actuator and was told that the estimate was the paperwork. It wasn't. I called back today to see when I could have this repaired and  was given another appt. a week out. The moral of the story is that they listed 12 things for "recommended services"  but nothing on what I actually requested. The car could have been repaired 10 days ago if I had been given the info that I requested. Now I'm trying to see if I can get my SRX repaired at another dealership either in Pensacola or Gulf Port.

resp.text: Hi Veronica,  I am very sorry to hear about your recent experiece with us. It is our goal to provide each customer with the best service experience possible. We have passed your feedback along to our General Manager and Serivice Manager. With your feedback we can only improve our processes and provide you with the best experience possible.

name: Michelle Hartley
text: I had the best experience buying my 2018 Dodge Challenger at Joe Bullard Cadillac. It all started with the great customer service Bobbie Hebert gave to me from the time I called to inquire if the car was still available, her wonderful knowledge about the car, and how she was easily able to relate to myself and my brother during the sales process and test drive. She was just as excited for me as I was for myself buying my dream car. She even followed up with me the next business day they were open after my purchase to see if I was still enjoying my Challenger. I walked out of that dealership with an uplifted spirit and felt through the whole process that I was receiving amazing fellowship and as if I were being edified through this whole process. name: Douglas Allen
text: What started off as a beautiful experience has turned out to be a nightmare. I purchased what was told to me to be my Certified 2015 Chevrolet Suburban LTZ. Rodney Lofton who is a awesome salesman and Roseevelt Harris the phenomenal finance guy sold me the vehicle and 3mths into my purchased I was told I had over $2k worth of repairs including brakes, new radiator, tune-up, oil cooler lines, and left tie rod end just to name a few. When I asked why wasn't these things serviced and replaced before I purchased the vehicle I was told the repairs wasn't necessary at the time. I feel the salesman did a great job but the service department made it a bad purchase by not doing their job!! I had to pay for the replacement of the radiator and oil cooling lines but the other repairs are still needed. I feel robbed and will probably never purchase from a major dealership like Joe Bullard again!!

resp.text:
Hi Mr. Allen,

Thank you for taking the time to give us this feedback. To make sure this issue is addressed/resolved I have notified the General Manager, Jason Colbert, of the situation and asked that he reached out to you as soon as possible today.

I'm very sorry that your service experience did not mirror your sales experience at our store but I'm confident if there's a way to rectify the issue our team will do so.

Kindest regards,
Kristina M., Marketing Manager

name: Robert Werning
text:
Review of Joe Bullard dealership

My used car purchase was probably a little different than most.  In my case, I needed a good, reliable vehicle as quickly as possible and would immediately be making a 12 hour road trip to a different state as soon as the car was in my possession!  My salesman Curtis Williams showed me what I wanted to see, took the time to answer my questions, and gave me the time to decide if the car was right for me - no "pressure to buy" involved.

Curtis actually delivered the car personally the next day, so that I did not have make another 2 hour trip from Pensacola to Mobile and back to pick up the car!
Overall I would say that I am very satisfied with the service I received at this dealership.  If all their employees are as conscientious as the ones that I dealt with I would not hesitate to recommend this dealer.

Respect and kindness are almost a lost value in todays society, but to us they are still important, Troy exemplifies these and more in how he serves his customers,
We were  surprised to hear Christian music playing and to hear the testimonies of several of the staff. We thank them for their standing up for the American values and showing that they are truly a family doing business in an honorable way.
Troy, we have put you and your new Bride on our pray list and thank you for not making fun of us older folks that haven't embraced " this tech -infested" world  fully yet.
We will see you this coming week with more ? and to drop off the keys.

text:
I have purchase many vehicle and I must say that this was one of the most pleasant experiences I have encountered buying a vehicle.  From my internet inquiry I get a phone call from Ms. Ashley Allen, a very pleasant experience.  Ms. Allen set up an appointment for me to see the vehicle I was inquiring about with Mr. Ben Jackson.  From the moment I entered the doors I was greeted and treated as a lifelong customer.  After meeting with Mr. Jackson I was introduce to Mr. Curtis Williams who would be my salesman.

Mr. Williams and I sat down to discuss what I was looking for in the vehicle of my my choice.  Once I had selected the vehicle, Mr. Williams made the test drive a pleasant and unique experience.  After I decided that this was the vehicle that i wanted, he even saw to it that the reasonable minor imperfections that I nit-picked while looking over the vehicle were taken care of prior to my picking up the vehicle.  Negotiating the final price was even an enjoyable experience, which is rare.  I think that at the end of the day we were both happy with the price.  At no time during the experience did I feel pressured or uneasy.

I will highly recommend to anyone that is looking to purchase a new or used vehicle, visit Joe Bullock Cadillac and ask for Mr. Curtis Williams.

Willie Johnson

name: John Shearhart
text: We shopped online for a good while and Joe Bullard had the best prices for vehicles with a third row. Our salesman was Doug, and he made us feel like he wanted our business without seeming too pushy. The vehicle was sold at a good price and was in great, clean condition. Roosevelt secured fantastic financing, and took his time answering all our questions. They even let us use another  vehicle to return our rental while our vehicle was being cleaned. Overall we have no complaints and hope to do business again!

name: Matt Holloway
text: Terrible! I came in because I had a tail light out and it's one of the newer LED lights that aren't supposed to burn out. They told me to come in at 3 and I would be out by 4. At 4 they had just finished their diagnostic check and they told me it would cost $607 to replace my tail light. I told them to go ahead even though I believed it was too pricey. The rep told me the light costs $500+ and the labor wasnt that much. I started to look up the part online brand new and I could buy 2 for less than what he quoted me. I told him they could stop and I'll bring in the light myself after buying it cheaper elsewhere. He tells me I will still have to pay $135 for the diagnostic. No problem. He comes back and tells me it's already in. I ask well where is my car? He says they're finishing up. 45 minutes later he comes back and tells me that they put a new light in and it didnt work. Must be a wiring issue he said. So I said: "So that $135 diagnostic u tried to charge me for wasn't even accurate? Because the diagnostic claimed I needed a new light." He never did answer. They did change my oil so I paid for my oil change only and went to leave. When I got my car back if was filthy even though they claimed all customers get a complimentary wash with all services. I will never go there again.

resp.text:
Hi Matt,

Thank you for providing us with this valuable feedback. I assure you this is not the Bullard experience we want for our clients.

I have forwarded your comments to the Service Manager, Sean Alexander, as well as the General Manager so that this can be addressed. I’ve also asked for one of them
to contact you to personally discuss in more detail.

I’m sincerely sorry for how your visit with us needed and I hope that we will be able to earn back your business.

Kindest regards,
Kristina M.

name: Julie A
text:
Our family was on vacation in Mobile Alabama this past week. Things didn't go quite as we had planned. Our SUV was cutting out pretty bad on the highway. It was getting worse the closer we got to Mobile. I contacted my friend who's daughter lives in Mobile to see if she might know of a service place. I talked with her daughter and she informed me that her husband, Kyle, worked for Joe Bullard Cadillac. She gave me the number for the service department and said to speak with Haley.  About this time the check engine light came on in our vehicle. It was flashing on and off, then would stay lit.
When I spoke with Haley in the service department she asked about the service engine light. When I told her it had been flashing intermittently she was immediately concerned and said we should get stopped as quickly as we could to avoid internal engine damage.  She then helped us get started with finding a tow service. We were 50 miles aWay and had four people so their usual towing service couldn't do it, but she got the ball rolling for us. She gave me her direct phone number so I could call if I needed anything.
Once we got to the dealership Kyle helped us get a loaner car while ours was being repaired. Haley kept us informed as they learned what was wrong. Our technician, Mike, came in on Saturday to work on our vehicle because we needed to leave to head back to Missouri on Sunday.
To make a long story short...God used all of these people to help us during a difficult time. They made this experience so much less stressful than it could've been. THEY WENT ABOVE AND BEYOND TO HELP US! And, they did it all with a smile. We appreciate the dealership and all the individuals who helped get us back on the road. I would recommend them to anyone who needs service or a new ride!!!

resp.text:
Thank you for your wonderful feedback. We always strive to meet the needs of our customers no matter the situation. Feel free to let us know if you have any concerns about your vehicle.

Kind regards,
Robby Herbert, GM, rherbert@joebullard.com (251)-544-7341

name: Karla Hardin
text: My husband and I were so appreciative of the staff at Joe Bullard Cadillac ! We were met by the GM and sales staff who listened thoughtfully to our specific needs. We never felt we were being forced in a direction but rather we felt they used their knowledge and expertise to tailor a “fit” for every area from the car itself to the financing. Special thanks to Damos and Roosevelt! We are confident that our future as part of the JB family is going to be as enjoyable as our purchase of our new car!

resp.text:
Thank you for the excellent review! It is great to know that Damos and Roosevelt were able to provide you with a pressure-free and knowledgeable service. Please feel free to call or stop by if there is anything else we can do to help you. Welcome to the family! Until next time, happy driving!

Best,
Marc Heiter - General Manager

name: James Smith
text: The recent lease of a XT5 is the 3rd Cadillac I have leased from Joe Bullard in last six years. Richard Borden has been instrumental in all three insuring that I got just what I wanted. I have been completely satisfied with the process in closing the deal on all three cars. A big part of each deal was because of Richard. He is the best. On the current lease, Roosevelt Harris and Damos Brand also were great.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for this wonderful feedback, James! We're so glad you came back to see us for your new XT5. It's fantastic to know Richard, Roosevelt, and Damos all helped make us worth the trip in! If there's anything else we can help you with in regards to your new vehicle, please let us know. Happy driving!

Best,
Marc Heiter - General Manager

name: Tracy Williams
text: the service I received on 2/1-2/5/18 has restored my faith in this wonderful dealership. Joe Bullard is the best from sales associate to service to the drivers they employ. Respectful and professional.

name: Pam B
text: I bought a Cadillac SRX from Joe Bullard in Mobile, Al. This dealership, especially Brandon and Andrew were super nice and helpful. Brandon kept me up to date on the on the schedule of getting my vehicle to me since it was being transferred from out of state. Great Dealership.

resp.text: Pam, thank you for the feedback! We are happy to hear of your positive experience at Joe Bullard Cadillac, and we are grateful you chose us for your automotive needs. We look forward to serving you again in the future!  Sincerely, Marc Heiter - General Manager

text: This was the best experience I have EVER had purchasing a vehicle! We went in, after work, on a Friday night. We kept the staff late, which is inconsiderate considering their long days...... Dean and Jon were absolutely wonderful! Thank you for providing your customers with a very friendly and extremely efficient staff!

text: I think that between the service Advisor Vicki Bodet and Repair tech Chase I got a good ofunderstanding of why it took longer to replace the signal bulb. good job

name: Jason Salvage
text: I took my Cadillac CTS into the dealership for an issue of my car not cutting off. I called after a day and they still didn’t know what was wrong. I picked it up and took it to another reliable mechanic and he diagnosed it immediately. I won’t use Joe Bullard anymore.

Hi Jason,

Thank you for this honest feedback. I'm passing this along to the Service Manager as well as the General Manager to make sure they are aware. One of them may reach out to you for information so we can address the issue..

I'm sorry we could not take care of this for you but I do hope we'll have the chance to earn your business again sometime in the future.

Kindest regards,
Kristina M.
Marketing and PR Manager

name: Jerry Stewart
text:
Curtis (Salesman) was on top of things.  He was eager to help, and knowledgeable when answering our questions.  He was able to ensure our happiness with the purchase of our Cadillac.

Richard (Finance Mgr) made our financial transaction an easy one.  He was clear & precise on explanations of the paperwork.  Mr. Nassar took his time when necessary, but expedited the purchase process efficiently.

Thanks to both Curtis Williams & Richard Nassar, we are now enjoying our Cadillac from Joe Bullard Automotive.  Thanks!

name: D Paolini
text: Joe Bullard has always extended Care, kindness and consideration in both sales and service. The level of quality from his dealership is consistant reliability. This family value continues to gain our trust and is always appreciated and welcome in ours.

resp.text: D, thank you for sharing your feedback! It is very important to our dealership that we earn the trust of our guests by following through with our promises and providing a hassle-free service. Best, Marc Heiter - General Manager

name: MamaJama71
text:
Great experience, very happy!

We came to the dealership to look for a car for my daughter.  Roosevelt Harris was absolutely the best person I have ever bought a car from, hands down!!  You have a real gem in him as an employee.  Polite, friendly and personable.  A pure please to be around!!!  Jon McCartney helped with my paperwork.  He was beyond a pleasure as well.  I told him I was in a hurry and he was very efficient.  Explained everything very well to me and got my paper work printed up.  I really appreciated how efficient and thorough he was.  He is definitely an asset to your company!

I never felt like they were pushy or anything.  They made me feel welcome.  My teenage daughter thinks Roosevelt is so cool.  He took time with her and answered all her questions.  She said he made her feel important and not just like a kid that didn't matter.  She said when she graduates from college and gets her next car, she's buying it from Mr. Roosevelt, he's like family to her now :)

I hope you can let them know how much we appreciate them and please do something extra special for Roosevelt (my daughter's request).

Thanks!

name: Wayne Howarth
text: I've been a customer of Joe Bullard's since 2014, all sales and service have been exceptional including this sales experience, kudo's to AJ, he was a great help in all questions and issues with the XT5 I am currently purchasing, I have and will recommend your dealership to friends and family, Thanks again, Wayne Howarth

name: wayne coaker
text: Our Salesman Richard Borden was very friendly and helpful in helping us purchase our car, went out of his way on  answering a lot of questions we had in making our decision. We really felt special when the sales manager came in along with Ty Bullard to talk to us and thank us for buying a car from them. We were treated well by everyone involved in our purchase.
