Allen answered all of my questions and made the process very easy. I appreciate Allen and the entire Joe Bullard staff’s desire to make sure I was completely satisfied with my purchase.  I am glad I came by to check out their preowned vehicles. I can highly recommend Joe Bullard Cadillac and salesperson Allen Jones to all who would be interested in purchasing a new or used car.

text:

My second visit on May 29th, 2019 resulted in my purchasing a XT4 and everything was totally different. I appreciate the salesman, Sim as well as the business manager Thomas for their help in making tis purchase happen.

text: From the moment I arrived on the Joe Bullard Campus, I was greeted with the respect and sincerity one can only appreciate in the car purchase experience. Within myself I had concluded "You are just looking today!" However, after having Curtis explain in detail the benefits and details on my car, and how it was "built to go head-to-head with the world's best", I knew I couldn't let this opportunity pass me by.  Mr. Williams is a "people person", and this will take him very far in his endeavers to maximize the car buyer's experience.  I have not regretted my purchase in any capacity, and have been singing the praises of the Joe Bullard Team - especially Curtis Williams!!!

Working with Allen Williams and Roosevelt Harris made, what for us was a stressful event (purchasing a new vehicle), into an enjoyable experience for my wife and I. text: Got a CTS... Staff is very polite & courteous.  Will come back for another vehicle when I plan on purchasing one.  Staff will work with you to the best that they can.

name: Jami Morgan
text: The people in the service department handling my claim were very nice. What I didn't like was that the mechanics were excessively rough with my vehicle. I had to have it towed and the towing company left it at the gate. Christian got me a loaner car, which I appreciated very much. When I picked up the loaner there were 2 guys who were trying to get it started to get it up to the shop. I needed to grab a couple things out of my car so I stopped to do that. For some reason they needed to open the back hatch. I was traveling with my animals so I had a large kennel in the back. I watched them put my seats down (rather roughly) and sling my kennel from the back to atop the back seats. It made me cringe but at this point I needed to get going as I had some stops to make and  I thought surely they knew what they were doing, this is a Cadillac dealership afterall and these cars cost a lot. They will surely be careful... When I got my car back, instead of them putting the vehicle back they way they found it, the kennel was still strown across the back. (As a plus though, it was washed! Which I appreciated since I had been on the road and try to take care of my car!) When I went to move the kennel back in place I noticed that there are scrapes across the plastic sides in the back. Greeeeaaaaaat. But, at that point I was leaving to head back to my home state and couldn't worry about it. It was more important to get home safe. They told me in addition to the battery that I needed new air filters, a rear wiper blade, and the throttle body cleaned, all easy enough for me to do myself. So, now I am here doing said maintenance and when I popped the hood I immediately noticed that my positive battery terminal clip has been broken and won't stay shut. Great. I am now back home, 3 states away. I will be back to the area, and am considering moving my family there but if they don't make this right I will find a different dealership to maintenance at.

resp.text:
Hi Jami,

Thank you for taking the time to leave your review and detailed feedback. We are closed today; however, I’m sending your comments over to my General Manager and Service Manager to make sure they address this first thing in the morning. Please expect a call from us tomorrow. I’m very sorry for your experience and I hope we have the opportunity to prove to you this is not how do business nor is this how we want our customers to feel when they leave our dealership.

Sincerely,
Kristina M.
Marketing Manager

name: Frank Jones
text: This was the best car shopping experience that I have ever had, if it was ten stars they would get it from me.  It started with my Internet Sales Manger Tundy McDonald and she was very excellent  getting ideas and question to help me with the purchase of my 2016 Escalade ESV. She sent me to my saleslady Courtney Mauldin, asks for her when you come in, she was totally Awesome. She went above and beyond to get a deal worked out for me,  there was an issue with the car and she took it straight to  service and they fixed it right away and found something else and ordered the part and sent it to detail to get it clean up and they did a great job. If you are looking to purchase a vehicle I recommend Joe Bullard Cadillac, who will treat you right, quick in and out, and they are Veteran friendly, great staff and service. It was worth the 285 miles that I drove from Louisiana to get an awesome deal and meet some great people that really cared about my shopping experience. Ms. Courtney  called me on Monday to check on me to make sure everything was alright with me and the Escalade, and that is quality service at it fineness.

resp.text:
Wow, your kind words took our breath away! We are so glad your recent visit was such a success, and we hope you won’t hesitate to reach out again in the future.

Take Care,
Robert Herbert, GM, rherbert@joebullard.com (251)-544-7341

name: Bill McLarty
text: I am William, answering for my wife Cheryl.  We bought this car new in 2004.  It has been solely serviced and maintained by McConnel/Bullard.  It has less than 30,000 miles on the odometer.  It's been the worst car we've owned since our marriage in 1962.  The problem today was a broken window regulator on the rear driver's side.  My wife has been the sole driver of this car.  We have no children in then home.  My conservative guess is that this window has been lowered and raised no more than 10 times in its aborted lifetime.  My wife was told a plastic roller had broken.  A plastic roller in a $50,000 (2004) Cadillac?!  My bill:  $517.23!  I can go back through my invoices and find similar instances of shoddy work and padded bills.  During the second year we owned the car the driver side dash assembly fell off the dash while my wife was driving.  At around the 4-5 year of ownership your service supervisor convinced my wife that she needed to replace all four tires (around 10,000 miles) because they had "dry-rotted." ($800)  I've owned two Cadillac De Ville's prior to this, and have never experienced what has to be either poor construction, low-quality parts, or untruthful service managers.

name: KIM CARTER
text:
Awesome Customer Service!!!

I recently purchased a 2011 Cadillac SRX. The customer service provided by all the staff at Joe Bullard exceeded my expectaions. I had the pleasure of working with Darren Robinson (New/Used Car Sales) and he most definitely went above and beyond to ensure I was a satisfied customer. Thanks for taking the hassle out of buying a car!!!

text: Our saleswoman Courtney was amazing and genuine. We received grade A customer service every step!

name: myra howard
text: Will never purchase another used vehicle that's not made by  Cadillac. My son purchased me a Lexus GX 470 after it was traded in. I had a total of six loaner cars from the date of purchase . Never Ever will they get a dime or another referral from me. I wish they had a half star. 👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻

name: barbara cowan
text: Saw a vehicle being advertised on Autotrader website that I was interested in. Before I made my visit to the lot, my mind was set that I would only be going to look at the vehicle. I was not even planning on test driving. But Mustafa Elastal (Moose) was so friendly and laid back, he made me feel very welcomed and comfortable.  All my questions and concerns was addressed with expertise and professionalism. Not once did I ever feel pressured. After a test drive and feeling this the vehicle I wanted, I told him I will be getting back with him. After conversing on and off for about a month with Moose the salesman by phone and having the privilege to speak directly to Ty (the owner of the dealership)  I felt the dealership really wanted my business and cared about my satisfaction.The deal was made by phone. Vehicle was delivered to my home personally by my salesman. All transactions and paperwork done in the comfort of my home. I was very impressed with the way I was treated during my recent buying experience at Joe Bullard Cadillac. Would definitely recommend family and friends.

name: Jenny Linda
text: Bought a 2009 GMC Yukon used from this dealership. Great service, very friendly and helpful. Scott Howie was very accomodating in trying to make sure I got the truck I was looking for and was very helpful. Mr. Richard Nassar knew I was on my lunch break and worked very quickly to get me in and out and finished with all my paperwork all with a smile on his face. Went to many other dealerships in the search for this used truck and could not be more pleased with my experience here at Joe Bullard Cadillac. Will start here first next time and leave the rest for last resort!!!

name: Jeannette Bennett
text: Worst used vehicle I've ever purchased. This car has cost more in 18 months than my Honda in ten years. Inspection protocol was incomplete before the car was presented for sale. When I tried to find out what had been done I received this asinine answer: if it needed something we did it. Will never purchase a car here again.

Our GM, Marc Heiter will be reaching out to you shortly regarding this matter. Sincerely, Joe Bullard Cadillac Team

name: Johnny Swopes
text: Absolutely, the most wonderful buying experience my wife Kathy and I have ever had.  The atmosphere was amazing!!  Ty was very gracious and made us feel so welcome as did the entire Bullard family!! Andrew Speight was phenomenal with his delightful British accent describing all of the wonderful details of this truly great Cadillac DTS. His knowledge of the vehicle was paramount!! He knew 'everything' and treated us royally with the test driving and description of the many facets of the vehicle. Andrew kept everything in perspective of the price we could afford. Then he turned us over to Jon McCarthy who was equally as brilliant. Jon made it happen!!! What service!! Jon was so relatable with such tenacity in helping us, and he really came through with making our dream come true!! We highly recommend the family of Joe Bullard Cadillac, and especially Andrew Speight and Jon McCarthy.  They will indeed spoil you! We really thank the Lord for sending us to this Company, thy are a true blessing to the gulf coast!!

name: C C Hall
text: I purchased a Cadillac SRX on 1/11/14 from Joe Bullard Cadillac. Curtis, Roosevelt and Ty were very courteous to me and my husband. They answered all of my questions and worked with us to get to the price we were willing to pay. The Cadillac warranty is hard to beat, especially the 4 years of maintenance and the road side assistance. This is the 6th GM vehicle that we presently own and I know will be the best serviced one by far. I had been looking for a vehicle for 5 months when I decided to look at the SRX. I am glad I did. It has everything on it that I was looking for plus a lot or more features. Everyone at the dealership that walked by you spoke and asked you how you were doing. This is a dream vehicle for me and I look forward to driving it for years. I will recommend to family and friends that are interested in a great luxury car or SUV to get a Cadillac at Joe Bullard Cadillac in Mobile, Alabama and ask for Curtis. I had to use the service department today to get my oil changed and check the routine things out. Christian and the others were very courteous and took care of me and my SRX. The customer lounge area was very pleasant and comfortable during my wait.

name: Greg Loughlin
text: Good workmanship, poor communication.  No warranty info with tires on road hazzard option.

Please feel free to contact us any time you need assistance and we hope to continue working with you in the future.

Marketing Manager

name: Ashley Brown
text:
Superior Service A++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

My experience at Joe Bullard Cadillac - Mobile Alabama was excellent to say the least. The moment my fiance and I pulled up to the dealership we felt welcome. Mustafa Elastal immediately greeted us and made us feel important. He went out of his way to make us feel comfortable as he walked around the lot with us picking out suitable vehicles. This was very important to me considering I had never owned a Cadillac before. His extensive knowledge of the vehicle I wanted (XTS) and the history of Cadillac itself impressed me by far. The hospitality didn't stop with Mustafa. Roosevelt Harris also did a fine job answering all the questions I had about the different cars and prices. He also mentioned a couple of nice restaurants we could try out while visiting Atlanta, GA which we did and absolutely loved. Curtis Williams came by and personally greeted us and also had a nice conversation with my fiance. Last, but definitely not least, Jon McCartney was absolutely amazing (and not just because he actually knows where Winnfield, LA is located lol). He worked very hard to get the financing I needed to get the exact vehicle I wanted. It was a hard sale for me, but he showed us that he wouldn't give up. I really appreciated all the time that each of them took out to make our experience the best car buying experience we have had. I would recommend this dealership without thinking twice (I already have mentioned them to others), and I will be bringing others to come do business with Joe Bullard Cadillac in Mobile, AL.

name: Ramona Reed
text: Honestly we did not wake up that morning thinking of buying a car. We saw one on the interstate and decided to go look at them. When we got there it was freezing and windy and Darren Robinson was in the parking lot moving cars. He offered his help and we told him we were in town to Christmas shop not spend all day at a dealership, we just wanted to try the car on for size. he escorted us inside for coffee and cocoa and went to get the car. we test drove it. we loved it but we were not there to spend all day at the dealership. we left our personal information to be reviewed and were going to shop when Darren notified us that we would be using the cadillac for the day via loaner form approval. we really enjoyed using the car. we Christmas shopped all day and when we returned to the dealership we had been approved for the car with our payments within dollars of request. Jon McCartney had to have been the most professional financial manager i have ever encountered. He was a real person who made us feel right at home and comfortable to speak openly. very friendly and personable. then Roosevelt Harris enters the picture. a gem. a diamond in the rough. so charismatic so joyful and helpful and accomodating. I cannot put into words how much Darren helped to familiarize us with the cue and features. he was so knowledgable of the cars systems. he was an absolute treasure. I cant say but one thing about Joe Bullards team, "you are doing something right". I got hugs from everyone when i left. i felt like i was part of a family there. I even got a text message from Darren on Christmas morning wishing us a merry Christmas. i literally spent 2 hrs tops at the dealership and received the most beautiful CHristmas gift I could have ever dreamed of. but the most inportant thing was the environment and kindness that we experienced while there. oh and my son loved the lounge with computers and coffee/cocoa which made his time there enjoyable also. we will definitely reccomend Joe Bullard Cadillac to friends and family and we will definitely be repeat customers ourselves. my only hope is that we have the privilege of having the same staff in years to come. Thank you so very much.

name: Fred King
text:
From the moment I walked in the front door, Andrew, Ben, and Ty did their best to find the perfect car for us. They were more than successful, my wife and I both have never been more satisfied with a major purchase and the reason for this was the genuine effort each member of the team at Joe Bullard put forth to ensure that we left not only as satisified customers, but as new friends.

Andrew stayed with us and walked us through the process and was a very genuine and honest regarding the steps and what was happenning and what was going to happen.

Ben was very diligent and went above and beyond to get the exact car we were looking for... the car is perfect, just what we wanted.

Ty was also great, taking time to sit and talk to us about what was happenning and to ensure us that everything was on track and going well. It was and it did. I do not remember seeing as big a smile as when I told my wife that ya'll had her car ready... Thanks

Richard made the paperwork fly by with ease... the power of a sharpie to show me where to sign... Thanks for making the experience great.

I can not say enough about my outstanding visit and purchase, when you want to go back to the dealership that sold you a car to visit with  the people who were involved in getting you a vehicle because they are now friends, I guess that is how it is always suppossed to work, I am glad that I found the place to go and to send my friends and family to when we need not only a new vehicle, but to meet some outstanding people as well.

Thanks again!

Fred & Diane

name: Andrea La Rossa
text: Wow!  Another great experience with Joe Bullard Automotive!  My Salesman, Damos Brand, was wonderful. He was courteous, professional, and very knowledgeable about the Cadillac product line and that helped make my car buying experience a dream!  Damos delivered my new Cadillac XTS to me and then spent as much time as I needed going over all of the XTS functions and assisted in setting up my XTS to suit me perfectly!!  I love my new Cadillac XTS and once again, I will recommend Joe Bullard Cadillac, Damos Brand, and the New Car Sales Manager, Roosevelt Harris, Jr., to everyone I can.  Both of these men are true assets to Joe Bullard Automotive.

name: Jim Smith
text:
I was impressed from the start with Rich Borden who was the first person I met and provided me an excellent selection of new and used models to make my choice. I had driven a 2002 Cadillac Deville for 10 years, so I was already happy with the Cadillac family and had owned/driven GM (Pontiacs before the Deville)cars since 1966. Because I perferred new over used, and because I had never leased a vehicle, Rich introduced me to Ben Jackson who provided me the pros and cons of the lease vs purchase option. I made my decision on a 3 year lease. I made my choice of the 2013 XTS.
The administrative process was made flawless by the excellent knowledge and professionalism of Ben Jackson and Richard Nassar.
The entire sales staff from Ty Bullard(same as when I bought a new Olsmobile Holiday 88 from his Dad and Granddad Joe Bullard in 1978), Roosevelt Harris(who presented me my Cadillac IPad),and in particular Rich Borden was outstanding.

text: When I tell you that my salesman, Mr.Curtis Williams and my fiancé Officer Mr. Roosevelt Harris did such a out standing job. Can't get any better!

text: Rude. Racist. Horrible customer service. No greeting and rude when speaking to customers. DON'T GO HERE!!!

text: These folks are great and do very good work. I hate to admit, but they have repaired my cars 7 times (folks love to rear end my car at red lights) and I have been 100% happy every time.

name: Joshua Davis
text: Got rear ended a few weeks ago. They took great car of my car and were quick. When I got my car back they even cleaned the outside an some on the inside. Highly recommend

name: The Stig
text:
Took my car here for repair after being rear-ended. Light bump, should have been a very easy repair.
First attempt to get me to accept my vehicle, they had installed a bumper cover that didn't fit. (See pics) I called them out on this and they kept my car an additional week.
Next attempt to get me to accept my vehicle, the bumper cover fit better but wasn't attached to the car behind the wheels and the corner pieces were flopping around and in no way attached to the cover. They managed to fix that the same day and I accepted the car.
Now, upon further inspection, I have discovered that the bumper mounts they replaced have not been painted to match. While this is not readily visible, it is still a sign of shoddy workmanship.
I cannot advise anyone take their car here for repair.
The photographs truly speak for themselves.

resp.text: The first repairs that we completed was with an after-market bumper that his insurance approved. When he was not 100% satisfied, we contacted his insurance, explained the situation and were able to get them to agree to an entirely new bumper which we gladly took care of. Waiting for insurance to get back to us, as well as obtaining the new bumper and doing the work, took extra days. The corner pieces that the customer is referring to in his review are the mud guards. They fit exactly the same on the original bumper as they did the new bumper that we installed. However, to make the customer happy we did more work to them and secured each side which is not at all how they come from the manufacturer yet made him happy. This is the very first complaint we have heard of concerning the bumper mounts. We did absolutely everything that needed to be done to insure this customers happiness with his vehicle. The repairs were on point as well as the “extras” we took care of for him.

name: Benjamin Grays
text: VERY HAPPY WITH THEIR WORK!

name: Erik Wright
text:
I visited this location last year and had my wife's car repaired after an accident. They did a fantastic job on the car and the service advisor I had was very professional and provided great customer service.  My only complaint was the front office lady came across as rude. I gave her the benefit of the doubt and figured she was having a bad day.

Fast forward to August 2020. I was in an accident and had Progressive book me an appointment at this location because they had done such a great job before. I arrived at the location and the same front office lady greeted me with the same brash, unfriendly manner that she had the first time. I decided to leave immediately and have my insurance provider book an appointment at another body shop. It is not hard to be kind to someone for 30 seconds while they check in. It rubbed me the wrong way and I wasn't willing to give this location business when this was my first impression not once, but twice now. Their work is fantastic, it is just a shame it is shrouded by the first impression at the door.

resp.text: We truly hate to hear of your unhappiness with your recent experience with our customer service. Please feel free to call our office and discuss your issues with management. Your experience is important to us and we would like to make it right.

name: Brittani Nickel
text: Customer service went above and beyond to make sure I spent minimal time without a vehicle. I had brought my car in for a hit and run dent, along with a windsheild replacement. When the windsheild service they usually use was not available in time, they helped me find a differant service. Made the whole process easy, quick response time, and excellent work.

name: John Seaman
text: My mother and I have both experienced poor service at this particular location.  Patronizing attitudes and slow service from the employees here are what give this location a one-star rating from me (and, by extension, my mother), but at least the actual work was good (when it was FINALLY finished...).

resp.text: We do hate that you feel that the attitude of some of our employees is less than desired. It is important to us that each customer is treated with kindness, thoughtfulness and respect. We understand that the time that ones vehicle is in the shop being repaired can be a stressful time therefore we want your time with us to be pleasant and stress-free. If you would like to discuss the incident in which you believe someone's attitude could have been better please feel free to call and speak to a manager.

name: Xande Libarios
text: Great service!

name: uncletaylorify
text: Very good service.

name: Yolanda D-L
text: In a word...Excellent!  From the moment I made the initial call to schedule the inspection until I received the call to pick up my car once the repairs were done, everything was conducted professionally, timely and always with the customer's best interest in mind.  My car looked better than it did coming off the showroom floor! The premises were immaculate!  Misty was very gracious and Nick was the best!  I highly recommend Joe Hudson's Collision Center on Madison Blvd.

name: Torey Lavish
text: They repaired my complete front bumper in one day which was great for not having to pay for a car rental service for very long. Their work was superb, looked brand new again!

name: Ali Adams
text: I had a great experience working with Joe Hudson's. They were very understanding of my situation after my car accident, and fit me in as quickly as possible (same day!) into their schedule for an insurance inspection. They went above and beyond in terms of communication and professionalism, ensuring that I knew everything that was going on. I never felt the least bit rushed or hurried whether in person or on the phone. I felt like they truly wanted to make the process as seamless as possible for me. I would recommend them to anyone in need in the North Alabama area - they are a top tier business!

name: David Jones
text: Joe Hudson collision center is a top notch performer in my book. I’m a miltary retired Sr. Non-commissioned  Officer.  Who have always maintained a high standard for anything I do. Joe Hudson exceeded all my expectations. They kept m informed throughout every stage of my wife’s car repair. The job came out outstanding and they evens buffed out other starches that were not part of the repair cost. Thanks guys great job!!! Happy Wife happy life......

name: Kyle Kuepker
text: Danny and the staff at Joe Hudson did a great job if helping us work though our accident. Fair, fast and accurate.

name: David Stewart
text: Well organized

name: Amanda Castagneto
text: 10/10 all around! Great customer service and they did the most beautiful job on my car. I was updated every step of the way on where they were at fixing my car and they did it in a fast amount of time. I will recommend this place to everyone I know.

name: Brenda Mckinney
text:
After having my new Sequoia for only a month, I had a little incident wt my lift gate and the garage door got a little tangled up. It wasn’t major damage, but it sure felt like it!!
I dropped my car off and three days later I got it back good as new!!!..AND it was spotless!!!
Everyone there was super helpful, very professional and kept me updated on the status of my car everyday!!
I will definitely use them again...although I hope I don’t need too :)

name: Ron and Linda Haybarker
text: Outstanding Body Shop. Keep you up-to-date on the progress of your vehicle. You know exactly when your vehicle will be done. Very professional work. My truck was in an accident they not only repaired that but touched up some spots that were there before the accident. Overall I was staying in service and friendly personnel thank you.

name: Larry Martin
text: Did great repair on my car.  Everything was on time and done well.

name: JoJo Campbell
text: So happy with the service at Joe Hudson Collision Center in Madison. They repaired my vehicle quickly and kept me informed of their progress through text messages. At no time, did I wonder what was happening with my vehicle. They are friendly and professional and did an awesome job!

name: Matthew Lewis
text: Excellent service! Had my car finished before they told me and it looked great! I highly recommend using them for any kind of body work. I'll definitely be using them again in the future if I need my car repaired. Daily texts and emails kept me updated on my car. This is the place to go!

name: Mel Sims
text: They were very easy to work with and accommodating.  They made sure my rental schedule was synced with their work schedule.  They send you email updates on the progress of your car and answered any questions I had.  I was given a lifetime warranty (non-transferable) on their work.  I like that I can trust the paint job and other work will hold up or be fixed.

name: Roger Little
text: Excellent place for repair work.  Everyone is very professional and great to do business with.

name: Wesley Jones
text: Excellent body work. Excellent customer service. Brandon was highly professional and had everything lined up for max efficiency. You are notified by text and email every step of the way as your vehicle is repaired.

name: Lyle & Tom Fleming
text: I brought my A4 in for repairs since the dealership doesn't have a body shop. Mark and Brandon provided a fantastic customer service experience and I couldn't be more pleased with the process and end product. I was alerted and updated via email every step of the way during repairs. Overall, this is a very knowledgeable and friendly place! Brandon even had the guys in the body shop touch up paint chips around my car for no extra charge. Use Joe Hudson on Hwy 72!

name: Matthew Graham
text: Great work. Car repair was finished in less than two days! They took the time to go over the repairs and they were thorough with me the whole way, staying in touch with status updates via text. Would recommend Joe Hudson's to anyone! Thanks!

name: Tara Hargrove
text: They fixed my car back to new! Excellent quality!

name: Jeri Baughn
text: This is a very efficient, clean, professional, friendly and conscientious body shop.  My car looks like new again and I am so happy about it! Their guy Nick did a great job of keeping me informed about the progress of my car.  I would use them again.

name: Gary Williams
text: Great customer service and repair work. My car look new again. It's hard to find a collision center that provides flawless repair service. I was expecting some unfinished things or little issues, not at Joe Hudson. Again Happy Customer.

name: bev bauer
text: Had to bring my car back for leaking caused  by the wreak. Took forever to get it all fixed. Disappointed.

name: Bridgette Wilson
text: They took the time to order the correct color and shade of paint for my car instead of throwing some red paint on the car. The manager also remembered us talking weeks in advance about minor details in my car. All the employees were kind and they all took the time to make sure everything met my needs. My car came out looking basically brand new. Thanks to them. And if I ever have any car issues I plan to go to them again!

name: Dreama Moore
text: Each experience is different.  I hope yours is better than mine. I chose them based on the reviews but after I had my car worked on, I spoke with others that had similar experiences.  It began unprofessionally. They had my car for 3 or 4 days and did not call. However, when I called them, they said they didn't know they had the work order from insurance but it was in my car. I didn't find them to be nice until I told them about their attitudes which did get better. On to the actual work, it took them 2 weeks on a 4 day job (according to insurance). This caused confusion with insurance.  When I finally got my car back, it wasn't fixed. I was told by them to take it to a mechanic by one of the employees because JH is a body shop. I took it to a dealership which advised me JH did not properly attach hoses. They admitted fault and fixed the problem.  However, other things  that were not wrong, are now wrong. Insurance wouldn't  cover it because the adjuster said it wasn't likely to happen in the accident, which only leaves me to believe it happened at JH. This has been going on since February and I finally finished in May. I had to spend additional time and money on something that was not my fault. This is the same thing I was told from others after leaving them. Before going there, get another opinion from a certified professional.  I will say, at least they tried to fix the problems. I just think they may have cost me more than I should have paid.  Also, they have lifetime warranties on their work.

resp.text: I believe Ms. Moore’s issues are more with Geico than with us. We took care of her every need including renting her a vehicle and replacing a dry rotted hose, as a courtesy to her.  She had mechanical damage to the back side of her engine that Geico deemed unrelated to her accident.  Therefore, they would not pay. We actually towed her vehicle to the dealership for her so the problem could be diagnosed. We did everything in our power to make Ms. Moore happy and make her experience pleasant. We feel we absolutely gave her complete customer service and had her best in mind. What she had to pay out of pocket and the extra time that things took due to Geico wanting the vehicle sent to a mechanic for diagnoses was completely out of our hands. We do hate that things were frustrating for Ms. Moore.

name: James Hoesly
text: Great Professional staff. Very nice new clean facility. Excellent repair work done. Would definitely recommend.

name: S E
text: Great experience all work was explained before, during, and after completion. I would definitely recommend using them.

name: Sandi Green
text: First impression under these circumstances they were on point and very professional 🤜🤛

name: Tricia Presley
text: Did a great job on repairing my car

name: Jim Rountree
text: I am HIGHLY COMPLIMENTARY of the Madison office of Joe Hudson Collision Center--- BUT completely due to the highly professional, very timely, and totally friendly service provided to me by Brandon Allen!! He was my Estimator, he kept me fully informed of all my options, the status of repairs, and finally the delivery back to me of my Cadillac-- fully REPAIRED!! I will give Highest Recommendations for future busibbus at this location-- but again, due to Brandon Allen!! James F. Rountree

name: Sean Mantler
text:
It appears that my original review has been repressed.
See silver car in photos, they speak for themselves.
Owner's response is inaccurate, I've never filed a claim nor had insurance with Geico. Nor was my vehicle involved in more than one accident. He obviously has me confused with another unhappy client.

resp.text: The previous review that this person left was was not accurate. He had another accident after his vehicle was repaired and delivered the first time. Geico inspected it and informed him that a new claim would have to be filed. The original work was properly and professionally done. The damage that he is speaking of on the silver car came from his second accident.

name: Jim Carter
text: Excellent scheduling, quality of service, and superb customer service.  Very professional.  Recommend them for your auto repair needs.

name: Michael and Amanda Dixon
text: Excellent work done on our Pilot.  Professional staff explained everything and ensured everything was taken care of.

name: neva jane roark
text: Professional. Easy to work with all employees. Work ready when promised. Work high quality

name: Yvonne Jones
text: Great customer service, my vehicle was taken care of in an exceptional rate of speed I will always work with on my vehicles. I truest loved the updates I received while work was being done on my vehicle.

name: Brooke Humphries
text: Took my car to get my car looked at. The guy was nice and friendly. name: Ken Stapler
text:
UPDATE: since posting the stuff below, we’ve been told it would be ready twice and guess what? Not ready and no return calls or notifications this time. Just awful.

So far we are not very impressed. Our daughter was in a fender bender in our Fision. They told us it would be a month before they could get to our car and that it would be a five day repair. We were ok with that. Everyone was helpful and nice and communication was good. Once we took the car in and paid the $500 deductible,  it all changed. The five day repair turned into a two week repair. Then two weeks turned to 2 1/2. The 2 1/2 has now turned to 3 1/2. They have not communicated at all. We had to call and wait for a call back that was never same day. We are so over this. I understand back orders and such but this is getting ridiculous. They said the original delay was a backordere part. Now they aren’t saying why.

text: It was great til we had extra charges that currently have not been answered as to why those charges are on my card...

resp.text: Dana Hand... I believe you're talking about the Uhaul rental that you rented thru Uhaul . We do not have anything to do with charges on your card. When your husband called and asked about the charges, he was explained we have no access to your card and to call Uhaul. Our reviews here are for Matthews Towing and Body Shop, this should not have anything to do with a Uhaul that was dropped at our shop. We just let them park the trucks at our location temporary we do not make any money off uhaul. Please contact Uhaul for them to explain charges to you, it is out of our hands.

name: Jay OHern
text:
Nice enough, but not a great paint guy.
Orange peel, poor masking job, overspray, buffing compound in all door jambs and around hoods, chipped and cracked interior parts. Typical body shop bs! I expected more from this outfit. If you let it leave your shop looking that way, and if you didn’t inspect it personally, then why would you fix it right the second time I bring it back???? Disappointed

resp.text: I do apologize to Mr. OHern. If we missed something during the repair, when the vehicle was dropped off with us for the repair. Mr OHern's Lexus had front end damage. He asked us to buff some scratches on the rear of the car while in for repairs. Vehicle was completed and ready on the date promised. When Mr. and Mrs. OHern picked their Lexus up, they seemed very pleased with the repairs and bragged about the color match of the Lexus. And 3 weeks later,  Mr. OHearn called and said there was buffing compound in the door openings, I asked him if he could bring it back and we would take care of it. Several months went by, never heard from him anymore until I seen the review that was posted several months after we had spoke. I have tried to call several times and left messages for him to call me back, but no response. As far as the chipped and cracked interior parts, I have no explanation for them as we did not do any work to the inside of the vehicle. I am not trying to make excuses for us as we all do make mistakes.  I take pride in my business and customers and hate Mr. OHern feels disappointed.

She was amazing in the professional but in the way yet made me feel like I knew her a very long time. Their was a small issue when I get the car back but they where extremely quick to respond and took care of the issue. In live things will happen but like I always said it’s not what happens but how it handle and they handle it great. I very highly recommend them!!

text:
HONESTY ALERT. Jeff Serio the manager is amazingly honest!!!
He turned down repainting my previous repair paint job.
I had been to 2 other body shops for this fix and they told me what a mess it was and what it would cost. They estimated the same costs. It was so much I tried one more shop.
Jeff explained that it is Alabama LAW that a repair paint job is warrantied for the life of the original paint if the car.
He told me to take my car back to the body shop and give them the oppertunity to fix it.
I did and they were happy to fix it
He saved me a ton of money...what a GREAT guy!!!

nice job, friends! thank you!

name: Diana Owens
text: I went in for a consultation on my 2015 Volkswagen Jetta. Although the man who helped me was very nice, something was off about the services he said were necessary for a "proper repair" to my vehicle. My car had significant damage to the back right passenger side of the door, which caused the paint to crease and flake off. Also, there was paint over two doors from the mailbox I hit. Even though there was no damage to my back quarter panel, I was told I needed a new one for a proper repair. I was also told I need two new doors. He said in total the price would be 4,500 dollars. When I declined the offer, he pushed me to file it through my car insurance. It just didnt sound like a correct estimate. Then he told me I could buy a used door, and get paint thinner (yes I said paint thinner) to get the mailbox paint off my car. Obviously that would ruin the whole paint job on my car, so I didnt do that. Turns out, I got an estimate for way less than the one I was offered here. Stay weary of this place.

Sad thing is - the body work they did looked good. Poor communication and didn't seem interested in making it right when I returned car initially. Put your issues in writing and email it to them and the insurance company. They seemed more motivated to resolve the problems after I put them in writing.

name: Jacob M
text: I've been going here for years, almost since I first started driving. I don't understand how someone could leave anything but a 5 star review. I read one review where clearly an unfortunate series of events occurred, along with some possible misunderstandings. In my opinion Reliable Auto Care and Exhuast is an extremely fitting name. If they could use trustworthy in their acrynym it would be even more so fitting. I've experienced nothing but good service, punctuality, and honesty from all the workers and the master mechanic. If a mistake was made or the progress changed in an unexpected direction I was called immediately and informed of the situation, then asked what I would like to do in order to proceed. I even had a sensor accidentally broken once while they were making a repair and they called me to notify me of their mistake and to tell me that they had already bought another sensor and replaced it at no additional cost. The most astonishing occurrence was last year when I had to have a crack in my exhuast welded up and the manifold tightened, then I proceed to hit a speed bump a couple weeks later and break the weld and loosen where the manifold had been tightened. After one quick call they told me to bring it back so they could repair it again for free. I would recommend anyone to this Auto Shop, even family.

name: Haleigh Shaddix
text: Stay away! This place is the exact opposite of reliable, which they claim to be. My fiance took his daily commute truck there 3 weeks ago and we still have not been able to get them to fix the original problem! The first week they had it from Monday thru to Friday at closing time which we were told we needed to hurry to come by and pay them and pick up the truck because they were ready to leave for the weekend. We pick it up and it barely makes it back to the house. We had to wait to contact them Monday the 2nd week only to find out that the gentleman that worked on the truck conveniently has Monday's off. We took it back because at that point we were already into them for a large amount of money and needed them to fix what the obviously didn't the first time around. They kept it over the holiday week and I assume never even touched it the entire time it was there. Going into the 3rd week we were told we needed to buy an additional part before they could finish the job... Where was that realization the first week you had it?!?!? Three weeks into this simple repair job and we were into a rental for $700 out of our pockets!! They didn't care about that either, knowing this is his daily truck, they sat on this vehicle stalling far too long and in no way tried to make it right. Not to mention the front desk receptionist is RUDE and extremely conceded! She has no concern for what you tell her about your situation. I don't know how many people can afford to have their daily commuter in the shop, but I'm here to say we will NEVER take another vehicle back in the vicinity of that place. Huge waste of time and money! Extremely unprofessional people.

name: Denean Anthony
text: Pete is absolutely amazing! We have taken all 5 of our autos to him over the years. He treats the small bumps and repairs with the same level of patience and expertise as the big ones. And trust me, with 3 kids, we have him on speed dial. I took the truck to him today with a broken tailgate handle. We had been fiddling with it for about a week trying to get it open.  He had it open in 10 seconds and had a new part delivered and installed in less than an hour. I know he had bigger jobs to do, but he took the time to fix this for me. He has blended paint on my Lexus to perfection, popped dented corners out of rubber bumpers, dealt with insurance adjusters, and all with a kind and friendly attitude. Pete has been in business here long enough to know exactly who to call to get whatever part you need. You couldn’t pick a better place to take your auto.

Hands down Pete is the nicest professional person you will ever come across. I asked if it could be fixed within my budget and he even beat what I was thinking it would cost. Much lower than anyone else. I brought it in on thursday afternoon, he said by the following friday it would be done and behold tuesday he gave me a text saying it was finished. Let me tell you, when I say you can't tell it's not just as it rolled off the showroom floor, I mean that is the absolute best body work I've ever seen in my life. Pete is a really good person. He is honest and hard working. He isn't like the normal body shops that only care about charging high prices to insurance company. He is out for the average person on a budget. There isn't a shop out there that can deliver perfection like pete can. Dixie auto body is a true jewel when it comes to autobody work in baldwin county. Hell, you would probably have to search state to state to find anyone that can compare to his level of skill, precision, and performance. I hope if your reading this searching for a body shop to work on your car, I hope you understand you have found the right place, now make the phone call.

Update- 8/10/19
Went there early because I had a leak in my tire. I was turned away, because of "over-bookage". There was nobody sitting in the lobby either. I previously spent $500.00 for new tires and alignment, and I posted a good review on that. So, I went back again. I drove 20 minutes to get there, because I do not live close to their shop. I get, " Sorry... we cannot help you today". They cannot do a simple tire patch on one of the tires that I brought from them? I would have waited on that to be done too. This is poor, and unacceptable customer service. I got it patched at another tire shop, Jim Whaley tires. That tire shop was extremely busy, but they still waited on me. name: Mark Richards
text:
On Tuesday Nov. 29 2016 I was traveling west on HWY 84 in Alabama and my Tahoe began to have an extreme vibration. The vibration was not in the steering wheel but the chassis. It felt like a u-joint to me so I proceeded slowly at 25mph to try and locate help. I pulled into the A-1 Tire Sale & Service Goodyear dealer and asked if they could repair my vehicle and what I thought it was. They said they would look at it and see if the could. After some time the mechanic returned to get the Service Writer and they exited and soon she returned to let me know that what was wrong was both front wheel bearings were bad  and my idler arm and bracket were worn out. I asked how much to fix ans was quoted $446.00. I asked was u-joint bad ?"no it OK " I was told. I asked to see my vehicle and when I spun the wheels I herd no noise, when I checked for play by lifting up on tire I noticed none. Then moving tire side to side I felt no play in the Idler arm. Now mind you anything can break at ant time, but I had my vehicle in the shop last week for a tie rod end and front end alignment by men I have trusted for years. So I refused the repairs and for my vehicle to be taken off the lift. The mechanic then came over to where we were, I then asked him "you didn't find anything wrong with the u-joint? NO was his answer. As he backed the vehicle off the lift a loud ping could be heard, like that you here when you have a bad u-joint. I then drove to another shop recommended by my son-in-law, and when their mechanic walked under the vehicle he could see the u-joint was bad with out touching it.
U-joint was repaired and $70.00 later I was on the road with no vibration.    So before I let A-1 Tire do any work on my vehicle I would recommend you take it to a honest shop to determine what is really wrong.

name: Megan Shaw
text: CAR OWNERS BEWARE. Do not leave anything that you even remotely care about in your vehicle while under their care or it will be stolen or attempted to be stolen. I got into a car wreck near their location so that's where I got towed. If that ever happens again I will make sure to go ANYWHERE else. I live about 3-4 hours away from this store so my items that I left in my car after my wreck were to be shipped to me (which took a month and a half to do). While in communication with them I was asked about an air pump in my car that was going to be "thrown away" because, and I quote, "people tend to leave stuff in their cars that don't work anymore so I didn't  feel like I needed to check to see if it worked". Ridiculous. 1) it's not that hard to plug something in just to see it work, 2) I wanted everything in my car regardless if it worked or not. I also had a small money bag in my car which I haven't received. I assume it's stolen because it was physically in contact with an AUX cord that I DID receive.

text: Our family wanted to use a local business when we needed body repair and we were so pleased to find Collision Tech. Since that first service 4 years ago, we have been back 4 more times. name: Emma Waldie
text: I can’t recommend collision tech enough. I’m a college student who knows nothing about cars, and after getting a quick quote from Patrick I realized other collision centers were trying to overcharge me significantly. Him and Luis were able to fix my mirrors for $350 less than what other shops were charging, and my old ‘08 Toyota looks brand new. They were also extremely fast and only needed my car for a day, while the other place told me my car would be in the shop for up to 4 days. Even more than that, they really went above and beyond by removing a big scratch I've had on my bumper for free. Overall, I can’t recommend this place enough, especially for those who may not know a lot about cars and want an honest estimate.

resp.text: Thank you...!!!...it was a pleasure!!!!!

name: Jody Eason
text: I took my truck here to get a leak at the rear window fixed.  They said it would be $600 to remove a dent and fix the leak.  So, they do the work and say they tested it, and I paid them and drove it home.  The next time it rains, the truck is still leaking, and I call back.  They say that for these trucks, the light sometimes leaks, so it may be that and not the window.  Umm . . . that would have been good information to know before I spent $600!?! "OK, we'll take a look at it again and take care of it."  So, I drop the truck off and call a few days later.  This time, they say it will be another $150 to replace the light (I just ordered a replacement for $30) rather than just fixing it because they convinced me to give them $600 that I didn't need to in the first place instead of telling me I might want to try swapping the light first.  Maybe they didn't intentionally keep me in the dark to get more money from me, but charging me another $150 to correct something you missed the first time is really bad form.  I'll never go here or recommend this place again.

name: J. Hickman (MrIg0Hard)
text: Fast and excellent service as usual!

resp.text: Thank you so much!

text: Great work at a very reasonable price!

They also cleaned up the stains and fixed the sticky seatbelt latch that were caused by my breakfast juice flying everywhere when I was rear-ended.

We are return customers and my wife and I have been pleased with their work.  It has been a few years since the last time, and the same people were there and they do great work!

Sincerely,
Neil Sutherland - 12/9/2013

text: Amazing customer service, super fair price, and easy to work with! Thank you Cockrell's for helping me get my car back so quickly!! It looks brand new!

text: My experience at Cockrell's was exceptional. The staff was very professional and knowledgable. They stayed in constant communication with me regarding the status of my vehicle. My truck looks great!

resp.text: Thank you Cody for your feedback. We value all things we do and appreciate you trusting in Cockrell's for your repair needs!

name: David Miller
text:
Had work done recently.  I picked up the car in the rain so there was no chance to see how it looked.  There was a missing trim piece that came broken that will be in in a couple of days that I have to go back for.  The next morning I checked it out and there were bubbles and dirt in the paint.  When I took it back I was told there was "No way to keep dirt out of paint."  They would clean it up "like new" if I left it with them.  Wife picks it up, it has been buffed but there are still holes where the bubbles were.  In inspected it I also find that the bumper is not completely attached.  It goes back again.

This time they say to drop it off and they will take my wife home.  She is handicapped and they expect her to climb up into a tall cab.  When she says that she can't do it she gets attitude.  They eventually find a lower cab that she can get into.  When we pick it up all they have done is buff it again.  There are still holes in the paint, and the bumper still isn't attached.  My wife never want to see the place again and I can't ask her to go.

I go and get the bumper attached and they buff it again but still nowhere close to right.  At this point they have won. "If you inconvenience them enough they go away" seems to be their motto.

resp.text:
I'm sorry to hear this Mr. Miller.  Unfortunately, I was unable to find your name in our customer database for this location (108 E. I-65 Service Rd) or any of our 3 locations in Mobile.  Please contact me @ 251-471-5600 so that I you can help identify which location the repairs were completed, and to see if I can assist you further. Are you sure this took place at a Cockrell's Body Shop?
Sincerely,
Dan Bridges
General Manager
Mobile, West Mobile and Theodore

text: I took my car to cockerells to get fixed and the service and staff went above and beyond! Dan made sure to keep me up to date with the repairs that were being made and always returned my emails and phone calls in a timely manner! My car looks like brand new and I’m so excited!!!!! I recommend using cockrells if you’re needing repairs!!!! Thank you so much to you and your staff for keeping my stressful situation way less stressful!

resp.text:
Lyndsey, thank you so much for your review.!! We pride ourselves on customer  service along with quality repairs. I'm so glad you were happy and we mean it when we say .. "We Love Your Automobile".  I thank you for trusting in us.
Dan Bridges, G.M.
Cockrell's of Mobile

name: Will G
text:
Consumer Beware! I just had to get my front bumper repaired. Quoted that I drop my car off on a Thursday to be picked up on Saturday. Saturday came, car wasn't ready. I already returned my rental!!!! Was told that it might be ready on Monday. Called Monday, "Another part had to be ordered". Mind you, they already ordered the part, which drove up the original quote, which would cross the threshold with my insurance, and make it go up!!! I told them that I would pay cash for the overage, so I could avoid a pricey increase in my insurance premium. I just wish they would've communicated that with me FIRST!!! They didn't even bother! Good thing I asked!!!!

Long story short, I had to pay extra for a rental (so I could go to work!), and I didn't get my car until FOUR days later than originally quoted. I encourage you to steer clear of this business. It the one on the Beltline. Take your business to another body shop!

name: Mike Nettles
text: Helpful friendly knowledgeable staff fair pricing

resp.text: Mike. Thank you for your feedback!. We take pride in our commitment to our customers and our friendly staff. Thank you for choosing Cockrell's Body Shop

name: Kitty Prince
text: My rear passenger window fell into the door of my Jeep. I pulled in to The New Cockrell's Body Shop and was greeted by the receptionist and told her my plight. It was raining and my interior was getting soaked. She went to speak with Dan Bridges who immediately came out to speak with me. Dan took my car, fixed me up to get back on the road.  No charge he says. This is a kindness I will remember always. Thank you Dan and Cockrell's,  you are now my go to shop. And by the way, the waiting area is awesome, clean and comfortable.

resp.text:
Hi Kitty, sorry it's taken so long for me to respond but I wanted to thank you for the kind words and positive review.  At Cockrell's Body Shop we take pride in taking care of everyone no matter the situation. It was my pleasure to assist you in your time of need. We're glad you liked the lobby too!!! Next time you're in the area stop by and say hi, or get a cup of coffee.
Dan Bridges
General Manager

name: Zip Po
text: There fixing my back glass among other things

name: Eleanor Rome
text:
Cockrells Body Shop is wonderful. I have had my car repaired here multiple times for different body work damages and every time the team has been great and the work they do is great.

They have amazing customer service, attentive staff, and I truly feel cared about each time I come in.

I have nothing but good things to say and would definitely recommend Cockrells to anyone looking for a top notch body shop.

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome review, Eleanor! We work hard to meet expectations like yours, and we’re happy to hear we hit the mark for you.  We do appreciate you recommending our shop to your friends and family.  Again, thank you!

text: Very unprofessional. They have had my car for over a month and keep lying about when it would be ready for pickup. They leave you on hold and sooner or later they hang up in your face.

Cockrell's Body Shop of Mobile

name: kaysha english
text: Very unprofessional. They have had my car for over a month and keep lying about when it would be ready for pickup. They leave you on hold and sooner or later they hang up in your face.

resp.text:
Ms English, I'm sorry to hear of your experience but I don't find your name anywhere in our database for repairs. I'd be curious to know which location your vehicle is at so that I may assist you. Please call me @ your convenience.
Dan Bridges, G.M.
Cockrell's Body Shop of Mobile

name: Katherine Pope
text: Excellent service! I've been hit twice in the past 6 months and both times the staff at Cockrells has been amazing to work with. Fast, quality work.

name: Amanda Robinson
text: William was very helpful .

name: Vivian Chambers
text: Professional staff. Honorable and respectful. Great service and trustworthy.

resp.text: Thank you Vivian for leaving a review!  Our team here at Cockrell's Body Shop is thrilled to have such positive feedback, and we're proud to know that our emphasis on quality customer service is recognized.  We thank you for using Cockrell's Body Shop for all your collision services.  Please stop by for a fresh cup of coffee if you're in the neighborhood anytime soon. Safe travels!

name: Marcus Denney
text: Top of the line service!

name: Raymona MORRIS
text: They were professional Nick's the best to go to I recommend them !!!!!

resp.text: Raymona. Thank you for your comments. We're very lucky to have Nick on our team! Have a safe weekend!!

name: David Jones
text: drove by to have door hinges replaced. he looked at them and done a quick alignment for free. will refer to my friends.

resp.text: Mr Jones.  Thank you for the positive feedback. We are glad to have helped. We appreciate any referrals you can send our way. Have a safe holiday.

name: Deena McCormAck
text:
Although the FINAL completed work appears to be well done, after my accident, it was my own familiarity with my vehicle and knowing it wwasn't 'right'. Obvious things like my car shaking, needing balance/alignment. Then tire replacement from damage.
My main complaint is lack of communication.  1st was informed of text up-dates...never happened. Then I suppose I became a problem child, pursuit job through completion...I kept calling and actually contacted my Insurance Agent who intervened for me. Ended up with additional week car rental and additional 2 hours waiting in shop and 6 weeks overall for complete repairs.

name: Charles Elston III
text: Great body shop they handled everything for me from talking to the insurance company down to the final inspection of my repaired car.

name: Ross Jacobs
text:
They did a fantastic job on my Toyota Van. Great customer service. Did the job fast and at a great price.

Thanks,
Cockrell's

name: Ross Jacobs
text:
They did a fantastic job on my Toyota Van. Great customer service. Did the job fast and at a great price.

Cockrell's

text: They do great work,  but take longer than expected. Why I can only give 4 stars.

text: They stole my radar detector, when I called them out about it they made up a BS excuse

resp.text: Mr. Dismukes. We haven't had any accuations or complaints about any radar detectors stolen. Which location are you referring to?

name: Mark Magee
text: I see the other Google reviews on here and I have to tell you I think they miss the mark.  Most of those reviews are old and I didn't do business with them back then, but my recent experience was great.  These guys do flawless work.  Greg really seems to be in tune with what a pain it is to have to get your car worked on after an accident and makes the situation more bearable.  I hope I don't have to use them again anytime soon, but if I need paint and body work, this is where I'm going!

name: Forrest Derr
text: Have used Cockrell's for about 10 years for maintaining our vehicle fleet.  Great people and quality service.

name: LATIKKI RILEY
text: Took longer than expected but did great work.

name: Tim Wiggins
text: Very professional 👏 👌

name: Teresa Blount
text: I just got a quote to replace a fender. $3,060.00! I’ve gotten 2 other quotes for under $600.00 yikes!

resp.text:
Teresa, that is a big difference for sure.  I'm curious to see what rates, parts, procedures and materials are being used for a $600.00 repair?  Yikes!  Please stop by one of our Mobile locations, and I'd be glad to review all the estimates with you to show you where the differences are and discuss your options.  Additionally, I don't agree that a preliminary estimate price difference supports a 1 Star review.
Sincerely,
Dan Bridges, G.M.
Mobile, AL

name: Ryder 21
text: Great place

resp.text: Thank you Javis for your review. I know our customers appreciate knowing we are one of the best collision repair shops in the area!!!!

Hi Trey, I apologize for such a delayed reply but we're so pleased that your experience was excellent!
Everyone here @ Cockrell's Body Shop was so proud to hear of your positive comments. Thank you!

name: Jennifer Wooldridge

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, Jennifer.  We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us—and we agree, Luke is truly a gem to have on our team! We count ourselves lucky for customers like you!

text: We have taken several vehicles to them and have always been pleased with their work.  They deliver what they promise, on time and the quality is good.
