Great people to do business with! They're fair priced and the work is done in the time frame that they said it would be. I live in Fl. and if I ever need body work on my SUV, I'll definitely go back to Al. to Franklin Paint & Body, LLC
I highly recommend this company!!

name: kattie curiel
text:
Franklin paint and body just rebuilt the front of our 2011 Toyota Prius.
After hitting a deer we had to pay out of pocket to fix this, and they worked with us to ensure we got the best for our money. They also did an amazing job with the finished product, couldn't be more satisfied, more thankful than I am to know a great team for auto work!
Thanks Franklin paint and Body.

name: george linton
text: Had some corrosion on my mustangs hood and trunk lid. They took care of it and repainted both. Perfect match and great service all around. You won’t go wrong using these guys.

name: Cary Woolley
text: Awesome place!! Does amazing work

name: Luke Hartsfield
text: My wife’s van was accidentally damaged while parked at church. Chad Hartsfield with State Farm recommended Franklin Paint and Body in Chelsea for repairs. I am extremely particular about vehicles and their appearance. I gave them a heads up about how hard to please I am. I took the van in on Monday AM. They promised to have it ready by Friday. To my surprise, they called for it to be picked up Thursday. When I got there and saw it, I was very impressed. The whole front end looked new. Perfect job. They went above and beyond what was required. Blended paint on fenders. They even replaced pin stripping. If I ever need similar work again, that’s where I will go. Brandon and Mandy were super!!

name: Shea Barnett
text: Great staff! Very knowledgeable and their quality of work is always top notch!

name: Steve Gallegos
text: Friendly and do good work.

name: Mal Sinclair
text: I backed into my husbands truck and we wanted to avoid an insurance claim so we took my van to a shop previous to going to Franklins, their estimate was $1,800. We are new to the area so I decided to check the Nextdoor app where several recommended Franklins. We got an estimate that was half of the first estimate, aside from that my husband felt very comfortable, the staff was incredibly friendly so we decided to go with Franklins. We just picked the van up and they did such an amazing job! It’s so hard to find a honest and reputable body shop, I could not recommend Franklins enough!!

name: Madame Ovary
text: Fantastic experience with Franklin Paint & Body. They did excellent work and had my car ready before it was promised. Bonus: They also detailed my vehicle and even cleaned up some cosmetic damage at no charge and without being asked. Can't recommend this business enough. Great folks!

name: Samuel Xavier Ervin
text: Gave me a good deal. If I have any other issues with my cars in the future, it's where I will go.

name: LMM D'max
text: I'm the owner of an 08 LMM duramax.  This truck means a lot to me.  I was referred to Franklin Automotive and am very happy I went.  I got 2 other quotes and Brandon and his guys fixed my truck for less than half the cost of his competitors. Brandon and his wife are hands down the most professional and honest people I have met in a shop like this.  Thanks to the employees and owners of this shop.  5 stars all the way.

name: Michael Vanhook
text: Excellent service and speed to deliver repairs. We have repaired our vehicles 3+ times with them. We've never needed to return for additional work.

name: Paul Monnette
text:
I have had my Vette for 18 years and Franklin has repaired my baby's boo boo's twice now. They do amazing work!  I have also used them for a professional parade ready detailing. I can't say enough about their; quality, service & reasonable pricing.
Thank you Franklin Paint & Body!

name: Doug Hartman
text: They have done about 6 of my companies trucks. I allowed them to do my truck after I struck a deer. Every piece of trim they removed is falling off. They broke every tab. I even lost the cap to my tailgate and it almost hit the windshield of the car behind me. The paint is pealing in places and you can see the old color where they missed taping. Not again...

name: Dorothy Welch-Brasher
text: Took a while to get my truck back. The work done on it was very good. They were professional and kept me updated on the progress of my vehicle.

name: Joseph Gray
text: I've used Franklin paint and body for several years on multiple vehicles and they have ALWAYS gone above and beyond what is expected. Brandon is very particular about his work and his entire staff is friendly and prompt. Hopefully I won't need their services very often, but in the event that I do need a paint and body shop I'll be calling them.

name: Denson Parker
text: The only place in Birmingham for car  body work.  Quality and reasonable price along with quick service.

name: Melinda Ledford
text: Some of the most friend service around!

name: Jim C
text: I trusted ADR with my classic Ferrari to do a paint correction and ceramic coating. They did a fantastic job and handled my car with great care. Very satisfied...5 stars!!!

resp.text: Thanks so much Jim it was a great pleasure working on your baby. Be happy to see you stop by in the future

name: MARY U BROWN
text: My brother and I both took our vehicles here for repairs and WOW did they do a GREAT JOB!! He had "holes" in his car from hail damage and let me tell you this car looks brand new, we are grateful for their service and at way less then the competitor price too.  I work in insurance & I send all my clients here.

name: JP Tribble
text: Did a better job than I thought was possible. I would recommend the work!

resp.text: Thanks such, I'm glad you was happy with the job

name: Emily H. Vandiver
text: ADR recently did outstanding fender repair work on my Lexus.  Doug, is very personable and a professional business owner.  He provided me a fair estimate, quick response, and excellent results.  He made sure that the repair was done correctly ... the paint job matched perfectly.  Kevin was also very efficient in handling the scheduling and paperwork.  They seem to be very customer oriented and are concerned about providing quality service.  I would definitely recommend them to others.

name: Spencer JHOG
text: Picked up my F250 today and I am super satisfied!!! Brought it in with a MAJOR dent on the right front fender that ran across a body line and now it looks like new! I've been a car nut all my life and know how hard a dent like this is to fix and Doug and Kevin blew me away. Incredible talent. OK, it is darn near a two decade old pickup but it made my day to see my baby looking good. These old Fords have some tough steel in them so I'm sure it was way more work than what the bill reflected. Thanks!!!

name: Roy Gambino
text: True professionals! I rarely write a review for anything, but was so impressed with Alabama Dent Repair (Kevin and his team) that I wanted to give them a shout out.  I have a relatively new Jeep Gladiator that suffered a small dent (ding) on the left rear quarter panel.  I'm always particular about where I park and absolutely hate dents/dings on vehicles. Alabama Dent Repair performed a paintless dent repair (PDR) on the damage and the dent/ding has literally disappeared.  It exceeded my expectations of what could be done and I couldn't be happier!  I contemplated purchasing one of the PDR kits on Amazon and attempting the repair myself...  Then I thought better - "Let a professional do it right the first time..."  So glad I did!  For the price of a cheap PDR kit on Amazon, Alabama Dent Repair removed the dent/ding better than I ever could have hoped to.  Good to know there are businesses out that that still care, deliver on their promises, and all for a very fair price.  Thanks again Kevin!

resp.text: Thanks so much Roy for the kind word you spoke about us. If you need anything else please give us a call first. I will do what can to help you. It was a great pleasure meeting you.

name: Kathleen Jackson
text: I've been dealing with the owner Doug for years he's always been my go to guy with all of my cars and I've always been completely satisfied with the work and price. The Staff at ADR are always professional  and friendly. I wouldn't recommend going anywhere else! Thanks Doug!!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much Kathleen for letting us work on your camaro. It's always a pleasure to help you

name: Ryen Harbin
text: Overall the best experience I’ve ever had in this type of business. They were very polite, on time, and were quick to get me into their busy work schedule. If you have any problems and need body work or anything relating to your vehicle to deal with this business I highly recommend them. Hands down the only place I will take my vehicles from here on out.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, we're glad to help you out

name: Kimberly Norris
text: Very friendly and helpful staff. Prices are reasonable and they did a great job of fixing and repainting dents and scratches on our car

resp.text: We would like to thank you so much for stopping in. It was a great pleasure helping you

name: Randy Bafford
text: Highly recommend ADR great knowledgeable staff and always willing to go that extra mile to make there customers happy thank you to the entire staff for helping me with more then a few of my personal vehicles and also my friends keep up the awesome work

name: james Lowdell
text: I had a little dent on the trunk lid of my car, and took it to Alabama Dent Repair. They were awesome ! I took it down for them to look at, they booked it in on Labor Day morning at 8am, and I cannot believe when I went to pick it up, the dent was gone and perfect !! They are great to deal with, very professional and really good work..  Very impressed.

name: Joseph Campbell
text: Good work for good price

name: Melissa Stoltz
text: I have delt with Doug Newton since 1996 and he is the most honest and great person to help with any cosmetic needs for your autos 💯

name: Josh H
text: I'm pretty disappointed w/ this group. I hear they do solid work. I can't verify that though because I couldn't get them to respond or do the work. I drove by there, talked to the owner. He said he'd call back that day w/ some options and thoughts. Never called. I reached out two or three times on FB...one response then nothing. I called the office multiple time, left some messages. Nothing. I suppose if you can't get much comms on the front side, makes me a little worried about the comms during the process. Idk...I run a business myself, so this sort of thing is just odd to me. Again, they may do fine work; maybe not. It's possible they only go after the major insurance bucks and don't care about individual customers. That's also fine...just say that so you don't waste individual people's time I suppose.

resp.text: Hey there Josh I just wanted to once again tell you I'm very sorry about not getting back in touch with you. At the time when we was talking I was very short on staff and let our conversation slip thru the cracks. I do want you to know that we look at every customer the same, whether they are insurance or self pay. Again I'm so sorry that we give you a bad feeling and do appreciate you letting us know what we did wrong. We are trying our best to correct these issues so it doesn't happen again.  Again thanks and have a great day

name: Diane Reisentz
text: I am thrilled with there service. My 5 day old car was hit in the parking lot. I was told by others that it could not be fixed because of the area it was hit. Well not true! Doug did an amazing job for a reasonable price. Highly recommend. I wouldn't go any where else.

name: Brandy
text: Doug is easy to work with and does quality work consistently.

resp.text: Just want to say thanks for letting us help you out

name: Dave Bender
text:
Recon Techs Huntsville is the premier vehicle reconditioning center in the Huntsville area. With a 10,000 square foot Auto Body/Collision, Professional Detailing and Vehicle Reconditioning Center they are your only true one stop vehicle reconditioning center in Huntsville.

The owner, Doug Newton, and his entire staff are highly trained with many years experience. Recon Techs Huntsville also offers the entire line of Professional Grade and Performance Guaranteed Recon Techs Detail Products and is the exclusive Certified Installation Center for Tsunami Nano Ceramic High Performance Coatings in the Huntsville area.

You can trust your car, truck, motorcycle,RV, ATV, boat or aircraft to Recon Techs Huntsville if you want the job done right !!

name: Glen Strobach
text: Very good customer service, high quality work, awesome results!  Do not try anyone else, let Doug take care of everything.  You can pay more and waste your time somewhere else, or just come here

name: Lee Clark
text: I have a new 2020 Toyota, I was at the Medical Mall Monday standing outside next to my car a SUV parked next to me and swung the door open and dented my car and chipped the paint, carried my car to Alabama Dent Repair this morning my car was repaired while I waited, Doug the owner was the person who fixed my car and touched up the paint, when he finished I had to ask where the dent was before I brought it in, it looked just as it did the day I bought the car, Doug is a friendly and professional person and his staff is also, I highly recommend this business who wants the job done right, it is a one stop shop, if I have any more problems I won't even call anywhere else, I'll go to Alabama Dent Repair, the cost of the repair was half of what I was expecting to pay, they also do a variety of work other than dent repair I just can't say enough about this business.

resp.text: I would like to thank you so much for coming in and seeing us. I was a great pleasure meeting you and letting me fix your car. I really enjoyed talking to you about your old truck seeing that I'm a huge fan for the old school rides. Please feel free to stop in anytime.

name: William Adams
text: They do some of the best work I have seen.there employees are great with there helping you to get the job done.if you need work done go see them I recommend it

name: Dan Pritchard
text: Best body shop in town!!

name: ashley brink
text: I brought my vehicle in and was under the impression I would pick it up looking better than it did after my wreck. I understand it's not a 40k vehicle but feel like there was a lack of reguard altogether. Their was no prep work on my brush guard and the damage from the wreck wasnt even sanded before paint. Here we are a a week later the  new paint is peeling off already. It was repainted  and then pulled out and there is white paint from the equipment  used, and stands out considering it is black. I stated multiple times when  I dropped it off that I was not concerned about the grill and the 3 scratch marks it had but now it is painted black, and looks like a weird replacement, considering all the accents are grey. I have no clue where the black came from  unless it was around the time the grill was being painted and they just ran with it. I am kicking myself for not swapping the panel and brush guard myself. You live and learn I guess.

resp.text: Hi Ashley I'm so sorry about you being unhappy with your repair and love to try and take care of it. If you was unhappy please just say something and we will be glad to try and make it right. I definitely want to make sure my customers are pleased with their repairs. At your convenience please come by so we can go over the repair and I will do what I can to correct it.

name: susan glandon
text: Doug Newton owns this, aka Recon Techs. He has worked on my vehicles for twenty years. If I can't figure out how to fix something, he becomes my second brain. And his reconditioning and painting is second to none.

name: David Cleveland
text: Unbelievable Service. These guys charge a very competitive rate and did excellent work! They even got me in right away. I'd highly recommend them!

resp.text: It was a pleasure working on your car. Thanks for the business and hope to see you again

name: Vernon Stone
text: They were great

name: DJ Cold Cash
text: Great ppl

name: Jerry Whitt
text: Awesom6group of guys and quality work!

name: Michael Muriithi
text: Highly highly recommend this place.  Honest guy and awesome work.!!!! Had a small but deep dent, he did a great job on my mustang,  had it back the same day.

name: Dustin Honeycutt
text: Doug did a phenomenal job removing a significant door crease using his paint-less techniques. Repair was quick and very affordable. I would highly recommend ADR to anyone.

name: Bobby Lupo
text: If you can think it , they can do it !  The best in Madison Co.

name: Alan Nalley
text: A deer did a good amount of damage to my Dodge Charger. Doug fixed it quick and he fixed it right. I'd recommend this guy to anyone!

name: Clayton Simons
text: These guys are awesome. Good work and fair prices  I'll be back if I get any more dents

name: Matt george
text:
ADR did an excellent job removing several large dents from my bmw hood. Paint
less repair. The hood is absolutely perfect. No wrinkles or paint damage. I will absolutely be using ADR in the future. Highly recommended.

name: Ten Ring
text: The driver's door of my 2017 Audi Q3 was repainted/repaired by Alabama Dent Repair, it looks factory new, no waves or “egg shell”. Thanks Doug!

resp.text: Happy we could get your car looking great again

name: Malcolm Smith
text: Quality auto repair shop.

resp.text: Thanks a bunch glad to be able to help you out.

name: chris pierce
text: Great job

name: Paul E
text:
Fixed my door lock at a great price and used some real ingenuity to repair it inexpensively.  Is now my go to body repair guy.
Smart, diligent and honest.

name: Gerald T. Blomeyer
text: Painted front clip on my 85 Toronado. Great job Great price

name: stinson knott
text: They did an excellent job and took the time to explain everything I really appreciated that

name: Belinda Conley
text: My grandson's car was damaged twice this year and I used this shop both times. Each time the work was completed on time and it looked like it was never hit.  The owner took time to time to explain how to look for previously done work and the difference in "flakes" in the paint. This is my go -to shop and I highly recommend it to others.

name: Holland Taylor
text: They are fair and work with you. Friendly and fast workers. I was explained all options in a way I could understand  since  I'm not car savvy, but I felt comfortable knowing it was being taken care by them.

name: Jade Mitchell
text: I wrecked my car just three days after moving to Huntsville and these guys made it their business to get my car back to me! They were so helpful and kind. I pleased with my experience here. For any of your auto body needs look no further!!

name: John Korak
text: I've been taking my vehicles to these folks for 20 years.  Insurance claims and smaller stuff.  They will work with you and do good work.  thumbs up.

name: RocketMan73
text:
I was thoroughly impressed with Auto Collision Doc, both quality and service, and the price was better than I expected. A couple months ago in August, they repaired some ugly collision damage on my front bumper and fender of my old Nissan pickup truck, from when I ran into an unmarked city contruction site several years ago.
When I first arrived, the owner Roland Edger immediately met with me and talked with me about several options: what would look best, what would cost least, what parts would be most readilly available, and so forth. He came up with an exact quote and timetable for repair, without ever pressuring me. My truck was repaired within a week, and it looks great (almost new), and all for a price much lower than I had expected. I would definitely hire Auto Collision Doc again!

name: Curtis Johnson Jr
text: Awesome people here

name: Joshua Eliser
text:
Wow, we couldn't be happier about the service and quality of the detailing they did to our Prius!  We just finished a cross-country move with our pets, and our car really needed to be professionally cleaned.  There was a fair amount of pet hair in the car and they did a fantastic job!  I'd highly recommend Autoworkz to anyone looking for car detailing.

Finding the place was a little awkward.  The building is laid out funny and a sign to say drive around back and down the little hill would helpful.  But aside from that, definitely coming back in the future!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the review!!  We will be addressing the signage very soon!!

name: jason scogins
text: I took my brand new VW Tiguan and had a ceramic coating put on it to protect the paint.  The end result exceeded my expectations and the quality of service.  From the most basic wash to the most advanced paint protection, these are the guys you need to use!

name: James A.
text: Uses the best ceramic coating available, and unlike most other detailers in Huntsville, he takes a tremendous amount of pride in his work.  Prin and Autoworkz are the best detailer and detail shop in all of North Alabama.

name: Matthew M.
text:
I’ve dealt with every detailer, especially the high end ones, in Huntsville. Prin is by far the best detailer in Huntsville and the best I’ve dealt with in my life (up and down the east coast).  His work just stands above the rest!

Edit: Added photos to his most recent detail job on my CTS-V Wagon.

resp.text: Thanks so much for this!  We work hard to make sure that our customers are protected!

name: Beck Mitchell
text: Prin and his team have always taken great care of my vehicles and provide the best value for any detailing shop in town.

name: Preston Johnson
text: This guy is first class all the way. Look no further, this is it when comes to all your detailing needs. Communication was great.  He answers all emails almost instantly and never left me second guessing my decision. Your vehicle is in good hands here.

name: Matthew Glidden
text: By far the best place in town to get your ride detailed and protected.  The brought new life into my 05 black corvette and made the water afraid of my car. Washing it is now a breeze and they will be doing my brand new 2021 AT4 before it gets beat up by the daily use!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the nice words Matt!  We try to do our best with every vehicle that comes into our shop.

name: Caitlyn Wilson
text: AutoworkZ did an outstanding job protecting my vehicle. He went above and beyond my expectations and was very knowledgeable! We will continue to bring all of our vehicles here and highly recommend him to anyone looking to protect their investment in their automobile with ceramic coating / detailing. The customer service is impeccable. Thanks Autoworkz!

name: Jeffrey Todd Henderson
text: As has been stated before, Prin and his guys are the BEST. Super nice guy and the highest quality work. I am very picky, and have high expectations, AutoworkZ exceeded them by miles. GREAT JOB! HIGHLY RECOMMEND! Thanks Prin!

name: Jessica Stine
text: I highly recommend any service that you need done to your car whether it's a detail or a paint correction! text: Highly recommended! I brought in my Tesla for a ceramic coating, and it left looking way better than it did the day I bought it. The color looks deeper, the swirls have been removed, and it looks exactly how I wanted it to.

text: We dropped my wife’s car off to have an interior detailing done on a Saturday, and we couldn’t have been happier with the results. They were able to remove water stains from the seats, and dog hair from the vehicle in just a day.

text: Heard about Prin from the intertubes and decided to give him a try. Worth every penny! Super thorough and reasonably priced. Highly recommended.

text: Wow! Very impressed. Would definitely recommend AutoworkZ.

name: Mafic
text: Just relocated to the area from Missouri and was in desperate need of a deep clean, inside and out. Prin and his crew at Autoworkz did an absolutely phenomenal job on the truck! To top it off, when I went to get it a solitary random rain cloud came over and rained on the truck as it was waiting to be picked up. Prin insisted he keep it over night and rewash it. His service is head and shoulders above the rest! Whether you need a good hand wash, a top to bottom detailing, or a top of the line ceramic wax Prin at Autoworkz will take care of you and your vehicle with affordable pricing and second-to-none service.

name: Mike Giles
text: Prin does amazing work, even if you don’t have a high end ride.  He put as much effort into my wife’s van as he would a luxury car.  I am really pleased with how the van turned out.  After a summer of hauling sweaty kids around.  It needed some freshening up.  Prin and his team knocked it out in a couple hours.  The van looks better than new.  And smells great also.

resp.text: Thanks so much!  I am glad that we were able to get it taken care of in that short period of time.  It was a pleasure work with you today.

They kept me in the loop with what was going on with my car, as well as what was happening with my insurer. The communication was great, and every interaction was friendly and helpful!
All in all it is a fantastic shop to go to!

text: They do quality work. Nice people. If you have an issue after they perform the repair they will inspect the vehicle again. A great recommendation from a friend.

name: John Thomas
text: Rod's is always great. I've honestly had to use them way too much with the amount accidents I've had. But this last one wasn't my fault. They did a great job as usual. Tyler Gallagher at the south parkway location is great. I probably called too much to ask questions and such. but he made sure everything was done correctly. Even did some stuff for my car that didn't have to be done. I always recommend Rod's to anyone that is in need of body work. They did a great job matching the pearl white paint (which is a hard color to match on a car) on my last car that I had. And they did a pretty good job matching the paint on my silver 2011 Honda that I have now. There's definitely a difference between the new paint on the new fender and the old paint on the hood but otherwise they did a great job and whoever they use to detail the car when you pick it up does a great job too. I swear I could have taken my car to the Honda dealership and gotten what I owe on the car or more than I owe. It looked that good. even my friend that drove me to pick up the car said how good of a job they did.

name: Patrick O'Hear
text: Great service great detail

name: Samuel Lasseter
text: I recently had some work done at this body shop and I felt they were professional and helpful all the way through the process. If you have a body shop need I would highly recommend Rod's!

name: John Thomas
text: I had a review before but it must have gotten deleted. Braden, Tyler, and Chelsea are the best. I am very particular about my cars and Tyler and Braden understand completely. I’ve had them work on several of my cars always did a great job. They matched my pearl white paint on my 2013 Ford Focus perfectly. And when I hit a deer in my 2011 Honda Accord they even went the extra mile and fixed things they didn’t have to like some overspray on my left doors of my Honda. They wet sanded it and made it look like new. I swear I could have taken the honda to the dealer I bought it at and could have gotten close to what I paid for it. Actually when I traded it in the Kia dealer kept commenting on how great it looked. I just had them repair some stuff on my grandma’s car and it looked great. It was so clean and shiny and the paint matched perfectly. It was so clean you could see all the little chips in the paint from being a grocery getter and Tyler went around the car and was touching up every little thing on spots they didn’t even work on. We kept telling him that he didn’t have to. The work they had done on the front and rear bumper looked perfect. My family jokes that I’m their number one customer. But I hope to never have to take my brand new car to them, but if something does happen to my new car I will be taking it to Rod’s. A few years before I even knew about Rod’s I took my car to Joe Hudson across the street from them and it took them about a day to just repaint my rear bumper from getting rear ended and they didnt even blend the the paint. And when I had taken my car to Joe Hudson it was done in about a day. But Rod’s they take a few days to a week and you can tell a difference in the work. I know I’m rambling but I cannot brag on them enough. They even invited me to just come up and have a cup of coffee at the shop. They treat you like family. I’m so glad a coworker sent me to them. I will always refer people to them. I can’t wait to see how good of a job they do on my significant other’s daughter’s car. Their prices are reasonable too.

text: Absolutely fantastic repair work. Great people to work with no matter the circumstances. They blended the paint perfectly on my custom car and kept me up-to-date on the process during the whole time. For Huntsville, this is the best you can get!

name: Brandi Anuskiewicz
text:
Shout out to Hoffren’s Auto Diagnostics in Fairhope!!!
They are an honest & hardworking group! They didn’t oversell- ever. Always recommend exactly what is needed. Always fix amazingly well at fair prices. They are accredited & the work legally stands up to any potential vehicle recall issues.

I’ve had 2 vehicles worked on by them (in one instance, was dealing with the dealership as well & able to compare suggested repairs/quotes.)

Example:
The dealership told me rotors needed to be replaced & all motor mounts. Quoted me around $1,500 and couldn’t tell me exactly.
Hoffrens (not knowing what dealership said) told me rotors needed to be turned & 1 motor mount needed to be replaced, plus took the time to explain without me asking. Including oil change & cleaning throttle body, as well- the entire quote was less than half the dealerships unsure quote.

text:
The staff at Chico’s are awesome... But it’s a shame that Chico is a total jack—. Maybe he is just struggling financially 🤔
My car has been ready for a couple of days now.
He wouldn’t release the car without the final payment from the insurance company..
His own employee verified that the check was disbursed.
I ask to speak with Chico regarding picking my car up..The person I was speaking with failed to put the call on hold while he spoke with Chico regarding the
Situation..
Chico gave him a rude and nasty response..
Once he came to the telephone, I let him know I heard everything he said..
Long story short...
I won’t be back nor I’m recommending his services to anyone..
I’m contacting my insurance company so helpful he will be blacklisted with them.
Lesson, Learned, helping the little business doesn’t always turn out..
Just keep going to the bigger company that is tried and true..
The
End

resp.text: Hi Ida. Thank you for you review of our service. Our goal is to always  be friendly and prompt when managing your repairs.  I am extremely sorry for the negative experience you had due to our policy of receiving full payment before the car can be picked up. It's  never our intention for our customers to be without their car any longer than necessary. In the future we will do a better job communicating our payment policy more clearly. Again, I am very sorry and always available to talk with you about your experience. Jeff Welch/ Owner 205 563-5082

name: Christy Hickey
text: My 3 heroes! We were passing through town and decided to stop and grab a bite to eat at the Subway. In a hurry to grab and go,I locked the keys in the car. I called 3 locksmiths and each had thier own reason for not being able to help me. I was at a loss! We decide to eat and think about what to do next. But the Lord had a handle on it. A couple of Firemen pulled up to do some maintenance on the hydrant so I walked out to  ask for help. They said they couldn't but there was a body shop down the road they would ask them. It was only a few minutes later a gentleman walked in Subway and asked if I needed help. I was so relieved! We went to the car and he accessed the situation then pulled out a couple of tools that looked like they were from another planet, but he knew what he was doing. He fiddled and fiddled but that door lock was not cooperating. The Firemen and myself were standing by cheering him on and giving advice as to what we thought would work. Justin stayed steady and with good humor did not give up.  We could see the keys, they were sitting on the console. So close but yet so difficult to get.  Giving up on the idea of pushing the door lock to release it Justin decided to go after the keys by hooking them with that long metal pole. Now things were getting really interesting!  The Firemen were on the opposite side of the car guiding Justin as to how close he was to picking up the set of keys that had at least 10 rings and keys jumbled up in a mess.  He hooked it!!! Now the dilemma was to lift the keys and bring them to the door that had a very small opening held open by a black plastic bag full of air. He was successful getting the keys to the opening and the young Fireman put his finger in the open groove to hold them while Justin pumped up the black bag  to increase the opening so the keys could slide through to the outside. It worked!!!! Yay!!!! Thank you so much Justin and the Firemen, you are MY HEROES!!!

name: Joshua Schwartz (BloodPoolBoy)
text: The reviews were right. They don't even answer the phone

name: Liz Fields
text:
I was going to immediately post a review because I was so angry when we picked our RV up from them but I waited and did my research (which I should have done before I used them) and now I am posting my review. My husband and I are fulltime RV'ers so our RV is our home and my husband travels for work. So when we found out that our exhaust manifold was cracked we needed someone quickly. So without proper research we took it to these guys. They gave us a crazy estimate but was told that it was JUST an estimate, that it really depended on how hard the exhaust manifold was to remove and if any bolts broke as they were removing it. We dropped it off on a Thursday morning at 8:00 a.m. On Monday at noon my husband was informed that the parts were still not in. Then on Monday at 4:00 p.m. my husband was told that it was ready to be picked up. Since we were over an hour away we told them we would pick it up on Tuesday. My husband was also told that the final bill was $2,990.00. WHAT??? We were flabbergasted because they had told my husband that the exhaust manifold came off easy and that no bolts had broken. My husband talked to the service manager and disputed the bill but the service manager would not budge so in order to get our RV back we had to pay it. Then I did my research and talked to several other diesel mechanics and also talked with some other freightliner and cummins mechanics and was told that they seriously overcharged us for the work that is shown on the bill. The bill states the following "Pulled unit in shop. removed turbo and exhaust manifold. Cleaned the head and the turbo. Installed and torqued new exhaust manifold and turbo with all new gaskets and bolts. Cleaned inside and out. Ran unit. Checked for leaks none found. Parked unit." They charged us $175.00 an hour and claimed 14 hours worth of work for a total labor cost of $2,450.00. No mention of any problems whatsoever in removing the exhaust manifold. In my talks with other diesel mechanics I was quoted anywhere from $1,200.00 to at the most (from another freightliner mechanic) $125.00 an hour for labor. And that it should not have taken 14 hours to do the job if there had been no problems. Another mechanic I spoke with said that if the parts were not there at noon but it was finished at 4:00 then it took them at the most 4 hours to "install and torque the new manifold and turbo with all new gaskets and bolts. Clean inside and out. Run unit. Check for leaks and park the unit." That would leave 10 hours for them to remove the exhaust manifold and that is overboard, especially since there were no issues in removing it. I was given some great advice and I am pursuing this. I was told that in order to hold the Freightliner name that they have to abide by a "Labor Guide" and to ask to see it (but we had already paid and picked the RV up so I was too late in doing that) so I have requested the labor guide requirements for this type of job. I have also requested quotes from other diesel mechanics based on what they said they did via the bill. And have contacted the main Freightliner offices. It is sad that we as consumers can not completely trust that we won't be screwed when we take our property to people.
On top of all of the above, when we were ready to leave my husband asked for the key and lo and behold they had lost it. They could not find the key to our RV. Really?? What kind of business that works on vehicles loses keys? It was a good thing that we had another key with us. I would recommend to do your research before you make a quick decision like we did.

name: Casey Tarantino
text: I don’t want to give them one star. They hurt us financially in the worst way. They are liars and thieves. My husband went to work for WTI in Alabama. Their repair shop is in cahoots with the Freightliner in the same town of Tuscaloosa. Just after a 90 day inspection my husband switched to WTI. They immediately on first day said there he needed over 6000.00 in repairs on his truck. We had no choice st the moment but to get it repaired where he could start work. Freightliner started repair on it. Finished it in THREE WEEKS!! So my husband was out of work for over 4 weeks due to this scam. After he was up & running again here in Pensacola we had to put it in the shop at Freightliner. After a week they found out that none of the parts had been replaced or were either old parts. It took another week to get it approved to not have to pay for the parts and labor on what was done! Then the manager in Pensacola found out that the Work was not even done by a licensed Mechanic in Tuscaloosa!!  Then of course the Pensacola Freightliner found some more things wrong of course. Like they always do. Sigh * we were out of work over 6 weeks due to this. I contacted the owner of the three Freightliner owned by him. One in Tuscaloosa and two in Atlanta area. He wouldn’t call me back at all. If we had had the money and time we would’ve had an attorney. Stay away from WTI in Tuscaloosa & FREIGHTLINER in Tuscaloosa. For the most parts there are is a lot of crookedness at Freightliners some more than others but TUSCALOOSA is the worst!! STAY AWAY!!!

text:
took car in for a factory paint job.   4 weeks later, dozens of defects.  Asked owner for refund; he said he would make things right.    4 weeks later, got car back with missing trim, trash in paint, front bumper hanging down (broken when they installed it).  Instead of metallic silver, car was gray.

Another body shop is finishing what these Neanderthals messed up.

text: I purchased a brand new vehicle from them April 29th. The service until the sell was made was nothing short of phenomenal. However, it ended there. It’s now been 5 weeks and they still haven’t sent my paperwork to my county for me to be able to purchase my tag. My wife and I have called multiple times and we get the same response. We will check and call you back. Guess what....no one ever calls back. I’m completely frustrated and have received warnings for no tag, so I now have a vehicle I can’t drive because I’m way beyond my 10 business days to have a tag. I recommend you shop somewhere else. I should have paid more and purchased local.

text: Love the service,  love the cars and every one friendly!

text:

The entire staff also made us feel welcome which we’ve had bad experiences at other dealerships. We will definitely buy from them again! Thank you Mikail!

name: A. Mck80
text: My experience at Autonation was awesome. My service advisor was Jason Williams and he saw to it that I had awesome service. Not only did he greet me when I drove up to the service center, but he made sure I had beverages to drink, he checked in with frequently to keep me informed of the progress they were making on automobile, and he saw to it that I received the services I requested and I received them in a timely manner. He was absolutely awesome and I will come back again.

name: LaToya B
text: This place was the absolute worse place I ever been to for car repair service. They were very unprofessional. They lied to me and told me my services would be covered under warranty. They said they called and then told me later warranty was not covering. My car went into the shop running and was there for 3 weeks. When I tried to go get it now they are saying it needs a whole new motor. It was so many levels to this, but I would never in my life ever buy a Dodge and I will never go to that dealership again. Everyone that work there is a complete joke.

name: Christopher Peters
text: They have trouble wearing masks correctly. Also, the Service department treats customers like an after thought.

name: jan vickers
text: automation is awesome! they bought my vehicle and found the exact suv I wanted!! Alexis was so sweet, and oh so helpful!

name: Jackie Camp
text: When my 2014 Chrysler 200 needs service I take it to AutoNation because they are professional and they check everything to make sure no issues arise.  When it's going to be a long wait they come and let you know were they are on each step of repair.  They always have coffee and water if needed.  They also check on recall parts so you want have to come back they fix it doing your service visit.  They always offer other discounts on oil changes, tires and other necessities.  I wouldn't take my Chrysler anywhere else.

name: Matt Montenegro
text: Some of the most sleezy people that give all car sales men a bad name. Purchased a used vehicle from this dealership in May of 2020. I was sold when I was told that my vehicle had an Auto Nation warranty of "90 days or 4,000 miles." Sounds great doesn't it? Well after being hurried along in signing paperwork so the vehicle could be mine I was very happy with my purchase. However, less than a month later, and still well within my "warranty" coverage period I got a Christmas tree of lights on my dashboard. I was told to take it to its dealership and from there I could then make the claim. When I called to make the claim, Auto Nation's warranty service said there was no vehicle with my VIN in the system. I then called the manager there who told me, "I never signed any contract stating I had a warranty and it doesn't matter what I was told because it isn't in writing." I realized the manager was right about this however, I was being told one thing then they intentionally rushed me through signing paperwork so that I wouldn't catch that I never signed anything for my "warranty". The deceptive methods of these people shows that they are talented at one thing and, one thing only and, that is lying to people. These people are clearly slimy and cannot be trusted, save yourself the hassle and do not purchase a vehicle from here. Learn from my mistake, don't come here. Where ever you do go, whatever you are offered make sure it is in writing!!!!

name: William Mott
text: The two service advisors I usually deal with are Michael Robinson and Ken Baker; they are always friendly and helpful. I dropped off my truck for service (oil change, tire rotation, etc.) and Ken Baker called back to notify me that my vehicle was ready. As far I know, the work was done satisfactorily.

name: Charles Bailey
text: I’ve never had any problems with them. Good quality work on time. They’ll tell you if something else needs to be looked at.

name: Samantha Stefan
text: I have purchased 3 Vehicles from this Dealership with my Husband and have had the same salesman Austyn ! He is Humble and Honest and that means a lot these days when purchasing a vehicle. They met my expectations and we will continue to buy from here as long as he is there. The best experiences I have ever had at any Dealership and I have bought many vehicles in my lifetime!!! Thank you Austyn you Rock !!!

name: Alfonso Packer
text: Consumer service was very poor. Upon arrival to pick up my car after recall work I had to stand in the lobby for 20mins before I was even acknowledged to get help. Then the service guy who said he had my paper so he would him me continued a phone call for an additional 30 mins. It didn’t bother me until I heard the conversation, which seemed personal not AutoNation business related, so I decided to go to parts while I waited to get so things. That department was great. After finishing up he still was on phone so I went to someone else to see if I could be helped then he decided to pull up my paperwork and noticed it was a recall job and only need a signature and to hand me my keys. I will never probably use the service department if that was a example of the customer service to expect.

name: Richard Dodson
text: Had some warranty work done on my 2019 Ram 1500. Troy was very knowledgeable of what needed to be done, and the service technicians did a great with the small issues that had, andchad my truck ready to go in a timely manner. Great job Autonation team.

text: Great service team. Ken was extremely patient throughout the journey. I experienced some flood damage in September 2019 that required major repairs to include a rental for a few weeks. Updates were offered and a complete thorough summary of what was serviced. Ken and the team wereprofessional. My vehicle was as showroom ready as the day I purchased it from them. Roll Tide.

name: Daijha Doss
text: NONE of my experiences at autonation have been pleasant. I’m either here all day or have to leave my car for days at a time because they can’t seem to do their jobs. My car was there for 2 days just to get the battery changed (I kid you not). Now I’m waiting on a part for my car and dear lord you would think they had to actually build the part themselves. I’ve been told 3 different stories about this part. I’ve had my car for almost 4 years now and EVERY SINGLE TIME I’m in there someone is upset about how they run this place. Now I’m that someone. Thanks for nothing Autonation. Keep up the good work.

name: Rick McNeill

So honestly never doing business with this dealership ever again. I suggest everyone get oil changes at Honda rather than this dealership... buy your cars somewhere else, the bad service outweighs the quality of their trucks.

Great company, great atmosphere, and it was awesome working with Chris and Austin
They made us feel at easy and comfortable
My husband and I would definitely do business with this company again
Thanks guys

name: Dana Adcock
text: 10 years ago we bought a new Jeep Grand Cherokee.   No one has ever touched this car but Auto Nation.  A couple months age my husband took the car in for repair.  A new condenser had to be installed.  After the work was completed, when we picked the car up, the dash lights were out.   We were told there would be an additional $300 or more to fix it.  This was very shabby business as it was fine before the work was done.   I’ve had a couple of issues with this establishment but let it go but this is going to far to expect us to pay for something that was broken while a very expensive repair was being done on the car.

name: Daniel Eisrnhard
text: Sid was very helpful throughout the whole process of repairing my wife’s vehicle through the extended warranty.  He spent time on the phone dealing with my warranty company and when it came time he even drove me in his own vehicle to the rental company.

name: Diane Krause
text: I took my car in for repair of the power adjustment on the driver seat. The service rep who took care of me made the scheduling and check-in nice and easy and arranged for the shuttle service to take me home. I was disappointed that the AutoNation website didn't allow me to schedule an appointment for repairs online (only maintenance services could be done online). I got a diagnosis and repair quote within a day, but word that it would take a week to get the part in. It turned out to be an additional day for the part to arrive, and I was told the car would be done the following day, but  it took two more days for it to get done. We came from the Houston area where we were used to parts being accessible more quickly, so this wait time may be normal for the Mobile area. The pickup experience was a bit frustrating. I picked up on a Saturday and waited 1 hour 15 minutes to get checked out (was told the car was ready but paperwork had to be done). The service rep kept getting pulled away by walk-ins, phone calls, and I'm not sure what else, but it seemed I kept getting bumped to the back of the line. There may have been more legitimate reasons for the long wait time, but those weren't shared with me. Everyone was nice and helpful, and my car was repaired, but the wait times were a bit disappointing.

text: Parts department is a joke. Spent 10 minutes going in circles trying to reach someone there. Eventually just hangup.

It’s weird to me that I didn’t get the title that day but now it has been a month and I still don’t have the paperwork. I’m still driving around with no tag, just the temp tag.

If you're looking to sell a vehicle and don't want to mess with CL or haggle with another dealer, autonation was great for me.

text: Always excellant service with very high standards - prices are more than comparable.

name: Christopher P
text: I went to this shop in late 2015 to have my plastic bumper repaired/replaced. I explained that my insurance had already paid me, and I was looking for ways to complete the job cheaply but correctly. They said they could repair vs replace the bumper with two days of work. 5 days later (3 days overdue) I pick up my car. The repair appeared to be done skillfully, but the paint job was aweful. The entire bumper had the orange peel appearance. I waited another couple hours and they improved it but still did poor quality work. I signed the paperwork that claimed the work and parts had a warranty. Approx 5 days later, the repair fell completely apart and the materials underneath the bumper fell off. When I returned to show them what had happened, they claimed they would not honor the warranty as it was a repair. This was in complete opposition to what they claimed before the repair. They then accused me of trying to engage in fraud and told me that I should not report this to my insurance company as this would incriminate me. I promptly called the insurance company, they said I had done nothing wrong but b/c they paid me to get the repairs done myself, they could not help. I agreed completely with the insurance company's assessment of the situation. I then called the better business bureau and filed a complaint. Several days later another piece of the bumper came off. This time, they were more responsive (probably due to the BBB's inquiry). In the end, they admitted the repair should never have been done, and a replacement of the bumper should have been done in the first place. They did replace the bumper at no cost to me. They did insist I was trying to engage in fraudulent activities, which was verified as false through my insurance. They simply tried to save a few bucks, and it took them a long time to realize thier repair was outside of their skill set or not possible with the part. Be careful, they are difficult to work with.

I'm not going to go into detail about how amazing my experience was because I don't want other customers to have an unreasonable expectation of this place.  That's just how fantastic my experience was.  The punctuality of keeping unreasonably, the respect and kindness of the staff, the workmanship of the repairs was absolutely astounding.

The manager of this location could make millions just teaching classes how to give stellar service.

I only wish these guys had service I used more often just so I could keep going back and give them my support.

name: Janice Lindley
text: Had my car towed to Cleveland Collision and Auto Service in June 2019  to replace the motor and paid in full for them to purchase the  motor, then paid in full for charges ask to install the motor.  I got the car back in January 2020 and it still was not in good running condition. The water pump was bad, the electrical wiring was not connected properly and the dash indications would not come on to let you know when something was wrong There were water hoses that ran from the water reservoir that was glued to where they connected to the motor, It was just a messy job and I can go on and on about things not done correct. Less than a month later  the car ran hot yet again without indicators to warn and now I am right back where I started and the car needs yet another motor. This business I am sure will not make it good, and for sure will not take the car back for them to keep over half a year to do yet more botched repairs.Would not trust this business with my bicycle.  Please Please find someone to do your auto repair before you consider this place. Just look around there are better places to trust to do the right thing.

text: I can't say enough good things about Cahaba Collision.  They are excellent. About 10 minutes after talking with Maggie about it, Trent called me and went even further with easing my fears.  That speaks volumes to me!!  He didn't have to do that at all!!  The quality of their work is top notch and grade A.  I would recommend them to anyone and should I need them again (which I hope I don't), they will be the first collision shop that I call.

name: John
text:
I believe this is the first time I've ever written a bad review for a business, but I feel I must in this case to protect others.  Last year, I had contracted with Payne's Body shop to have a car repaired which was damaged in a parking lot by one of my kids.  I agreed to pay all charges to repair the car which totaled about $1350.  The owner of the car said it was taking too long to get the car repaired, so she was going to have it fixed elsewhere.  I agreed to pay her directly and get reimbursed by Payne's.  Even though the owner of Payne's promised to send me my money back, it has been over a year and I have not received my money back. I have tried countless time to contact the owner of Payne's but he never returns my calls and is always "out of the office".  I contacted the BBB to see if they can help.  They just notified me that he is not responding to them either.  So now I will have to pursue legals means to get my money back.

Beware of doing business with Payne's, and if you do, request the work be done BEFORE you pay.

As a business owner, I cannot imagine attempting to treat a potential customer in this way.  I guess he already spent my money!!!

name: nita chandler
text: Got an estimate of how much it would be for my vehicle repaired completely. Agreed to price. Noone called to tell me my vehicle was ready. When I called, I was told they lost the original key to my vehicle he had to get another made and most of his profit went towards replacing my key. Not my problem. When I got there to get my vehicle, it was not properly completed. The mouldings was not tightly attached to the vehicle. I was told the mouldings wasn't included in the price..I'm like what???? This was a part of the repair estimate! I was told my vehicle would be cleaned up, etc. NOT DONE...I assume since my key was lost and he had to get another, that he would spend the money nor time to repair my vehicle correctly..Long story short..Never ever again! I only gave 2 stars because the paint was ok.

name: Terry Baaqee
text: Generations Gap

text: They had my car for a month. We kept being given a run around. It went from having to wait 10 days, to another week added onto that, to having to wait an entire month! The customer service really needs to improve. The only time we were ever given any type of information is if we called. Noone told us anything otherwise. We had to wait 3 days for paperwork before we were allowed to take my car and the 3rd day, it was still incomplete. Whoever is in charge of that also needs to get it together. We took my car anyway because that's all they said they were waiting on. But, The headlights are uneven and there are gaps everywhere. There is also still a piece on my car that needed to be replaced from my accident and wasn't. I am extremely unhappy with the service.

Our 2017  Nissan Armada was broken into. Our insurance carrier had us set up with a different shop in Enterprise. We stopped by Professional Body Shop for an estimate and arranged through our insurance carrier to work with them directly to have the repair completed.
Professional Body Shop  met our needs with a quick turn around time and did excellent work!!!
Three days later this same car was backed into. Again, the professional team at Professional Body Shop provided us with an estimate, immediately got our car into the shop and the body work that was completed  was perfectly done.
Thank you for understanding our needs and for providing us with outstanding service!

Where do I start!!!! I took my car there on the 29th of October, and was told it would be done WITHIN 7-9 days, she didn't mention anything about business days. I  Called them 7-9 business days, they have me another date. Called back on the date and I was given another date. Called yesterday and were told  11/16/2018. Anywho, here we are 16th of November and now she"s telling me it'll be far as Tuesday before they're done. Worst place ever!!!!! I wish I would've read the reviews first!!!!
Edit: 11/19/18 I called this morning and the HELP took My Number, but called my Husband Phone, just to tell him it might be Wednesday 11/21. Okay, fine because I'm off on Wednesday, but THEY BETTER NOT TELL ME IT WILL BE AFTER THANKSGIVING#!#!!

name: Raven Red
text: I am very impressed with this company! They did a super job repairing my corvette after I was in an accident. They even have a particular person that specifically handles all of the corvettes that come to the shop. Everyone was kind, helpful and made sure my almost brand new vette was restored back to the original appearance. I highly recommend this company to anyone that needs good body work and paint work....and if you have a sports car, rest easy knowing your expensive ride will be in good hands. Thank you all! This body shop is by far the best in Enterprise.

name: Steven Dickerson
text: I used them because I was told by my insurance company they used them and that they did an outstanding job, the work is yet to be seen… I was told that they would have my minor dent and scratches taken out in 4 days….. Well two weeks later because of the lack of the right parts (they ordered the parts and did not check to ensure the parts were all there when they arrived last week). I was called and told that I could pick up my car in the afternoon, but they called me as I was walking out the door to pick up car they did not have the right parts on hand to deliver the car as quoted on the phone that day. I was then told that I would have to wait for 5 more days because they did not open the box that the ordered parts came in to ensure all the parts were on hand, so they had to re-order the parts and it would take at least another week for the parts to arrive for the installation and completion of my car… think first on using them as your repair shop…. They might do great work, but they quote quick repair times but cannot deliver ….

name: Jack Prewitt
text:
I dont leave many reviews. So take this one for what its worth. PDC has hands down the best customer service I have ever recieved.

From start to finish they were professional and helpful. They gave me a detailed and thorough quote to begin with, clear and concise list of parts and labor provided.

Once the car was dropped off they handled every aspect of the insurance side of the transaction flawlessly. I was updated about my cars progress every tuesday, thursday, or whenever there was a major event. They truly care about your needs as a customer.

However with me what really went above and beyond was when I picked up my vehicle. My radar and sensors were no longer working due to needing recalibration (as far as I could understand) this could only be done at the dealership.

They didnt put me back on a wait list, they didnt ignore the problem. They saw me asap, sat me down, explained the situation, and went as far as scheduling me at the local dealership to fix the problem. Then when the dealership was having trouble, sent thier own tech to help address what was wrong.

The work done was excellent, their service above and beyond, and should I be asked to recommend a body shop for any reason. PDC would be the place.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your review. We really appreciate you choosing us and could not be happier knowing you are satisfied with the work and service provided. Thank you again!

name: Mr GOS
text:
Very nice result on my Mercedes GLK after I had made a horrible attempt to fix damage to my front bumper. It looks like new now! very nice work ☺️

Nice people working here as well and the overall costs turned out being a little cheaper than they estimated when I first brought in the vehicle.

resp.text: Thank you. We are glad you are happy with the work.

name: Stacy Curry
text: I had someone back into my vehicle and needed a body repair shop quick. PDC allowed me to just walk in without an appointment and get everything taken care of. They estimated exactly right for the repairs, and had it done in 4 days. The work included body repair, paint, and they even detailed the inside of the car. The inside looks better than it did when I bought it last year! This company is fantastic, their team is so friendly and bubbly, and they will work hard to make sure that you are taken care of in the best ways possible. This is now my go-to body repair shop.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your review. It is appreciated. We are happy to be able to take care of you. Thank you for sharing!!!

name: Keith Tomlin
text: Kim and Ivan are amazing! They came highly recommended and they did not disappoint. Super nice and very professional.

resp.text: Thank you so much. We really appreciate your review.

name: Stacie Diaz
text: I took my mustang gt in for some dent removal and a full paint. When I got there I was immediately  impressed  with owners. They were both hard at work. The process  was explained very detailed and things were pointed out that I never thought of. A very detailed estimate  was emailed  within  24 hours. Immediately I accepted  and work began a couple  of weeks later. As the repairs were started there were some trouble areas that weren't seen until the prep work. I was immediately called  and informed there was frame damage.  However,  they honor the estimate and did the extra work. It took about  4 weeks and each week I would  receive updates and pictures of the work. When the day come to pick my car up, I didn't  recognize it at first. It was stunning.  From a dark gray  to a glossy black it is absolutely  beautiful.  No dents, pings, scratches..... I could not find 1 imperfection. They detailed  it AND I'm not sure what they did but the plastic  trim even looked refreshed.  Now I'm scared to drive it and it's parked with a cover on it. I highly  recommend  this company. They stand 100 % behind  their  work and will not let me have my car back until it was perfect. And thats how it is.

resp.text: Wow! Thank you for your review. We are truly happy that you are pleased with the work and experience. Thank you for sharing.

I have used PDC two times now and they rock! Two rear end accidents through my insurance and they took care of me every step of the way. The customer service is spot on - super responsive via all mediums, periodic calls to update you on your car and parts being ordered, and just rockstar employees who make a bad situation a little bit better with a smile!

Every time someone asks me for a shop after an accident, I say PDC!

name: ET Development
text: I went there years ago. If it is owned by the same people for a long time, beware! If it has new owners in the past years, ignore this review. Reviews were not available at the time I got ripped off. While I was in flight school, I took in my Porsche to have a complete color change. I picked this shop because they provided the most expensive quote ($3,000 vs. $1,500 of others). It took twice as long. The front emblem was shattered. The sanding marks looked like someone took a brick over the whole car. The owner accused me of 1) Bringing the emblem in shattered, 2) That the car already had brick-like sand marks when it came in (the 4-year old car had not been painted since new and had no accidents). Total waste of $3,000. Get EVERYTHING in writing, take lots of pictures before and after, record the conversations. If I had the time before being stationed 2,000 miles away, I would have loved to sue the POS.

resp.text: We are very sorry to hear you had a bad experience. We are not affiliated  in any way with the previous business that was at this location. PDC Body Works was established in August 2016 and we absolutely care about our customers, how they are treated, and we strive to provide our customers with a great experience with high quality work and complete satisfaction.

name: Mina Shimizu
text: I had a door ding under the passenger mirror. I went to several body shops and collision centers in the Auburn area (where I live) to have the door ding removed with the PDR, but no one wanted to do that because (they said,) "the dent position is bad."  I googled body shops that provide the PDR service in the Montgomery area, and found Southern DENT Solutions. I sent them some photos of the door ding via email. Robbie immediately responded to my email and said he could repair it. I visited his shop next day and waited there for about an hour. Ta-da!! The door ding is COMPLETELY gone!! Thank you so much,  Robbie!! You are a magician.

name: Finley Brewer
text: Southern Dent Solutions is beyond remarkable! I called today to see if they performed work on appliances. My brand new stainless steel finish refrigerator had a small dent and a bit of a crease. Robbie stated he would come to my residence in Montgomery after the auto shop closed in Prattville. He kept me informed of the time he departed and just before arrival at 6:15pm. He and his co-worker diligently worked with their tools to eliminate the dent and crease. The result is  incredible!  I am still amazed there is someone who provides quality same day service and drives a significant distance after work hours to provide the service. Robbie’s workmanship and manners are a rare find in any profession.

resp.text:
Finley,
Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. We appriciate the kind words and the business. text: Scott McClellan only reason your giving a bad review is you bought your own parts to save a dollar, that mechanic or any other mechanic is not responsible to warranty YOUR PART that's the chance you take that is why we mark parts up to cover things like this. The thing your not saying is you drove your truck for a month before the slave cylinder went out and like I said that's your part that went out not his so you a responsible for that repair also the labor cost will have to be took up with the store that sold the part. I've known David and his wife for 20 plus years they are honest and good people I've sent him plenty of customers and they have ALL thanked me and said how good of a job he'd done them. But the funny thing is that in my line of work I visit and talk to just about all the shops in the south Hoover to Montevallo area and you and your wife's name came up a couple of times funny how those guys I spoke with all seemed to remember you having some kinda problem and screaming money back, fix it for free, your just trying to screw me and then the I'll get a lawyer card lol we all love those, cant afford to get your car fixed but can afford a lawyer fee yeah right. Folks these are great people at David's Auto don't believe what one trouble maker puts on here because of their on ignorance.

name: Christopher Godlewski
text: I've had multiple experiences with this shop, and none of them have been good.  I brought my truck in for paint and bodywork; they kept my truck over 4 months!  The paint looked great, but the attention to detail in the bodywork was very poor.  I actually had to pay my regular mechanic to fix the bodywork that they were supposed to have done.  The owner complained about the work repeatedly, making me feel like he was doing me a great favor with my business.  Years later, brought the truck back for some more paint and to have a bunch of scratches buffed out.  Picked up the truck the first time, paint was done, scratches were still there.  Brought it back, showed one of the workers the scratches.  Before coming back to pick it up, I asked the owner if the all the work had been done.  He told me it had; when I came to pick it up, I looked him in the eye and asked if all the scratches were gone.  He said they were - and they weren't.  I called repeatedly to ask when the work would be done and was told they could get around to it whenever his sone was done moving them into a bigger shop.  After months of waiting, I called a few more times and they never would return my phone call.

name: Guy Fawkes
text: I had an excellent experience here.  My wife hit my car when pulling in to park next to me (not her fault, cancer drugs cause pain in her joints and her elbow locked up).  Anyway, she had previously taken her car to another location that did good work, and she wanted to take hers there.  I did so, but that location's quote on my car seemed extravagant.  The damage to my car was minor - nothing they couldn't sand off and repaint.  There was no need to replace the damaged panel.  I took mine to a second place that also wanted to replace the panel.  Finally, I took it to Precision.  Immediately, they said there was no need to replace the panel, and he could buff it out and repaint it.  I saved about 35-40% taking it there due to that, and the work was fantastic - you'd never know there was any damage to it.  So - this place is honest (again, the panel did not need to be replaced and I'm sure the other locations said it did just to up the cost).  And, to top it off, since he had the paint, the owner/operator also touched up a door ding I had from someone else's door slamming into mine in a parking lot.  You can barely notice that now, and he threw that in for free.  Overall, could not be more pleased.  Very good work, good people, oh - and on time as well.... they completed the work as estimated (both the price and time estimate).  Highly recommend.

resp.text: Mr. Fawkes, Thank you for those kind words. We always strive to the the best in our industry in both price and quality.

name: Don Wynn
text: My impression of Precision Body & Paint: nice property, convenient location, well kept, clean waiting room and nice employees. My experience at Precision Body & Paint: I had some minor work done to my truck unsuccessfully. Moreover, there was a 2% surcharge for paying with a CHECK, "Only with cash will there be no additional fee," says Scott, the owner of Precision Body & Paint. I asked Scott, "As a business owner, there is no merchant fee for a check, why do you impose one on your customers? His response: "How am I suppose to know if your check will bounce or not? For the time it takes for me to chase you, the additional fee won't even cover it." Judging by Scott's tone, the owner of Precision Body & Paint does not trust his customers very much. Speaking of which: the work took nearly 3 weeks to "complete," two weeks over Scott's trusted estimate. During that time, Scott did not fix the areas that I had requested. Instead, he would always cut me off mid conversation because he "had a baseball game to run to." This happened three times throughout the three weeks that he had my truck. Regarding the work that Scott did not finish, he promised to refer me to someone else who could but never did. He had me order my own parts, failed to install those parts properly and even charged me extra for installing the parts that he failed to order. My truck has not driven properly since. Scott's business conduct was deficient, abrasive, unethical and condescending. Scott chose to speak down to his customer, fail to complete the work properly in a timely manner and charge an additional 2% fee for paying with a check because the customer did not have a wad of 3Gs in his wallet. Capital One says it best: What's it your wallet? How would you rate Scott, the owner of Precision Body & Paint had YOU been treated this way?

name: Christina Rhodes
text:
Brought my car in for repairs. Let me start off by saying im unsure of my internal repairs. Diagnosis was great. He knew what it was... but when i got my car back and took it on a trip to florida I almost didnt make it back. 3 out of 8 of my coil packs where so lose they could have came off. They also did work on my chain guides and tensioners. 2300$ worth of work. The car jumped timing and had to be towed back.

Update. They did honor their warranty and repaired the work that was done. They got it done quickly. The only guy that gave me a little issue was the front desk guy. But the owner stood by his word. And I respect that. Their are 2 reasons this is not 5 star. And one is the mechanic did not care enough to check what was throwing the new codes. P2004 and P2005. And what i mean by that was just eye balling it to see if it was anything obvious. But it was very simple. The wiring harness in the back was not clipped back into its holder and was blocking the control arms of the actuator from moving properly. Cleared codes and issue is fixed.
The 2nd thing is where my coils were in fact not replaced but the boots were replaced instead of the actual coil packs. It was way cheaper for me to just order all new preformance MSD coil packs (that come with new boots) . If anyone would like to buy my coil boots please hit me up. They are barely used and i have no need for rubber coil boots.

Over all glad to have my Mustang GT back.

text: I took a 2010 Mercedes E class in to install a small piece of plastic on the front bumper. I purchased an aftermarket piece and was told it would not fit my car. Apparently they had the correct piece in the back, and I asked if I could use it. The next day I came to pickup the aftermarket part and these Einstein’s had painted it without my consent. They blamed it on a misunderstanding. After forgiving them for their mistake and the $40 I just lost on that piece. I then said to the owner “I can’t wait to put this piece of plastic on my mantle. It reminds me not to take shortcuts”. This struck a nerve of the insecure butt-hurt owner. I allowed them to procure the correct part and install it. After retrieving my car, paying $250 (2in x 2in piece), and promising never to return, I get in my car and crank it up. I notice my right headlight is pointing at a different angle. I bring this to the attention of the “owner” and he doesn’t even get up to check out my car. Buyer beware

Two weeks after getting my car back, my newly replaced bumper started falling off. My paint started chipping off. I have two dents on both sides of my car from which their tow truck caused. Very sloppy work. Save yourself your money and the headache.  Had I have an older car, I would not have been upset, however since my car is fairly new, being upset is a understatement. I will not be back.

name: James Payne
text:
My late father really should be making this review but I doubt they get any Google products or services in Heaven. Anyway, over the years, mom and dad have had a statistically higher than average number of fender benders, (Passenger side door skins more to the point) and each and every time Jacksonville Body Shop has come thru for the Win! Consistently beating other local body shops by sometimes as much as $500 for the same work, it's hard to beat them unless you're trying to pull a fast one on your insurance agency and need a fatly padded quote, just a joke folks, chillax!
The quality of work is exemplary, and Dad was a hard guy to please. The most recent door skin incident took place after Dad's departure so I took care of the leg work for Mom. I picked the car up on the scheduled date. It was washed, vacuumed, shining like a new penny. All the gaps between panels were consistent and parallel and the color matching was spot on.
I hope you never need the services of a body shop,  but if you do, I highly recommend the folks at Jacksonville Body Shop.

text: Action Collision is the best body shop I've ever used. In fact, I drove 50+ miles to get them to do the repair work on my car because their work and professionalism is outstanding. Always quality work. Nothing missing, everything works, and service after pick up.  I couldn't ask for me.

name: Joseph Czabaranek
text: My ‘98 4Runner was hit by another vehicle. The radiator support, wheel well, fender, and bumper were bent pretty bad.  I didn’t have collision insurance so Action was willing to straighten it out well enough so I could put a new fender and off-road bumper on without insisting on completely replacing the radiator support.  They even installed some of the parts I brought in, and provided a few parts without charging me.  It looks great, one day and $100 less than they estimated, and they saved me $2-3k.

text: 2nd time doing business with Action Collision.  First time i had an unfortunate incident with my Mustang where a empty palette was leaning up against the fence, fell over onto the side of the car. Repairs were done and paint match was perfect 👌 I looked around town for someone to repair shipping damage on my wife's motorcycle, why not Action i thought! Very satisfied with the results and my wife is happy again.😀

text: Went to action Collision in December a deer hit my car I went to got it painted in September this will happen the pain start peeling up then they supposed to fix my door but the window stopped working they put a new window switch in you the switch was broke then exploding fix my AC but it's still doing the same thing so if I were you I wouldn't recommend nobody to go to action Collision I won't even give them one star action Collision do sneaky things behind good customers backs they call my insurance company to try to make my insurance company pay for something that I already paid for without me knowing that's bad business so if I were you I would never go to action Collision I rather go a bootleg paint shop that's basically why I went in the first place

name: Tom Fitzpatrick
text: Action Collision is a top-notch group.  We have a 2007 Saturn Sky Turbo that was, inadvertently, damaged while getting new tires at PepBoys.
